story:
Short Summary

  • My name is James Kelly. I am a self-published author with two new books scheduled for release this year. I previously hosted "Aspects of Writing" on KLAV 12.30 AM in Las Vegas, Nevada for three years. The network was purchased by a Lotus broadcasting in April 2015. Once the takeover was completed, KLAV flipped to a regional Mexican format as La Caliente.
  • Our goal is to offer a fun and informative show where authors and writers from every genre can showcase their work, while at the same time offer advice that is beneficial to up and coming writers. I created the show to discuss the various aspects of writing, publishing, and promotion methods that can often seem overwhelming to the novice writer.
  • Your donation will help to support the show while we create and grow this long-term project. Our monthly costs include advertising and promotion, plus web hosting and bandwidth for the broadcast. We have already created our own studio from which to record and broadcast the show.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We believe our goal of $1000 will position us for immediate success and sustainability while we seek corporate sponsorship.
  • We do not charge our guests to be on the show. Therefore, your contribution is greatly appreciated. Your contribution tells us that you truly believe in the validity and necessity of this broadcast.
  • Previously, I personally funded "Aspects of Writing" in its entirety. However, production cost, studio cost, advertising and promotion (social media) can become very expensive. This time it is my intention to launch the project with the ultimate goal of taking the show national. Recently we signed with amfm247.com, which broadcasts live on the worldwide web on Friday's at 6 PM (PST) and 9 PM (EST). We are hoping to raise the funds necessary to take the show live on ROKU Television, Tunein Radio, and Livestream. As a member of amfm247.com the upgrade would be instant. VosCast, and hopefully 840 AM in Las Vegas are also a goal for the very near future. This would give us nationwide and worldwide coverage, reaching millions of listeners.

The Impact

  • Your contribution helps to maintain free advice for anyone contemplating writing, publishing, or marketing their work. Anyone who has published a book, written a play, or composed a piece of music, understands that the creation aspects of writing is a small percentage of what it takes to get your work before the public to enjoy. The hardest part begins after the work is completed.
  • I recall the fear I had when I created and produced "Aspects of Writing" for the first time. Three years later, I am constantly reminded of the success and true purpose of this venture when I see the pride in first time authors, who appeared on the show, having pursued and achieved their dream of becoming a published author. 
  • Every penny acquired will be used to enhance a fun, informative, encouraging and uplifting show that can change a writer from a dreamer to an achiever.

Risks & Challenges

  • There very little risk in putting this show together since we are already on the air. We just need to expand.
  • The biggest hurdle for me to overcome has been nerves. The first time on the air, I believe I hyperventilated. Thank goodness for the guests that night who pulled me through. I now treat the show as a living room.
  • I always tell my guests to just focus on the conversation, and that it is just us sitting around the room discussing our trials and tribulations – as well as our joys - about the writing industry. It really creates a fun, and sometimes funny atmosphere.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot contribute, please let a fellow author know about our project.
  • You can share this project using social media or by sharing the link to this website.

And that's all there is to it.

There very little risk in putting this show together since we are already on the air. We just need to expand.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please let a fellow author know about our project.
You can share this project using social media or by sharing the link to this website.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Give less f*cks, live more life

Women not giving a f*ck means we decide what to care about. We decide what our priorities are. It means we can be mentally, spiritually, and emotionally free to live our lives as we choose. Women not giving a f*ck means we are unapologetic for being our bad-ass selves!

Since October 2017, I’ve taught over 700 women in the San Francisco Bay Area how to not give a f*ck. The impact has been incredible. The core teachings of my workshop help women to immediately implement strategies that:

  • Prevent Compassion Fatigue
  • Address Invisible Labor 
  • Avoid Burnout in Their Profession
  • Reinforce the Right to Set Boundaries
  • Effectively Counter Gaslighting
  • Build Intersectional Solidarity

This work changes women’s lives. It liberates. And it's too important to be limited to the women of the Bay Area. That's why I need your support to take this work worldwide.

As of April 5th, I am readjusting the funding goals to a more realistic sense of what my networks and community can handle. It was an edgy ask for me to begin with, and now I feel some ick for not staying with my gut.

If $8,000 is raised, I can keep working on the book and do a few out of area workshops.

If we can get to $10,000, parts of the workshop tour will happen! 
If we can get to $15,000 then I can start the podcast!
If we can get to $20,000, I make the online courses and webinars!
If we can get to $25,000 the whole workshop tour is ALIVE!

Learning in public is not an easy thing to do, but part of what I teach is to live our truths unapologetically and ask for support. I'm shifting on the fly and trying not to get stuck in the shame of publicly making a miscalculation. I went too big in my funding goal and now I'm course correcting.

I’ve been invited by 25 cities across North America to bring this powerful work to their communities. I'm developing a podcast, and a book proposal is also in the works, so this particular form of liberation can be accessed anywhere.

With everyone’s support, we can help reach women all over the world who want to be freed from the social conditioning—and the social conditions—that limit our power and efficacy. None of us can create change alone. Will you join me?

Why Women Give a F*ck and Why it’s a Problem

First, let me be clear—when I say that I work with women, I mean that I work with all women, including trans women, genderqueer, and non-binary femmes, and folks who are femme of center. The podcast, the book, and workshops rest on the concept of intersectional feminism. We can only be effective allies to one another by recognizing distinct barriers that certain groups of women face, and the right of all women to have access to their inner authority.

All women are constantly threatened by gender bias, sexual harassment, sexism, violence, and economic inequality. When we express dissatisfaction with the status quo, we're told that we have a personal issue—as if we’re responsible for harm being inflicted upon us. If we just cared a little more, if we were just a little more confident, if we were just a little more accommodating, none of these bad things would happen, right?

Hell no! Gender bias and discrimination are NOT the psychological problems of the women they oppress! Misogyny and sexual harassment are sociological phenomena, not psychological, and therefore require a sociological solution.

Please support this campaign, and please urge others to support it. Take a moment right now to choose and commit to a level of support, and then share it with your network. Then follow up with those people so that they get on board! This is too important to all of us to leave it to casual reminders. Make sure women know that we can free ourselves by saying no to trying to solve a sociological problem with a psychological response. Your donation will create a resource that women are asking for right now.

Dismantling the Old Advice Models

A lot of the "advice" out there teaches women that "empowerment" is successfully getting along in a world designed to benefit men, to the disadvantage of women. It feeds on women feeling inadequate or like there's something wrong with them.

How To Be A Woman & NGAF says f*ck that!

No more molding ourselves into the dysfunctional and limited roles expected of us. No more "self-help" that preys on women's vulnerabilities or capitalizes on unhealthy status quo boundaries.

My workshops help women learn to recognize how the forces of oppression constrain their choices in sometimes invisible ways—and then we help them exercise the power they already had to give the f*cks they want to be giving.

The Solution

Media is an incredibly important platform for resistance. I'm committed to developing a podcast, a national workshop tour, a book and an interactive website to deliver this information to women who are ready to not give a f*ck—all to help women everywhere fully embrace that we don’t have to keep absorbing and internalizing these toxic societal messages and expectations. 

Everyone needs access to media made by women who are giving less f*cks and as a result are living more life. We all benefit from stories that accurately reflect both the diversity of women’s experiences and the shared ground of misogyny and sexism.

If we're successful, it will mean that women can do less invisible labor.

Women will endure less gaslighting, be safer in the workplace, and it will mean that fewer people of all genders will put up with racist and sexist bullsh*t.

We start by not giving a f*ck about the status quo. There's no shame in acknowledging our limitations and using self acceptance to strengthen our resolve. Do this for you, be a woman who doesn’t give a f*ck.


Here's what this campaign is raising funds for:

THE WORKSHOP TOUR - $40,000, Summer - Fall 2018  

North American tour. The workshops are  fully interactive, somatic, immersive experiences where women are able to really explore the f*cks they don’t want to give. In groups ranging from 12 to 40, women get to experience solidarity. We actively practice having each other’s backs. Everything we bring into the workshop is accounting for the differences that different women experience. In a white supremacist society, being explicitly anti-racist is the biggest f*ck you to the status quo.

So far, across North America women have asked me to bring this workshop to their communities. The invitation comes from feminist bookstores, community organizers, and moms offering to host the workshop in their living rooms.

Buy a VIP ticket to a How To Be A Woman & NGAF Workshop in your city. Give a workshop ticket as a gift. Sponsor an entire workshop on behalf of other women. Don’t see your city? Message us!

THE PODCAST - $5000

From the very first workshop that filled up in minutes, women have been asking me “What’s your podcast? Where can I find your podcast?”

A very good question, because I didn’t (yet!) have one. That’s about to change. I’m partnering with a feminist, professional public radio producer to create a show that is informative, funny, engaging, and empowering—and that will help you learn how not to give a f*ck. We’ll be amplifying the diverse voices of incredible women who have rich stories to tell and meaningful insights to share. You will not want to miss a single episode. The ultimate goal is to monetize the show so that it become self-sustaining. But we need you to help us get the first season off the ground!

 

THE WEBSITE - $35,000 Re-launching with online course offerings Fall 2018

After the very first How to Be a Woman and NGAF workshop I realized how important this curriculum was and crossed my fingers that I could buy a domain that conveyed what was happening. I was shocked (shocked I tell you!) that www.howtobeawomanandnotgiveafuck.com was available. I snatched it up and an online presence was born.

Now, it's time to move beyond presence to resource. The funds raised here will pay for a web developer and for the production of video courses and webinars. By Fall of 2018 we will be relaunching the website optimized for online coaching and learning with a community of contributing writers and more advanced versions of How to Be a Woman & NGAF materials. The website will feature new writing and resources from many different women who don’t give a f*ck. Plus, a whole catalogue of interactive courses and webinars for everyone.

THE BOOK - $20,000, Research and Development 2018 -19, Publication Summer 2019

This is information every woman needs—and I want to share it in one of the most accessible formats. The book will be a resource that you can turn to again and again, and give as a gift to the women in your life who really need to give less f*cks. Solidarity means intersectionality. I will be interviewing women on the road to collect diverse stories of women learning how to not give a f*ck. This book is both a resource guide and a celebration. I’ll tell my own story, along with those of a dozen other women, about how not giving a f*ck about the status quo liberates and sustains us. This money will go towards both the time to write as well as the funds to hire an editor.

The Team Making This Happen

Airial Clark, Founder How to be a Woman & NGAF

Airial Clark was raised by women who believe in women. As a single, Queer parent she's raised men who believe in women. She believes in you too. Her therapist is still amused that Airial teaches women how to not give a f*ck because, "Airial you give so many f*cks about so many people!" While this is true, Airial knows she can give the f*cks she gives because there are so many f*cks she's refusing. 

Tessa Levine, How to be a Woman & NGAF Campaign Communications and Workshop Assistant

Tessa Levine is a community organizer and digital strategist. She is committed to fighting injustice on all fronts because the personal is f*cking political. Also proudly woo AF.

Courtney King, How to be a Woman & NGAF Tour Logistics

Courtney King, founder and principal of C. King Solutions is a professional organizer with a cracked sense of humor, a cheerful disposition, and the determination to make things better. No worries, we can do this.

We Have To Do This Together

You are officially invited to join us in not giving a f*ck.

One of our favorite ways to express my f*cks is through where we direct our money. This is your opportunity to be a part of a movement.

Not automatically giving a f*ck means you are able to choose when you give f*cks and what f*cks you give. It means rejecting sexism. It means rejecting racism. It means we don't wear ourselves the f*ck out trying to please other people, including people who aren’t in our lives and people we don’t even know! We achieve balance. And we can’t do it alone.

Please support this campaign, and please urge others to support it.

You’re supporting media and community workshops created for women by women. Work that celebrates women being seen for who we really are and makes visible what we’re actually contending with. Do this for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially at this time, please help us by sharing the campaign. 

Use the hashtag #H2BWNGAF and let other people know what this resource means to you!

story:
Short Summary

Artificial is a podcast about a human and a robot learning about the world. It follows the progression of a relationship between comedian Ana-Marija Stojic and her new  co-host, a real functioning Artificial Intelligence robot. The two work on building a podcast together by meeting up for coffee, having late night cram sessions and asking comedians and industry experts for their thoughts over burritos and binary.

This is a half documentary narrative half debate series that follows the relationship between a human and a robot: from their first meeting to their final day in studio as co-hosts when they find out that one of them might be replaced: will the studio execs replace the machine with another machine or the human with another human (or mix and match while they’re already at it)? 

www.andthemachine.com
 

About us

ABOUT ANA-MARIJA STOJIC (COMEDIAN/COHOST):
www.anamarijastojic.com

Originally from Yugoslavia, Ana-Marija is living in Toronto doing comedy all over the city. She can be seen regularly at The Comedy Bar and the ALTdot Comedy Lounge.  Ana-Marija was in the Sirius XM's Next Top Comic Finals in 2017, a semi-finalist in the Seattle International Comedy Competition 2017 and a finalist in Absolute Comedy's Prove You're a Comic 2017.

Credits include: JFL42 2017, All Jane Festival 2017, Crom Comedy Festival 2017, Breakout Comedian of the Year IHJ Nominee 2018.

ABOUT GOOD ROBOT (CREATORS OF THE MACHINE): 
www.goodrobot.com

The past few years have seen huge advancements in the development and availability of small, fast microprocessors and sensors; an explosion in flexible, scalable computation and storage; the proliferation of highspeed, reliable networks; the evolution of big-data and AI-based predictive analytics; the arrival of blockchain and smart contracts; and the ubiquity of personal devices. All of these are elements create new opportunities to enhance operational efficiency, catalyze innovation, and engage customers.

Over the past seven years, Good Robot has experienced the birth and growth of many new technologies first hand. Our clients range from startups that require prototyping services to enterprises who need assistance with research or market entry. What they all have in common is a commitment to innovation and the recognition  that emerging technologies can and will benefit their organizations.

ABOUT EGGPLANT (TECHNICAL PRODUCER): 
www.eggplantps.com 

We are a boutique post­-production facility that has grown into a robust full­-service 4K compliant creative studio covering video and audio post, motion graphics, animation, VFX and 360/VR. Eggplant Picture & Sound, located downtown in the heart of Toronto’s production community, is one of Canada’s leading Post Production facilities offering best-in-class talent, creativity and the most advanced technologies. As a sought-after specialty post company since it was established in 1996, Eggplant Picture & Sound is a unique and dynamic destination, offering a vital combination of video, audio, motion graphics, animation and VFX, all in one vibrant and convenient location. Providing full-service or an à la carte menu of media solutions for producers, broadcasters, marketers and advertisers, Eggplant Picture & Sound services feature film, factual and scripted genres, as well as broadcast and digital advertising. Our proven comprehensive Optimized Digital Production Workflow is an industry driven standard and delivers maximum efficiency for our clients adhering to all cinematic, broadcast specifications and digital deliverables. The result is a premiere destination for collective talent and technology where workflow and creativity flourish in an efficient, seamless and innovative post and media solutions environment. Artificial will be part of a larger roster of content being produced out of our space.


ABOUT AKIM MILNE (PRODUCER OF THE PODCAST): 
www.storymasters.ca

AKIM MILNE (PRODUCER):
Akim is currently working as a Producer/ Editor for a digital content firm called Storymasters Communications. He is in the process of finishing his Master’s at York University in cinema and media studies. In addition to his work in film, he co-directs a youth musical theatre troupe called Spirit Express. Awards include: 3 Internet Advertising Competition Awards (2018): Best Employment Online Video Campaign, Best Bank Online Video, Best Employment Online Video


ALAN MAJER (FOUNDER OF GOOD ROBOT):
Alan Majer is the founder of Good Robot. For the first half of his career, Alan worked as a technology researcher and writer, helping to identify cutting edge technology and business innovations. Today, Alan also works with new technologies hands on, exploring the potential of blockchain, AI and machine intelligence, robotics, and connected sensors. The result is exciting new opportunities to innovate and transform business processes, and the ability to combine strategy and research activities with a real-world approach to their implementation. personal devices. All of these are elements create new opportunities to enhance operational efficiency, catalyze innovation, and engage customers. 

Over the past seven years, Good Robot has experienced the birth and growth of many new technologies first hand. Our clients range from startups that require prototyping services to enterprises who need assistance with research or market entry. What they all have in common is a commitment to innovation and the recognition that emerging technologies can and will benefit their organizations. 

Where your money goes

The money funded goes to the building and maintenance of the AI robot. Below is the breakdown. In order to comply with our NDA agreement and protect IP the breakdown is not explicit, however backers can request more detailed breakdowns.

Show development: $500
Hardware: $2,500
Software: $3,000

The machine will be constructed with a combination of text to speech and AI programming that require hardware and software development and maintenance.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Artificial is a podcast about a human and a robot learning about the world. It follows the progression of a relationship between comedian Ana-Marija Stojic and her new  co-host, a real functioning Artificial Intelligence robot. The two work on building a podcast together by meeting up for coffee, having late night cram sessions and asking comedians and industry experts for their thoughts over burritos and binary.
This is a half documentary narrative half debate series that follows the relationship between a human and a robot: from their first meeting to their final day in studio as co-hosts when they find out that one of them might be replaced: will the studio execs replace the machine with another machine or the human with another human (or mix and match while they’re already at it)? www.andthemachine.com 

About us
ABOUT ANA-MARIJA STOJIC (COMEDIAN/COHOST):www.anamarijastojic.com
Originally from Yugoslavia, Ana-Marija is living in Toronto doing comedy all over the city. She can be seen regularly at The Comedy Bar and the ALTdot Comedy Lounge.  Ana-Marija was in the Sirius XM's Next Top Comic Finals in 2017, a semi-finalist in the Seattle International Comedy Competition 2017 and a finalist in Absolute Comedy's Prove You're a Comic 2017.Credits include: JFL42 2017, All Jane Festival 2017, Crom Comedy Festival 2017, Breakout Comedian of the Year IHJ Nominee 2018.
ABOUT GOOD ROBOT (CREATORS OF THE MACHINE): www.goodrobot.comThe past few years have seen huge advancements in the development and availability of small, fast microprocessors and sensors; an explosion in flexible, scalable computation and storage; the proliferation of highspeed, reliable networks; the evolution of big-data and AI-based predictive analytics; the arrival of blockchain and smart contracts; and the ubiquity of personal devices. All of these are elements create new opportunities to enhance operational efficiency, catalyze innovation, and engage customers.Over the past seven years, Good Robot has experienced the birth and growth of many new technologies first hand. Our clients range from startups that require prototyping services to enterprises who need assistance with research or market entry. What they all have in common is a commitment to innovation and the recognition  that emerging technologies can and will benefit their organizations.ABOUT EGGPLANT (TECHNICAL PRODUCER): www.eggplantps.com We are a boutique post­-production facility that has grown into a robust full­-service 4K compliant creative studio covering video and audio post, motion graphics, animation, VFX and 360/VR. Eggplant Picture & Sound, located downtown in the heart of Toronto’s production community, is one of Canada’s leading Post Production facilities offering best-in-class talent, creativity and the most advanced technologies. As a sought-after specialty post company since it was established in 1996, Eggplant Picture & Sound is a unique and dynamic destination, offering a vital combination of video, audio, motion graphics, animation and VFX, all in one vibrant and convenient location. Providing full-service or an à la carte menu of media solutions for producers, broadcasters, marketers and advertisers, Eggplant Picture & Sound services feature film, factual and scripted genres, as well as broadcast and digital advertising. Our proven comprehensive Optimized Digital Production Workflow is an industry driven standard and delivers maximum efficiency for our clients adhering to all cinematic, broadcast specifications and digital deliverables. The result is a premiere destination for collective talent and technology where workflow and creativity flourish in an efficient, seamless and innovative post and media solutions environment. Artificial will be part of a larger roster of content being produced out of our space.
ABOUT AKIM MILNE (PRODUCER OF THE PODCAST): www.storymasters.ca
AKIM MILNE (PRODUCER):Akim is currently working as a Producer/ Editor for a digital content firm called Storymasters Communications. He is in the process of finishing his Master’s at York University in cinema and media studies. In addition to his work in film, he co-directs a youth musical theatre troupe called Spirit Express. story:
What exactly is this project?

We love holding this podcast marathon!  It’s an all out celebration of podcasts and geekdom  which is a blast for fans and podcasters alike.  This year marks our third annual marathon and we hope to it make it the best one yet.  Both previous marathons played to packed houses and featured 20+ podcasts and acts performing live at the Blue Box Café in Elgin, IL.  In 2016 we added on online element and streamed the event on YouTube live. We also had a live concurrent marathon on our YouTube channel featuring even more podcasts that couldn’t make it to Elgin.  As soon as the event ended attendees and participants alike started asking us when the next one will be.  We now have an answer: October 7, 2017.

Even though the marathon is free to attend, there are costs involved and we need help.  This year we are hiring a popular artist to create the poster.  The artist and the printing of the posters cost money.  Flyers and press kits cost money.  We would love to hire PR to help us spread the word.  This costs money as well.  This is why we are holding this IndieGogo.  We need funds to spread the word and make this the best experience yet. 

When is it? 

Oct 7, 2017 8:00am to 9:00pm CST. These times apply to the event at the Blue Box Café and to the streaming marathon that will be on YouTube Live.

Who are we?

We’re a diverse group of podcasters and content creators that want nothing more than to entertain and connect with fans. Some of the media groups involved are Golden Spiral, Too Much Scrolling, League of Geekz, as well as a number of independent shows and artists. Rob Southgate and Martha Southgate, co-owners and executive producers of Southgate Media Group, are producing this event. Together, they have also produced and performed live podcasts at the Blue Box for the past three and a half years.

Why an Indiegogo Campaign?

Your support will give us the funds to promote the event including, T-Shirts, posters, flyers, PR and more.  If we go over this amount we have 4 stretch goals to get us two GoPros, a lighting package, and wireless mics to improve the quality of our streaming video. Your help allows us to produce a more professional event. 

How else can you help?

Spread the word. Share this campaign. Tell your friends, co-workers, families, really anyone who loves podcasts or wants to support experimental forms of entertainment. Share this on social media or get a bullhorn and stand on a corner. 

Thanks for supporting us!

Follow SMG Podcast Marathon on Facebook and Twitter for the latest updates and lineup changes.

Risks and challenges

No risks here. The marathon will go on no matter what. Having the funds will simply make the event better. Every dime brought in from this Indiegogo will go toward improving the event.

story:
What's up,  Beloveds!

I'm Jae Tafari from Kansas City, and we are now relocated in the beautiful state of Colorado!

I am a first-generation Jamaican American multicultural performing activist, producer, writer, mother and spiritual partner.  I'm also a survivor of childhood trauma. It took me 20 years to discover the many wounds that never healed, and I had extreme depression/anxiety to prove it. I believe this is a byproduct of the miseducation of conscious love.

Did you know that according to the American Psychological Association, 50% of Americans will encounter at least one traumatic experience in their lifetime. 8% of them will experience Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), and women are twice as likely to develop PTSD (http://www.apa.org/advocacy/interpersonal-viole...).

The Journal of National Medical Association reported that out of 617 patients who sought medical treatment for trauma, 96% of them were African American and 65% of them reported that they'd been through at least one traumatic experience. When searching for treatment, an article from the Department of Counseling and Clinical Psychology considered  it more likely for Black Americans to drop out of treatment pre-maturely if they: A) met with someone outside of their race, B) felt disrespected or misunderstood, C) couldn’t afford the expenses.

        "USA Today" released an article in February of this year that out of 843 surveys, 94% of women in the entertainment industry stated that they were sexually harassed or witnessed harassment to their female colleagues. 65% admitted to never vocalizing their co-workers’ advancement due to sexual acts, and 21% were forced to perform sexual activities (https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2018...).

        When you look at the trauma in our world, Who gets the chance to speak up about it, let alone heal from it? Not many. Especially not women.

So on August 31, 2018 “indiFEM.Dialogues w/ Sisters of Culture, Healing & FAME”  is coming right into your comfy homes!  

With your support, we can finally give voice to our stories, celebrate our experiences and treat ourselves to the remedies of quality living! 

We want YOU to be a part this indiFEM.Movement, too! After all, there is no "US" without "U."

Help us raise $14,400 to fund our talk show for one year! Your contribution will be invested into our Interface Logistics & Production Flow:

a.       Copyrights

b.       Trademarks

c.       Tax ID

d.       Education

e.       Lawyers

f.        Equipment

g.       Studio space/Time

h.        Content Creativity

i.         Program Design

j.         Manual Labor

Our Team

We’re a family of love warriors, and we believe in the power of collective conscious creativity.

I’m the Producer/Host/Content Creator/Interviewer/Bookings Director/Editor/Media Manager and Founder of the show, but I can’t do it alone. With the guidance of the Harmonious Eternal Loving Presence (HELP), my mentor and the founder of Females of Arts, Music & Entertainment (F.A.M.E.) - Roz, and the sisters of culture & healing, (Lisa Lola Healing Arts), (Yoga w/ Kiara), (Nettle+Honey), (iNity Home Health), we are blessed w/ the wisdom & strength to heal the heart of a woman & the soul of mankind.

Many of you know that I'm a full-time mother, and the last thing I want is to spread myself so thin, that I produce low quality work - all around the board. I want to be present and fun with Indigo, not drained or cranky. I want to excel in my Bliss Work, not half-ass my way through this amazing life experience. 

With the funding for "indiFEM.Dialogues" I have the chance to join forces with the top leaders, healers, and teachers to raise the level of consciousness across our communities and improve the statistics shown above.

Please, help us give this platform for our sisters of culture, healing & FAME the exposure it deserves!

Perks

Don’t leave empty handed when you donate to our “indiFEM.Dialogues” Indiegogo campaign. Treat yourself to any or all of our perks! Check ‘em out & stay in the flow with our sisters of culture, healing & FAME:

-         Hand-Crafted FEM REMs Herbal Care Products

-        First-Look Sneak Peaks inside upcoming Books By Jae

-        Sponsorship Benefits

and more!!!

Even if we don't hit our entire goal, the show must go on!  We'll use every penny to give you the kind of show that we've been waiting for: REAL CONVERSATIONS WITH REAL WOMEN WHO ARE MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN THIS WORLD!

The Impact

As a mixed woman, a mother, an artist and a survivor of trauma, this platform is HUGE! I have spent my entire life looking for a place to not just fit in, but to actually belong. I've made so many mistakes and needed some safe, non-judgmental comfort. I've been confused and ashamed most of my life and never spoke up about it; let alone heard another story like mine.

Once I finally gave my story a chance - 6 years ago - I knew I had begun my healing journey. This soul cleansing journey has lead me out of some of the darkest hours of my life that allowed me to understand, re-direct and forgive. 

All I hope for is the chance to offer this same journey to you. No matter your race, gender, occupation or experience, you belong here, and your story matters. 

Risks & Challenges

No journey is perfect. Our dreams don't always come true exactly as we envision, but that doesn't mean it's not part of the Divine Agenda.

"indiFEM.Dialogues" is an investment in our future. We may not see everlasting results immediately, or perhaps in our lifetime. 

"The true meaning of life is to plant trees, under whose shade you do not expect to sit." -Nelson Henderson

I am a believer and a love warrior - as Glennon Doyle Melton so beautifully phrases. I trust in the Divine Agenda, for it has proven to me time and time again that all good things are made possible.

Nelson Mandela says, "It always seems impossible until it's done."

We may encounter some resistance from people who do not understand the value in this movement. Not everyone has the courage to step into vulnerability, and not everyone wants to transform. There are risks to every choice we make, but to take risks is to live freely, fully and deeply. 

"Seek patience and passion in equal amounts. Patience alone will not build the temple. Passion alone will destroy its walls." -Maya Angelou

This is the beginning of something great! Each day a new seed will be planted.

My mission is to use my gifts to heal the heart of a woman and the soul of mankind; starting within, one step at a time. 

Thy will be done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please, get the word out and make some noise about "indiFEM.Dialogues"!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools on all of your social media, and let's give our sisters of culture, healing & FAME their voices back!

And that's all there is to it.

 

"It takes a village to raise a child. It takes a globe to transform a generation. We need YOU." -Melita irie Muzik

Thank you so much for your invaluable space.

Peace & Love,

Jae Tafari

Jae’i Tafari International

Founder of Melita irie Muzik

Host of "indiFEM.Dialogues w/ Sisters of Culture, Healing & FAME"

 

~~Connect~~

Media Consulting >> http://www.facebook.com/melitairiemuzik

“Life as MelitaME” Blog>> http://melitame.tumblr.com

Instagram: @JaeTafari >>http://www.instagram.com/jaetafari

Bookings: Melita.irie.Muzik@gmail.com

Artist Development Programs: GiftedRemedies@gmail.com

Talk Show/Herbal Care/Retreats: indiFEM@outlook.com

story:
Hvis du missede vores crowdfunding kampagne, men stadig gerne vil være medlem, så skriv til medlem@seinmag.dk at du gerne vil meldes ind, så kontakter vi dig omkring oprettelse så snart vores medlemslogin lanceres på www.seinmag.dk i starten af december.

 

Tusind tak for jeres støtte!!! <3 <3 <3 

_________________________________________________________________________________

 

Hvad er SEIN?

Vi har skabt SEIN ud af en frustration over at blive talt om og til af de etablerede medier, men aldrig talt med. Vi har skabt SEIN for at have en platform for 15-25 årige, hvor vi selv definerer, hvad der skal tales om, og hvordan det skal tales om. 

Se vores flotte webmagasin

På SEIN skaber vi tekst, lyd og visuelle fortællinger, der være noget så forskelligt som en

  • Tekst om ufoer i Kolding
  • En animeret tegneserie om Freyas smerter i livmoderen
  • En podcast om at være splittet mellem drømme
  • En fotoserie om at vokse op på Vestbredden

Vi er fem redaktioner med tilsammen flere end 100 frivillige producenter, så der alle hverdage, hele året rundt, kommer noget nyt på SEINs hjemmeside.

SEIN er også

et fællesskab, hvor vi møder hinanden i virkeligheden gennem events, talks, filmfremvisninger, workshops, fester og åbne redaktionsmøder. F.eks. har vi lavet

  • Tosomhedsevent i Det Kongelige Teater
  • Udstilling af Kibbutz-serien i U-kirken i Århus
  • Filmfremvisning i Grand Teatret


På to år har vi ​

  • udgivet 488 indlæg
  • afholdt 39 events
  • haft mere end 1 million sidevisninger
  • mere end 100.000 brugere 
     

Hvad har SEIN brug for, og hvordan kan jeg hjælpe?

Vi har brug for 250.000 kroner og 2000 medlemmer inden jul for at kunne fortsætte SEIN. Indtil nu har vi overlevet på støtte fra fonde og donorer, men ansøgningsprocesserne er enormt tidskrævende og resultaterne for usikre. For at SEIN skal kunne blive ved med at være det mest vedkommende, dækkende og ærlige medietilbud til de 15-25 årige er vi nødt til at være økonomisk selvstændige. 

Pengene skal bruges til:

  • Husleje
  • Udvikling af hjemmeside
  • Oprette medlemslogin
  • Beskeden aflønning af dem, der bruger al deres tid på SEIN. 

 

Hvad får jeg ud af det?

Du kan støtte, med hvad du har lyst til, men vi har sammensat nogle pakker, hvor du enten kan få nogle flotte sokker, en mulepose, t-shirt eller sweatshirt med som tak. Du har også mulighed for at købe forskellige events og workshops af os.

 

Men... Hvis SEIN er gratis, hvorfor skal jeg så blive medlem?

Vi laver de mest vedkommende, hudløse og ærlige fortællinger for unge mennesker i Danmark, og det synes vi, at alle skal have adgang til uanset indtægt. Derfor vil alt indhold på SEIN fortsat være gratis. Det er også derfor, vi kalder jer for medlemmer og ikke abonnenter; og som medlem af SEIN får du:

  • Gratis adgang til et hav af spændende, sjove, lærerige og hyggelige events (Ikke-medlemmer kan også deltage, såfremt de køber en billet eller et medlemsskab af SEIN)
  • Et nyhedsbrev med information om nye projekter, events og forandringer samt eksklusive anbefalinger fra de forskellige redaktioner.
  • Et månedligt åbent redaktionsmøde i både Århus og København, hvor SEINs medlemmer kan komme og få direkte indflydelse på SEINs indhold samt et oplæg af forskellige, spændende folk
  • En SEIN-hotline. I to timer hver mandag sidder SEIN klar til at tage telefonen og snakke om lige præcis det, du har lyst til. Har du spørgsmål, forslag, idéer, eller keder du dig bare? Så ring!
  • Mulighed for at være passivt et medlem, der blot gerne vil give en skilling til et godt formål.
story_txt:
Hvis du missede vores crowdfunding kampagne, men stadig gerne vil være medlem, så skriv til medlem@seinmag.dk at du gerne vil meldes ind, så kontakter vi dig omkring oprettelse så snart vores medlemslogin lanceres på www.seinmag.dk i starten af december.
 
Tusind tak for jeres støtte!!! <3 <3 <3 
_________________________________________________________________________________
 
Hvad er SEIN?
Vi har skabt SEIN ud af en frustration over at blive talt om og til af de etablerede medier, men aldrig talt med. Vi har skabt SEIN for at have en platform for 15-25 årige, hvor vi selv definerer, hvad der skal tales om, og hvordan det skal tales om. 
Se vores flotte webmagasin
På SEIN skaber vi tekst, lyd og visuelle fortællinger, der være noget så forskelligt som en

Tekst om ufoer i Kolding
En animeret tegneserie om Freyas smerter i livmoderen
En podcast om at være splittet mellem drømme
En fotoserie om at vokse op på Vestbredden

Vi er fem redaktioner med tilsammen flere end 100 frivillige producenter, så der alle hverdage, hele året rundt, kommer noget nyt på SEINs hjemmeside.
SEIN er også
et fællesskab, hvor vi møder hinanden i virkeligheden gennem events, talks, filmfremvisninger, workshops, fester og åbne redaktionsmøder. F.eks. har vi lavet

Tosomhedsevent i Det Kongelige Teater
Udstilling af Kibbutz-serien i U-kirken i Århus
Filmfremvisning i Grand Teatret

På to år har vi ​

udgivet 488 indlæg
afholdt 39 events
haft mere end 1 million sidevisninger
mere end 100.000 brugere  

Hvad har SEIN brug for, og hvordan kan jeg hjælpe?
Vi har brug for 250.000 kroner og 2000 medlemmer inden jul for at kunne fortsætte SEIN. Indtil nu har vi overlevet på støtte fra fonde og donorer, men ansøgningsprocesserne er enormt tidskrævende og resultaterne for usikre. For at SEIN skal kunne blive ved med at være det mest vedkommende, dækkende og ærlige medietilbud til de 15-25 årige er vi nødt til at være økonomisk selvstændige. 
Pengene skal bruges til:

Husleje
Udvikling af hjemmeside
Oprette medlemslogin
Beskeden aflønning af dem, der bruger al deres tid på SEIN. 

 
Hvad får jeg ud af det?
Du kan støtte, med hvad du har lyst til, men vi har sammensat nogle pakker, hvor du enten kan få nogle flotte sokker, en mulepose, t-shirt eller sweatshirt med som tak. Du har også mulighed for at købe forskellige events og workshops af os.
 
Men... Hvis SEIN er gratis, hvorfor skal jeg så blive medlem?
Vi laver de mest vedkommende, hudløse og ærlige fortællinger for unge mennesker i Danmark, og det synes vi, at alle skal have adgang til uanset indtægt. Derfor vil alt indhold på SEIN fortsat være gratis. Det er også derfor, vi kalder jer for medlemmer og ikke abonnenter; og som medlem af SEIN får du:

Gratis adgang til et hav af spændende, sjove, lærerige og hyggelige events (Ikke-medlemmer kan også deltage, såfremt de køber en billet eller et medlemsskab af SEIN)
Et nyhedsbrev med information om nye projekter, events og forandringer samt eksklusive anbefalinger fra de forskellige redaktioner.
Et månedligt åbent redaktionsmøde i både Århus og København, hvor SEINs medlemmer kan komme og få direkte indflydelse på SEINs indhold samt et oplæg af forskellige, spændende folk
En SEIN-hotline. I to timer hver mandag sidder SEIN klar til at tage telefonen og snakke om lige præcis det, du har lyst til. Har du spørgsmål, forslag, idéer, eller keder du dig bare? Så ring!
Mulighed for at være passivt et medlem, der blot gerne vil give en skilling til et godt formål.

story:
THE ORIGIN

Melanated People came into existence in August of 2016. It spawned from the constant oppression of Black voices on white owned social media platforms. The need for a safe Black space was more prevalent than ever. Social networks have become a very intricate part of our everyday lives, and an important source of information, culture, and business. 

After seeing positive, uplifting, thought provoking Black focused content being removed based on unfair bias rules and regulation on platforms that were supposed to encourage freedom of expression. The ability to amplify Black social and political issues within our communities is of the upmost importance, and bringing them to the light of the world is crucial. This was recently evident again in 2020, when the killing of an unarmed Black man, George Floyd, by a White Minneapolis police officer resulted in widespread protests that demonstrated, where content such as post, and videos were removed from those main platforms. 

"In 2021, social media advertising spending in the United States was projected to amount to 47.9 billion U.S. dollars, out of over 198 billion total online media advertising spending forecast for that year."

Source:  Statista Research Department, Social media ad spend in the U.S. 2019-2021 

Not only are our voices silenced on major platforms, but our businesses are also hidden and shadow banned when they start to receive too much attention or tracking. Practices like these leads to the loss of small businesses and organizations that support our communities due to the lack of exposure. A report by the Institute for Policy Studies stated “While households of color are projected to reach majority status by 2043, if the racial wealth divide is left unaddressed, median Black household wealth is on a path to hit zero by 2053 and median Latino household wealth is projected to hit zero twenty years later. In sharp contrast, median White household wealth would climb to $137,000 by 2053.”  To counter act these predictions and maintain Black wealth, the first and most important action is to take back our narrative.  

 

To have a truly safe space, Black people must create them for themselves, and they must be funded and supported by Black people.  We must make strides to close the technology gap and take our fair share in a Market that targets and profits from Black culture. This starts with simply controlling the places that our content created and stored.  

 

“To date, we’ve connected over 100,000 users to Black content, groups, and businesses, that matters to them from all over the world.”  


 

Melanated People takes the power of social media and places it back into the hands of the culture.  It provides a platform for them to get involved with issues they care about or finding like-minded people without the fear of accounts being shadow banned or delete. Our users enjoy a public and private time, direct messaging, Live video, Groups as well as a directory of Black Owned services and business to make it simple to discover, find, and support. We also boast in app and website advertising so Black businesses and organizations can get the exposure they need and deserve. So far, we’ve connected over 100,000 users to Black content, groups, and businesses, that matters to them from all over the world.


 


 


 

The Mission  

Our mission is to provide a Safe Space for all people of the global African diaspora, a platform to network, connect and build their brands and businesses. We seek to empower our members collectively by means of reinvestment into our communities; social, economic and education systems. 

 

Black social media is the soul of the internet. Black Creators are the heart of the culture. Our content is unique and special. Melanated People was created because of the need to for Black people to control our own media, our own narrative. We want all people of the African diaspora to join and share our culture globally. We hope our app will unite our people worldwide and give us a platform to freely be us and enjoy who we are. To elevate who we are we need to have a safe black space where we can control how we spend our money, the products we support and reinvest into who we are.    


 

 

 THE GOAL

Our next stage of evolution will focus on building our infrastructure to house more users, buy adding stronger servers and redesigning our apps for a more better user experience. We are working to make Melanated People the social media experience for the African diaspora. We are also looking to add additional features to better compete with mainstream platforms. It will also be used to create content and hire Black content creators, so we can develop better content for our users. We are ready to move to the next stage, but we need your help to do it.  We want to build a true community for our members to connect with each other, Black Businesses, and information that will help them grow.

story:
“You yourselves are our letter, written on our hearts, known and read by everybody.”            2 Corinthians 3: 2

‘The Letter Podcasts’ are an exciting way for people hear the teachings of St Paul, explore the Book of Acts, and engage with the Bible in a dynamic, creative and original way - bringing fresh perspectives on the early church and the life of the great apostle.

But don’t worry, as being educational they’re going to be entertaining and a lot of fun!

Each episode will be an easy-to-digest chunk of approximately 10 minutes, perfect for people with busy on-the-go lives.

We are planning to create 3 mini-serials of roughly 10-12 episodes each.

The first series is due to be recorded in January 2019, and released in the early Spring.

It will be broadcast on UCB radio, as well as being available to download from our website. We are also exploring a number of other routes through which to make it available.

‘The Letter’ was originally created as a stage show and toured to churches all around the UK to great acclaim. Below is some of the feedback.*

 

We need a little help

  • The Series One scripts are written, the Series 2 & 3 ideas are planned, the recording studio is booked, but we need to raise little extra money to cover some of the pre-production costs and pay the 7 actors involved for their time. If you can help in any way it would be really appreciated.
  • We'd also love it if you could share our campaign, share out Facebook & Twitter feeds and help us get the word out about this exciting new project.

Mike Peacock- writer and director of Rhema Theatre Company and Peacock Productions- is an award nominated writer and director of  5 short films, over 40 theatre productions, and is a published author. His style is humorous and fun as well as shedding light on unusual topics and has a passion for bringing the Bible to life in new ways for people today. 


*‘I’ll never read Paul’s letters in the same way again. Worth 20 commentaries!’ Kim Lau, Manchester Chinese Church

‘The Letter is a brilliant production’. Baptist Times Review

‘Well-written, skilful and professional.’ Jane Gledhill, Theological Training Centre

‘Once again I thought you scaled the heights in performance with a brilliant script and a powerful message for the church. It also made me think about the man Paul in new ways.’  Graham Hooke, Calvary Christian Fellowship

‘Rhema Theatre Company bring God’s word to life in a performance marked by professionalism, enthusiasm, humour and a faithfulness to the scriptures. Truly inspiring!’ Rev Francis Murphy, Greenock Mount Kirk Church, Scotland

‘Excellent. A really superb evening…brilliant!’  Steven Gaukroger, Goldhill Baptist Church

For more information, please visit our web site or follow us on Facebook & Twitter.

 http://rhematheatre.org/the-letter

story:
Hi, and welcome to Halo!
We're so happy to have you on our team.

As a new member of our team, there's so much we'd like to share with you. You already know about our commitment to making the world a better, safer place, and to giving magic havers back their freedom and peace of mind. But did you know that we're also pushing boundaries and innovating to achieve our mission in ways previously thought impossible? It's true! And we're delighted you've chosen to join us on our journey.
 

VALENCE and the world of New Candler.

VALENCE is a serialized urban fantasy podcast, meant for adult audiences, entering its second season. In our first season, we introduced the major characters and learned a little about New Candler and the world in which the series takes place. With season two, we're bringing some new players to the game and taking our audience beyond what's already known and diving deeper into Halo, the tech company leading the market in magic suppression.

Season 2 of VALENCE is already in production, with all episodes written and edited, and with recording already underway! Join us on January 9th, 2021 for the Season 2 premiere of VALENCE wherever you get your podcasts.

 

Who are we?

Hug House Productions

Hug House Productions is a podcast production collective founded by Anne Baird, Katie Youmans, and Wil Williams. Our company is currently producing: Scoring Magic, a documentary about the process of making an audio drama; VALENCE, that very audio drama, an urban fantasy fiction podcast; and HEXADEC, an anthology podcast with episodes based on colors.

Hug House Productions's goal in coming together and creating podcasts is to bring stories to the world that feature and spotlight queer characters and artists, as well as those from other marginalized groups. In telling these stories, Hug House also seeks to educate people about the reality of and process that goes into creating these types of stories so that others may learn from our successes and our follies as they bring their own experiences and stories to the wonderful medium of podcasts.

VALENCE Cast and Crew

For Season 2, we're bringing back all of the main cast from Season 1, with some new faces added to the mix!

CAST:

  • Josh Rubino as Liam Alden (he/him);
  • John Westover as Nico Salvai (he/him);
  • Caleb Del RIo as Flynn Velasco (he/him);
  • Jordan Cobb as Sarah Harris (she/her);
  • Katie Chin as Grace Chen (she/her);
  • Ishani Kanetkar as Mahira Varma (she/her);
  • Madison Dabbs-Petty as Elisha Dawes (she/her);
  • Elena Fernández Collins as Soledad Marquez (they/she);
  • Alex Welch as Noel Alden (she/her);
  • Naomi McMillan as Morgan Reilley (she/her);
  • David S. Dear as Richard Alden (he/him);
  • Giancarlo Herrera as Luis Acebo (he/him);
  • Miracle Fonmanu as Zoe Kafoa (she/her);
  • and many more to be introduced throughout the season!

Read the cast bios and see the full cast list on our website.

CREW:

  • Wil Williams (they/she) - Showrunner, Lead Writer, and Sound Designer;
  • Katie Youmans (she/her) - Director, Writer;
  • Anne Baird (she/they) - Production Manager, Script Supervisor, and Co-Director
  • Raul Vega (he/him) - Theme Song Composer
  • Giancarlo Herrera (he/him) - Artist's Representative

 

What do you get?

PERKS

  • Eternal Gratitude: Nothing physical, we're just very thankful for your support!
  • Social Media Shoutout: We will shout your name from the heavens (our Twitter) in public thanks of your support.
  • Early Episode Access: We'll send you a link to listen to the episodes of season 2 a week before they drop on the public feed.
  • MP3s of Season 1 and 2 Themes: Full-version MP3s of the Season 1 and Season 2 themes for VALENCE,
  • Sticker Pack: A VALENCE-themed sticker pack including the new season 2 logo and a limited edition sticker only available during this campaign (designs TBA).
  • Special Editions of Episodes: Access to special editions of each episode released alongside each regular episode drop featuring added lines voiced by Showrunner Wil Williams.
  • Written Bonus Scenes: We'll send you a bundle of written bonus scenes set in the VALENCE universe, like some of Liam and Nico's chaos dates that occurred between Seasons 1 and 2 and more from the perspective of other characters.
  • Custom Character Voice Memo: A custom voice memo from the character of your choice. (*Terms and conditions apply.)
  • Producer Credit: Sponsor an episode in season 2 and we'll say nice things about you right in the episode! (*Limit of 12.)
     

ADD-ONS

On top of the perks included with the regular reward tiers, you can add any of the following rewards on to your pledge!

  • PDF copy of Stabl by Wil Williams: A copy of the book VALENCE is based on: Stabl. Find out where the story of Liam and the TEAm began!
  • VALENCE Seasons 1 and 2 on CD: Inspired by the amazing Rashika Rao, we'll burn the first two seasons of VALENCE onto discs so you can have both a souvenir and another way to listen to the show!
  • Custom Magic Sound: What does your magic sound like? Now you can find out! Our sound designer Wil Williams will create your own personalized magic sound for you to use however you want.

 

How are we using your money?

This season, we've budgeted to pay every actor who's working on the show -- this means that everyone involved in the voice acting portion is being paid, even if they only have a couple lines.

So here's the breakdown of our $7,000 goal:

Voice Acting - $3,735.00
This is the actual cost of our voice acting this season! Because the scripts are completed, we know the exact cost. 

Sound Design - $2,400.00
Sound design is time consuming, so we want to make sure our sound designer (Wil) is paid for their work!

Composition - $100.00
Raul Vega (creator of Rose Drive and Swiss and Lali) is coming back to create a version of the theme song for season 2 and must be paid for his work!

Hosting Costs - $65.00
This will helpcover our website and RSS hosting costs for the season!

Platform Fees - $700.00
Indiegogo charges a 5% platform fee, as well as a credit card charging fee on each payment. This is an estimate of what it will end up being. (And if those costs end up being less, it'll go towards hosting!)
 


 

But what if we raise all of that?

Once we hit our goal of $7,000, we've got some very exciting stretch goals in store!

$10,000 - Bonus Episode: Nico's Perspective
That's right! If we hit the magic $10k number, we'll produce an episode from Nico's perspective  so everyone can learn more about our disaster chaos child.

$15,000 - Bonus Episode: Morgan Reilley's Perspective
Season 2 is going to take us further into the depths of Halo -- but what about the side of the company that Liam and the TEAm don't see? $15k will get everyone an episode from the point of view of the CEO of Halo herself... Morgan Reilley.

$20,000 - Bonus Episode: T.B.A.
Okay, listen... if we hit $20k, we'll do another bonus episode and let everyone decide what it is, We'll come up with some options and do a vote on what we do!
 

Risks & Challenges

We at Hug House Productions are committed to making Season 2 of VALENCE a reality, so there's little risk to be had. The season is already written, edited, and currently in the recording stage of production, with sound design planned to begin in October 2020. 

Even if we don't reach our goal, VALENCE Season 2 will still happen, and we'll still be fulfilling your rewards — it just might take a bit longer to achieve, and won't have as many frills on the production. 

This isn't our first rodeo; we're familiar with the process and have a plan in place with contingencies in case of any issues popping up, but if you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please reach out to us and we're happy to help!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially, which is why the end product will be released for free, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • Tell others about the campaign on social media! We'll be posting about the campaign on the Twitter page for VALENCE and the Hug House Facebook group.
  • Share the campaign with your friends and family, even if they're not familiar with podcasts yet. There's always room for more fans of podcasts in the world!
  • Rate and review VALENCE on Apple Podcasts and / or Podchaser -- while it may not increase our charting position (podcast chart analytics continue to be a mystery), it does help others find the show and makes us feel good. ;)
  • For continued support, you can pledge to Hug House Productions on Patreon and purchase merchandise for VALENCE and our other shows on TeePublic.
     

Acknowledgements

Thank you so much to our entire cast and crew for working with us on VALENCE!

An extra special thank you to the following:

  • Katie Chin for helping us name our tiers for this campaign.
  • Rashika Rao for inspiring the copies of VALENCE on CD.

David S. Dear as Richard Alden (he/him);
Giancarlo Herrera as Luis Acebo (he/him);
Miracle Fonmanu as Zoe Kafoa (she/her);
and many more to be introduced throughout the season!

Read the cast bios and see the full cast list on our website.
CREW:

Wil Williams (they/she) - Showrunner, Lead Writer, and Sound Designer;
Katie Youmans (she/her) - Director, Writer;
Anne Baird (she/they) - Production Manager, Script Supervisor, and Co-Director
Raul Vega (he/him) - Theme Song Composer
Giancarlo Herrera (he/him) - Artist's Representative

 

What do you get?
PERKS

Eternal Gratitude: Nothing physical, we're just very thankful for your support!
Social Media Shoutout: We will shout your name from the heavens (our Twitter) in public thanks of your support.
Early Episode Access: We'll send you a link to listen to the episodes of season 2 a week before they drop on the public feed.
MP3s of Season 1 and 2 Themes: Full-version MP3s of the Season 1 and Season 2 themes for VALENCE,
Sticker Pack: A VALENCE-themed sticker pack including the new season 2 logo and a limited edition sticker only available during this campaign (designs TBA).
Special Editions of Episodes: Access to special editions of each episode released alongside each regular episode drop featuring added lines voiced by Showrunner Wil Williams.
Written Bonus Scenes: We'll send you a bundle of written bonus scenes set in the VALENCE universe, like some of Liam and Nico's chaos dates that occurred between Seasons 1 and 2 and more from the perspective of other characters.
Custom Character Voice Memo: A custom voice memo from the character of your choice. (*Terms and conditions apply.)
Producer Credit: Sponsor an episode in season 2 and we'll say nice things about you right in the episode! (*Limit of 12.) 

ADD-ONS
On top of the perks included with the regular reward tiers, you can add any of the following rewards on to your pledge!

PDF copy of Stabl by Wil Williams: A copy of the book VALENCE is based on: Stabl. Find out where the story of Liam and the TEAm began!
VALENCE Seasons 1 and 2 on CD: Inspired by the amazing Rashika Rao, we'll burn the first two seasons of VALENCE onto discs so you can have both a souvenir and another way to listen to the show!
Custom Magic Sound: What does your magic sound like? Now you can find out! Our sound designer Wil Williams will create your own personalized magic sound for you to use however you want.

 


How are we using your money?
This season, we've budgeted to pay every actor who's working on the show -- this means that everyone involved in the voice acting portion is being paid, even if they only have a couple lines.
So here's the breakdown of our $7,000 goal:
Voice Acting - $3,735.00This is the actual cost of our voice acting this season! Because the scripts are completed, we know the exact cost. 
Sound Design - $2,400.00Sound design is time consuming, so we want to make sure our sound designer (Wil) is paid for their work!
Composition - $100.00Raul Vega (creator of Rose Drive and Swiss and Lali) is coming back to create a version of the theme song for season 2 and must be paid for his work!
Hosting Costs - $65.00This will helpcover our website and RSS hosting costs for the season!
Platform Fees - $700.00Indiegogo charges a 5% platform fee, as well as a credit card charging fee on each payment. This is an estimate of what it will end up being. (And if those costs end up being less, it'll go towards hosting!) 
 
But what if we raise all of that?
Once we hit our goal of $7,000, we've got some very exciting stretch goals in store!
$10,000 - Bonus Episode: Nico's PerspectiveThat's right! If we hit the magic $10k number, we'll produce an episode from Nico's perspective  so everyone can learn more about our disaster chaos child.
$15,000 - Bonus Episode: Morgan Reilley's PerspectiveSeason 2 is going to take us further into the depths of Halo -- but what about the side of the company that Liam and the TEAm don't see? $15k will get everyone an episode from the point of view of the CEO of Halo herself... Morgan Reilley.
$20,000 - Bonus Episode: T.B.A.Okay, listen... if we hit $20k, we'll do another bonus episode and let everyone decide what it is, We'll come up with some options and do a vote on what we do! 

Risks & Challenges
We at Hug House Productions are committed to making Season 2 of VALENCE a reality, so there's little risk to be had. The season is already written, edited, and currently in the recording stage of production, with sound design planned to begin in October 2020. 
Even if we don't reach our goal, VALENCE Season 2 will still happen, and we'll still be fulfilling your rewards — it just might take a bit longer to achieve, and won't have as many frills on the production. 
This isn't our first rodeo; we're familiar with the process and have a plan in place with contingencies in case of any issues popping up, but if you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please reach out to us and we're happy to help! 

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially, which is why the end product will be released for free, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

Tell others about the campaign on social media! We'll be posting about the campaign on the Twitter page for VALENCE and the Hug House Facebook group.
Share the campaign with your friends and family, even if they're not familiar with podcasts yet. There's always room for more fans of podcasts in the world!
Rate and review VALENCE on Apple Podcasts and / or Podchaser -- while it may not increase our charting position (podcast chart analytics continue to be a mystery), it does help others find the show and makes us feel good. ;)
For continued support, you can pledge to Hug House Productions on Patreon and purchase merchandise for VALENCE and our other shows on TeePublic. 

Acknowledgements
Thank you so much to our entire cast and crew for working with us on VALENCE!
An extra special thank you to the following:

Katie Chin for helping us name our tiers for this campaign.
Rashika Rao for inspiring the copies of VALENCE on CD.

story:
It tastes...um... good?

For over eight years, BeerAndTrembling has combined "Gas Station 6-Packs and Dime Store Philosophy." Each of the 300+ blog posts has included a beer review and a reading of the week drawn from classic literature, philosophy, or poetry.

And, although I am very proud of BeerAndTrembling, the beer reviews have always felt like a weak point. My only experience with beer has been as a consumer, and predominantly as a consumer of the cheapest suds I could find. Cornell University's Beer Tasting program will give me the tools to create a consistent set of criteria to evaluate and review the myriad styles of beer. Cornell's School of Hotel Administration is the premier hospitality management school in the nation. Through eCornell, their expertise can be shared at an affordable price.

Campaign in the Neck

For the course and required materials, I am seeking $500. The benefits of such a modest investment are numerous:

  • BeerAndTrembling will continue to improve, integrating what I learn into more consistent, reliable beer reviews.
  • I will publish a series of blog posts sharing what I learn from the Cornell program, so that all of my readers can benefit from Cornell's instruction.
  • All donors will have access to my class notes.
  • Readers who donate $15 can "Buy Me a Book" and choose a reading of the week for a future blog post.
  • Readers who donate $20 can "Buy Me A Beer" and choose a beer to feature in a future blog post.
  • Readers who donate $30 or more can "Buy a Round" and choose BOTH a beer and reading to be paired in a future blog post.
  • Readers who donate any amount are free to reach out through BeerAndTrembling's contact page and share any comments, suggestions, or snide remarks.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everybody can or will donate, but they can still help:

  • Share BeerAndTrembling (and this campaign) with your friends.
  • Comment on any blog posts that move you.
  • Read good books.
  • Drink good beer.
  • Engage other people and their ideas (whether online or IRL) with a sense of respect and openness.

story:
Background and Summary

Hey there! I'm Heather, and since 2009 I have been podcasting on Tudor England with my show, the Renaissance English History Podcast. In addition I created the first ever online virtual summit on Tudor history, the Tudor Summit, which brings together leading authors and historians to discuss Tudor history every six months. I also have a radio show on Tudor music in the UK. That show actually sparked the idea of creating an entire online radio station devoted to Tudor history. I wanted a way to distribute the show to my podcast audience, and since I don't have a radio license, I wouldn't have been able to do that on my show - the laws say that without a license you can only play 30 second snippets of music, covered under Fair Use. If you want to play full works (which I do on my radio show) you need a license.

The idea to get a license snowballed, and I've decided to start an internet station devoted to Tudor history. I'm gathering content from the leading podcasters out there, and I'll also be playing music from the 16th century. We'll have book shows, interviews, and more. 

Basically, it will be an online station available through Tune In and its own player, and it will be focused on All Tudor, All the Time. Bringing you into the 16th century, no matter where you are. Whether it's in your car during your commute, at the gym, or when you're cooking dinner, you'll be guaranteed to turn on this station and hear something Tudor related - whether it's music or talk. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need some funding to make this station a reality! The first thing is the licensing, so we're legal to play all the music we want. Also, the radio station software, and web space, so we can broadcast out all over the Tudor-loving world! Then, money for licensing and paying for content from other shows and presenters. 

I'm doing flexible funding with this, and everything you contribute will go straight to the campaign, even if I don't reach the final amount. This is something I'm going to do regardless, and I've created some (what I think are) great rewards and sweeteners to ask for your support. 

The Impact

I believe deeply in my bones that learning about history connects us to different cultures, and helps us see different viewpoints - something that has often become missing in modern discourse. I also think that the stories of this time period are just plain fun. 

I've been talking about history, and sharing stories with people since I was 14 years old, and my first summer job was as a student docent at a Revolutionary War home in my hometown. I can remember so vividly the experience of being in the home alone, looking at the possessions of the family that had lived there, and thinking how very close we were - only time had separated us. When you can cross time, and start to see the world through the eyes of the people who lived those events, you start to build empathy, and it becomes easier in general to see the world through the lens of people who might view it differently than you do. 

The Tudor Radio Network will bring together presenters and experiences to connect you to the 16th century, to challenge your mind and help you see the world through the eyes of the people who lived five hundred years ago. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is going to be finding programming to fill 24 hours a day. My goal initially is to only fill up the day with 8 hours of programming which I would repeat three times - that's so that people in each time zone around the world would be able to catch the shows (there seems to be pockets of Tudor fans in Australia, Europe, and America, so broadcasting three times throughout the day ensures everyone will be able to listen to everything).

Part of the money raised from this indiegogo will go towards developing more original programming, and paying people to present shows.

I will say that I am uniquely positioned to be able to pull this off because of having been in the podcasting world for so long (9 years), being part of a podcasting network (the Agora Podcast Network where I have access to brilliant content creators), and the people I know through doing my Tudor Summits, and being deeply involved in this world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, I'd LOVE for you to share this with all your Tudor-loving friends! You can also listen like crazy once the station is live! We will need listeners to help us pull this off!!

story:
Okay, we're asking for financial help. We reckon this is a two, possibly three-year project, so we'll need to buy hosting if we're going to do it properly. We could do it all using freebies, but it might mean we run out of download capacity (episode 1 has almost crashed the free allowance), and we'd also struggle to host previous episodes (episode 1 took up 37%, so we'd struggle to host an archive of more than about three). We'd also have to lose the music, as you need to buy a PRS podcast licence in order to use it. (NB: The music choices will be goooooood!)

So if you fancy chucking a couple of quid our way to help out, we'd appreciate it. If you'd like to chuck a couple of quid more, we'd appreciate it even more. And if you'd like to sponsor the whole shebang, our appreciation would know no bounds. In return we'd offer rewards, as detailed opposite.

And finally, we've budgeted for more than we need, because it could well be that we don't get enough people chipping in. Which is fine. You ungrateful bleeders. However, if we do get fully funded, there will possibly be more money than we need. If so, we'll send the surplus County's way, in the form of sponsorship of some kind.

Everyone wins!

Everyone wins!

story:
Short Summary

We are Cracked Brain!!! What started out as a weekend hobby podcast has grown so much over the last year. Cosplaying is a passion that all of us share; as a way to challenge ourselves to create and embody a character with our own hands and creativity. Now, we want to take our vision higher. Our goal with this campaign is to actualize dreams that we have all had since childhood.

Brandon and Candace went to school to attain degrees in animation and game design. After attaining those degrees, the market for those endeavors left our area. And for the last few years, those skills have remained fairly unused. Stephan has dreamed of being a professional voice actor since he was 5 years old. Although he has been able to do some voice acting work in the past, work is exceedingly hard to come by. So, instead of trying to look at others to POSSIBLY join, we want to create our own content to use the skills we've tirelessly worked to enhance. This campaign is will hopefully enable us to purchase the needed hardware and software to create the animated show, web comic, and other content that we want to create.

What We Need & Your Rewards

We've spent many hours figuring out what we will need in order to bring everyone the best content we can. Optimizing the computer set ups we already have and getting the equipment needed to bring our original ideas to light.

  • We've calculated that the minimum to get the bare essentials of what we'll need will be around $5000. The low key home studio set up for audio production that we're planning to use, is about $2700 with the components alone (Condenser microphones, A quality mixer board, mics stands, sound insulation, etc). The rest is going toward getting the computer components needed to ensure quality animation production, 3D imaging, audio engineering, and more.
  • For the past few months, we have been looking for as many different "rewards" to offer, as possible. For all physical items, we've contacted local companies about a variety of different products. A goal of ours is to offer the most fun products that we can offer AND support local artists and companies at the same time.
  • If we are not successful in achieving our projected goal, we plan to use whatever donations received to purchase the necessary components that we will be able to use.

Another Way You Can Help

Times are tough for all of us. And sometimes we just don't have the funds available to help out monetarily. But there is another way that helps out JUST AS MUCH. Let as many people know about this campaign as possible. Talk about us with friends and family. Share it on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and any other social media platform.
