story:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.

Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.

Si no nos conoces 

Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.

O suscribirte en iTunes.

O seguirlo en Spotify.

O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.

Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.

Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.

Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.

Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Lima, en Perú.

Qué es el No sé, dime tour LIMA

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Lima, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de Perú para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.

Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.

A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.

Por qué nosotros

Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.

Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 

Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 

a los Shorty Awards...

Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.

Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.

Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.

Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.

Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.

Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.

No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.

El problema

Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.

Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...

Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.

Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Lima nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.

Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 

Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.

Lo que nos hace falta

  • Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
  • Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a Perú.
  • Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
  • Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

  • Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
  • Merch
  • Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
  • Alquiler de equipos
  • Honorarios de producción
  • Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos

Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Lima en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).

Por qué te necesitamos

Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  

Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.

El reto

Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.

Tal vez no vives en Lima, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.

Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.

Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.

¿Contamos contigo?

Maiah y Gabriel
story_txt:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.
Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.
Si no nos conoces 
Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.
O suscribirte en iTunes.
O seguirlo en Spotify.
O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.
Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.
Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.
Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.
Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Lima, en Perú.
Qué es el No sé, dime tour LIMA

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Lima, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de Perú para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.
Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.
A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.
Por qué nosotros
Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.
Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 
Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 
a los Shorty Awards...
Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.
Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.
Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.
Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.
Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.
Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.
No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.
El problema
Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.
Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...
Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.
Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Lima nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.
Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 
Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.
Lo que nos hace falta

Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a Perú.
Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
Merch
Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
Alquiler de equipos
Honorarios de producción
Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos
Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Lima en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).
Por qué te necesitamos
Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  
Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.
El reto
Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.
La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.
Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.
Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.
Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.
Tal vez no vives en Lima, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.
Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.
Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.
¿Contamos contigo?
Maiah y Gabriel

story:
Decolonize your mind! Unpack all of the lies and stories that were told to you about Indigenous people and POC. 
 
Help us bring the truth of our voices and experiences and set the record straight for future generations.
 

The "Why"

We must know where we come from to know who we are.  We need to know the real history to form identities as Indigenous people and POC that are proud, loud and mad!

We need to undo the erasure of our people from history and media by beginning to tell our stories again.  The language that we speak and the stories that we tell were the first things that were stripped from our people as acts of oppression.  We were written out of history books, erased from the census and denied basic rights to gather in public, build community, and share our knowledge and culture.  Raices is working as a community group to build these experiences in person through programming that we offer around playgroups, language classes, herbal/healing workshops and other opportunities to bring the community together to share our stories and our wisdom.

Our podcast is an extension of our mission and will allow us to bring the stories and knowledge to a larger audience, including those who are unable to make our live events.

 

We aim to provide a bimonthly podcast to start as we launch with "extras" offered as we are able to develop them.

All contributers of $60 or more will be able to access our podcasts for as long as they desire.  We will be creating a virtual community of listeners on Patreon as a way to better interact with our listeners and share the stories of others.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need equipment and money for marketing.  In order to get the podcast up and running we need microphones, headphones and small equipment to get the podcast to sound great- especially when we record live events. 

  • We need $900 for equipment and marketing to start up our podcast to provide this information to the public.  We are hoping to make the content available in both English and Spanish.

  • For those who donate $60 or more and join our listening community, we will be able to give you a shout-out at the beginning of our episodes and the chance to get some "Decolonize your Mind" merch after we launch our podcast as a way to say "Thank you!"

  • If we arent able to raise all of the money, we will use what we collect to buy whatever equipment we can afford and will continue fundraising to meet our goal!

The Impact

Those who hold the information, drive the narrative.  It is time for a revolution of information. It is time to re-center the experiences and stories of people of color.  By embracing and learning our history we are acting in resistance to settler/colonialism. By sharing our stories and history that has tried to be erased, we are continuing the legacy and ensuring that future generations have access to this information.  

Risks & Challenges

This is our first podcast and so we anticipate the beginning to be a little rocky.  We know there will be a learning curve but we are quick learners and are committed to getting this done! 

However, we have experience in writing, editing and storytelling.  We are avid readers and researchers and will take the time to make sure we get our facts right and our stories straight. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to share this with others and spread the word.

  • Visit our website Raicesct.org and check out our resources, support our work, and if you live in the area stay in touch and come to one of our local events!
  • If you don't live in the area, connect with local POC doing community-based work and start the process of decolonization and community building! It's about creating a vision of the world we want to live in and working each day to get closer to that vision.
  • Remember:  The world we live in now  isnt the world we used to live in and it doesnt have to be the way the world is in the future!!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

And Remember...

We are resilient people because we have survived the gravest acts of genocide, violence, and oppression.  We are also beautiful people because we have rich cultures full of songs, stories, languages, cuisine, and wisdom that are complex and unique.  We would be honored to bring as much of this to you as we can so that you may learn and share with others.  Knowledge truly is power.

Thank you!!

story:
We Did It!

Although we fell short of raising enough to pay writers pro rates, we ensured that there will be at least a 21-episode first season of NIGHTLIGHT thanks to you.

We've launched a teaser episode on iTunes, and other platforms like Stitcher are awaiting approval.

Our first episode, featuring a story based on the bestselling novel Dread Nation will launch on June 26!

We've also created a Patreon page and a PayPal, so you can continue to support the podcast and help us lock down a second season.

 

Thanks again for your support. We couldn't do this without you.

-Tonia

 

===========

 

TL;DR:

We need more horror written by Black people.

  • Many podcasts/magazines don't pay their writers. That's not cool.
  • Very few podcasts/magazines pay pro rates. We get it. That's tough to do. That's why we need your help.
  • We want to increase the exposure Black horror writers get & help them launch amazing careers
  • Podcasts are incredibly popular and an excellent avenue to promote authors and their stories

Can you help us get more Black horror out into the world?

We Need You

It's not cool to only "pay" writers with exposure. Writers have bills and we don't know anybody that accepts exposure as payment. We want to pay the writers whose stories appear in this podcast a fair rate. We also want to pay the Black narrators a fair wage for their voice performances. And people in Hell want ice water, but they can't launch crowdfunding campaigns, so we hope you can help our wants become reality.

Nightlight will (with your help) be a weekly podcast featuring a ~30 minute horror story written by a Black writer, along with a short interview with that author. The founder, Tonia Thompson, will edit and produce the podcast.

  • We need at least $5,000 to fund the first year. This will allow us to pay writers $75 per story and narrators $25. That's 52 stories, 52 writers, 52 episodes of horror. If we can't raise $5,000, we'll either produce fewer episodes or pay writers less. We'll decide exactly what will produced at the end of the campaign, with your input, if we raise less than $5,000.
  • $15,000 means we can pay pro rates! This is important because paying a writer pro rates allows them to join the Horror Writer's Association, where they can enjoy a number of benefits including promotion of their work and career resources. The writers can also be nominated for awards, so we really want to be able to a pay pro rate of ~$270 per story.
  • If we raise more than $15,000, we will pay narrators more! At $15,000, we will be paying the narrators out of our own pockets, but with your help, we can pay narrators professional rates as well.
  • You'll be helping us fund the first year, allowing us time to build an audience large enough to sell ad time, and perhaps even build a community of support via Patreon.
  • If we raise a ridiculous amount of money, we'll use it to fund next year's episodes.

The Impact

You'll help Black horror writers launch careers.

  • Agents, directors and producers can find potential horror stories and writers in one place.
  • We'll lift the voices of marginalized writers and allow them to tell their stories.
  • Racism sucks. Hearing more stories from a Black perspective can help fix that.
  • Reparations!

Risks & Challenges

  • Getting listeners is always a challenge. Luckily, I have a marketing background and a solid plan for promotion. In fact, if you're interested in becoming a listener, regardless of whether you can contribute, head over here and drop us your email.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money a little tight? I get it. You can still help!

  • Share, RT, and Like posts on social media.
  • Run a contest for your followers. Ask them to donate to this campaign and send you proof of that donation. In exchange, you can send them a piece of your art, a short story, your best recipe, or a nice note!
  • If you're really adventurous, have followers send you their receipts and offer to do something crazy like 1 pushup for every dollar you helped raise.

Ready? Let's get it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, RT, and Like posts on social media.
Run a contest for your followers. Ask them to donate to this campaign and send you proof of that donation. In exchange, you can send them a piece of your art, a short story, your best recipe, or a nice note!
If you're really adventurous, have followers send you their receipts and offer to do something crazy like 1 pushup for every dollar you helped raise.

Ready? Let's get it!

story:
What This is About...

Your Bible pulsates with the kinetic energy of thousands of years, 66 books, 40 authors, 3 continents, 3 languages! It has space wizards, and dragons, and knights, and scientists, and detectives. It is a wild, wild epic. And it all tells the story of how the God that created it all is redeeming it back to Himself. 

Your Bible is a whole universe waiting to be explored. So grab a cup of coffee, crack open your Bible, because we want to explore it together. 

There are some really confusing things in your Bible that we want to make sense of, too. We don't have Bible degrees or think we're right about everything. We just have a love for this incredible transcendant epic. 

We Need Your Help...

While we desperately want this to be available to everyone for free, it unfortunately costs us some money to get the cameras rolling. 

We're hoping to raise $5,000 by the middle of November to launch our podcast, video, and social series with the level of excellency it deserves. We need money to push the podcast on platforms, get stock imagery, pay our designers, and much more (whew it is overwhelming just thinking about it!) 

The Impact

When you donate to this campaign, you are allowing Bible Unbound, a series on biblical literacy, to remain free for everyone who needs to enjoy it! 

Another way to look at it: it is our heart and passion to share the gospel message in every podcast we do as well. So donating to Bible Unbound is a lot like funding a missions project.

Risks & Challenges

As of right now, our campaign rests on the shoulders of those who believe in us. If we cannot raise the money by the end of the year then we may not be able to continue producing content. But we are confident in God's faithfulness, and the faith of His Church that we can launch well! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially then please do not worry! We love that you are interested in the idea. You can help us by sharing the videos and podcasts on a regular basis, subscribing to our channel/following us on social media, and last but not least praying for us! We want to tackle this narrative with insight and accuracy and that can only be done through the power of the Holy Spirit.

story:
The Patron Saint of Suicides

The Patron Saint of Suicides will launch in August 2020 as a 14-episode podcast audio drama, created by author Alex Dolan. With a full cast of roughly 40 actors, an original score, and sophisticated sound design and foley effects, this is designed as a movie for your ears.

UPDATE: As of July 13, we will be offering immediate access for all donors to the first episode! For as little as $1, hear it now! 

About the Show

Haven Otomo has a gift of persuasion. After surviving a brutal train massacre, she uses this gift to save people from the brink of suicide. She spends her free nights patrolling the Golden Gate Bridge, where over the past few years she has stopped 34 people from jumping. 

To process her own trauma, Haven goes to a recovery group for survivors and performs as a stand-up comic as a form of therapy.

Two years after the train massacre, the area sees a rash of suicides. Young men are throwing themselves in front of trains. When the police find a connection to the train shooting two years ago, it leads them to Haven.

The police ask for her help in the investigation. As more is revealed about these crimes, Haven wonders whether some of her fellow survivors are involved, and she questions whether she can trust the people closest to her.

Story Origins

A few years ago, I read a story about a man named Chen Si, who has saved more than 300 people from jumping from the Nanjing Yangtze River Bridge in China. I was immediately inspired by someone who would dedicate themselves to helping people in this way. The story also made me wonder what type of person would perform this kind of work, and the power of persuasion he would have to talk hundreds of people out of hurting themselves.

This was the seed that grew into The Patron Saint of Suicides. The main character, Haven Otomo, has dedicated herself to helping people in crisis. I wanted to create a character with a preternatural gift of persuasion and explore how this gift would impact other facets of her life. Then, I wanted to put her in a story where her gifts would be tested. I set the story in San Francisco, near the Golden Gate Bridge, the most popular location in the United States for suicide jumpers.

The central crime of the book, a train robbery that turns into a mass shooting, was inspired by the phenomenon of the “flash rob,” a new kind of crime that has emerged and grown in popularity over the past few years. The crime usually involves a group of minors meeting at a certain location, for example, a convenience store. They then swarm the store and steal everything in plain sight, fleeing the scene before the staff or owners can take action. A similar robbery recently occurred on the San Francisco Bay Area’s BART system. After interviewing several police officers on the nature of the crime, I thought it would be interesting to feature a crime that escalated out of control and resulted in tragedy.

Timeliness and Relevance

The New York Times reported a study from the National Institute for Health Statistics that suicide in the United States has surged to a 30-year high. The latest data show that more than 42,000 people died from suicide in 2014, compared to more than 29,000 in 1999. The rates have climbed for almost every demographic and age group. The World Health Organization estimates that roughly 800,000 people across the globe die from suicide each year.

Suicide is a growing concern, and yet, as a society, we have largely shied away from discussing it in a meaningful way. This audio drama should resonate with those looking for a springboard for discussion.

What We Need

We are looking to raise $5,000.00 USD to cover the costs of production. This will also pay for bonus content, and set the stage for us to develop a season 2! We worked really hard since the fall of 2019 to bring this show to life, and we're really proud of it. We hope you can help support this so we can produce more content and ignite a conversation about mental health in this country.

20% of Proceeds Fund Mental Health Work

Part of our goal in this show is to raise awareness and open discussion around mental health. To that end, we are committing 20% of the proceeds from this campaign to be donated to the National Alliance on Mental Illness (www.nami.org).

What You Get

We appreciate whatever support you can give, and we'll offer the following perks:

FRIEND. For $1, you get:

  • Ad-free episodes
  • Name in credits
  • Your question answered by series creator Alex Dolan

AMIGO. For $5, you get everything above PLUS:

  • Episode access one day early

BEZZIE. For $10, you get everything above PLUS:

  • Behind-the-scenes content

SPIT BROTHER/SISTER. For $25, you get everything above PLUS:

  • Signed script of your favorite episode
  • 1 free show sticker or pin

YOUR HEART IS TRUE. For $50, you get everything above PLUS:

  • 35% discount on merchandise (you will get the discount code once the campaign has ended, and it will be available for 24 hours though the show's Merchandise Store)
  • 1 T-Shirt or Face Mask from the show's Merchandise Store

YOU'RE A PAL AND A CONFIDANT. For $100, you get everything above PLUS:

  • A limited-edition signed print (100 available) specifically created for the show The Patron Saint of Suicides by renowned artist Shawn Coss! 

PATRON SAINT. This is for sponsors who really believe in the project and want to support the show in a meaningful way. For $250, you get everything above PLUS:

  • The ability to dedicate an episode to someone (we will record a message before the opening credits on your behalf)
  • The full 14-episode series on CD, complete with cover art.

Limited edition signed prints (100 available) from artist Shawn Coss.

Other Ways To Support Us 

Whether or not you can donate money, you can still support the show!

SHARE! Share this campaign (using Indiegogo's share tools), Share the URL www.suicidesaints.com, recommend the show to your friends. Get the word out—we can't do this without you!

LISTEN! When it's out, join us for the show! A lot of people put a lot of work into this, and we think you're going to like it. 

Saints Be Praised

The original story for The Patron Saint of Suicides was written as a novel, and adapted into an audio drama. Here are some blurbs from other authors about the novel version:

"Some books grab you by the throat and refuse to let go until the last page is turned. THE PATRON SAINT OF SUICIDES is such a book. Gorgeously written and ingeniously plotted, it held me captive from its shocking start to its jaw-dropping conclusion."

— Riley Sager, bestselling author of FINAL GIRLS

“An emotional ride born from the ashes of a tragic robbery, Alex Dolan delivers a brilliant and complex thriller that will whisper to you long after you close the cover. You NEED this on your radar.”

—J.D. Barker, International Bestselling Author of Forsaken and The Fourth Monkey

"A novel that subverts, very cleverly, the reader's expectations of where it will take them. I will be thinking about it for some time to come. Dolan is an unquestionably talented writer."

— Alex Marwood, bestselling author of The Darkest Secret, The Wicked Girls, and The Killer Next Door

“Alex Dolan possesses not only a fine talent for storytelling, but also a gift for creating intriguing, unusual characters to people and drive those stories. In The Patron Saint of Suicides, we meet Haven Otomo, a struggling stand-up comic who trolls the Golden Gate Bridge for possible suicides to coax off the rail. The prose is crystal clear and sinewy, scaffolded by a lively structure that dances from Haven’s first-person voice to an objective third-person narration featuring Gibson and Blossem. Dolan combines compelling, believable characters—Haven, in particular, is irresistible—with another dark, twisting tale that will keep you reading long into the night.”     

—Randall Silvis, bestselling author of Two Days Gone

“The Patron Saint of Survivors is a beautifully-written and immersive story that tackles fairly harrowing topics in such a captivating and lyrical way, I found myself lost in the pages, unable to put it down. Haven, our main character, is probably one of the most likable and unique characters I've read in a long time, a pitch-perfect embodiment of the extremes explored in this novel, comedy and death, extremes balanced by a talented author to make for a wholly balanced and literary novel, with the added bonus of suspense. I greatly appreciate Dolan's giving pen, the details he provides, the colors, the play with senses, so that I was able to live in this gorgeous story.”

—Shannon Kirk, award-winning author of Method 15/33 and In the Vines

“Alex Dolan’s THE PATRON SAINT OF SUICIDES is part mystery, part thriller, and wholly a dark and intricate study of human behavior. Dolan intersects comedy and tragedy with a masterful touch, resulting in a character-deep novel that contains as many moments of aching humanity as it does cliffhangers. One of the most original voices I’ve read in some time.”

– Carter Wilson, USA Today bestselling author of Mister Tender’s Girl and The Comfort of Black

“Employing deft prose, Alex Dolan weaves a compelling tale that tackles PTSD, gun violence, and other societal ills while exploring how we use humor to process and deflect our pain. A wonderful read.”

—Nina Sadowsky, bestselling author of Just Fall and The Burial Society

“The Patron Saint of Suicides is a complex exploration of loss and vengeance with a twist you’ll never see coming.”

—Elizabeth Heiter, award-winning author of The Profiler series

 “It's not enough to say that THE PATRON SAINT OF SUICIDES is a gripping psychological drama.  It does more than grip.  It tears.  It horrifies.  It eviscerates.  Dolan has crafted a story that has as many layers as a fractured psyche--and as the plot unfolds, the layers peel back one after the other, always revealing new surprises.  The deeper you fall into the plot, the deeper you fall into madness--until the book's gut-wrenching and completely unexpected conclusion.  This novel is an amazing accomplishment.”

—Joshua Gaylord (Alden Bell), acclaimed author of When We Were Animals

“The Patron Saint of Suicides grabbed me immediately. Dolan writes with an incredible confidence and clarity of voice, and he roots a weighty, thoughtful story in characters who feel like people you already know.” 

—Rob Hart, acclaimed author of New Yorked and City of Rose

For as little as $1, hear it now! About the ShowHaven Otomo has a gift of persuasion. After surviving a brutal train massacre, she uses this gift to save people from the brink of suicide. She spends her free nights patrolling the Golden Gate Bridge, where over the past few years she has stopped 34 people from jumping. To process her own trauma, Haven goes to a recovery group for survivors and performs as a stand-up comic as a form of therapy.Two years after the train massacre, the area sees a rash of suicides. Young men are throwing themselves in front of trains. When the police find a connection to the train shooting two years ago, it leads them to Haven.The police ask for her help in the investigation. As more is revealed about these crimes, Haven wonders whether some of her fellow survivors are involved, and she questions whether she can trust the people closest to her.Story OriginsA few years ago, I read a story about a man named Chen Si, who has saved more than 300 people from jumping from the Nanjing Yangtze River Bridge in China. story:
The Podcast That Connects Everyone With Food!

The Something About Food? Podcast has been going for almost 3 years with 80 episodes and over 80 guests. Diverse folks chat about what they eat, why and how food connects us all. We believe that there is room for everyone at the table.

What We Need 

Since we started, the podcast has been almost entirely self-funded. Paying for the website, hosting sites and our audio editor takes some cash. All the money raised will go into the podcast itself.

The funding will enable us to continue these food conversations with many more exciting guests talking about how food impacted them, and the tasty, memorable and outright ridiculous things they’ve eaten. It isn’t just food, it’s people, their connections to what they eat and us.

The Impact

Your contribution will take the burden off me and allow us to continue connecting and discovering all the foods we never knew about.

Moving Forward

As we grow our listenership we hope to one day be able to fully monetize the podcast. As more ears listen in the greater our chances of being free of any monetary worries.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the Indigogo campaign and the podcast so that we can get others to the table. Thank you for listening, eating and joining our Something About Food? Podcast community.

story:
Support The Carlötta Beautox Chronicles -- Season 2

The Carlötta Beautox Chronicles is a podcast sitcom that launched in the spring of 2019. It follows the comic misadventures of a wanna-be actress who'll do anything to become famous.

Last season, Carlötta suffered through any number of humiliations in her quest to become a star. Nevertheless, Carlötta persisted. By season's end, in a crazy case of mistaken identity, Carlötta became a social media sensation. She's finally famous! Hollywood's newest darling.

In season 2, Carlötta must struggle with the consequences of her newfound (and undeserved) fame. BUT life for Carlötta won't be one giant swag bag. The person whose identity she inadvertently stole will be back, threatening to expose her as a fraud. What drama for a comedy!

WAIT! There's more! We're thrilled to announce we will be creating a MUSICAL EPISODE for a total of 8 episodes.

 

WHAT WE NEED: 

In order to make a 2nd season happen, we need your help. We are asking for $8000. 

BUDGET BREAKDOWN:

  • OUR LEAD ACTORS x 8 episodes =  $1300   We want to pay our brilliant actors for their time and energy.
  • OUR BACKGROUND PLAYERS x 8 episodes = $1600  We have lots of supporting roles! 
  • RECORDING STUDIO:  $1700  A professional studio in LA helps us to continue the quality we established in our first season.  $340 x 5 sessions (we record more than 1 episode per session).
  • CUSTOM MUSIC: $1750  Our musical episode means we have to hire a music producer and musicians.
  • SOUND DESIGNER;  $1250 There's a lot of hours that goes into sonic world-building!
  • INDIEGOGO FEES:  $400

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET:

Our show currently runs with no advertising sponsors! That means we rely 100%  on the generosity of our listeners. Donating will not only help this season come into being but will also land YOU on an acknowledgement page on our website. 

Backers at higher levels can also get tangible rewards like stickers and T-shirts!

 

WHO WE ARE:

The show is produced by Ann Sloan and Laura Lipson for Trojan Cat Media. As this is our 2nd season, rest assured we have assembled a team of producers, actors, and engineers with a proven record of producing a quality show. Fiction podcasters get the job done!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you're unable to donate financially at this time, we totally get it. But there are plenty of other ways you can help support us. Here are just a few suggestions:

  • Perhaps you can follow us on our socials:  FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM.
  • Or maybe leave us a positive review on your favorite podcatcher. The Carlötta Beautox Chronicles can be found on most podcast platforms.
  • Make some noise about the campaign! Tell your friends and family by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Thank you so much for supporting us in whatever way you can!

story: During this expedition I will be starting my podcast titled Who? & How? in which I will be having conversations discussing the what, when, where, and why of the beautiful beings in this world to discover their stories - daily rituals, how they live day to day and what makes them who they are. I will be conducting these conversations at least twice a week (but hopefully more!) and will be featured on my blog which you can follow at (thesteffanperception.blog). Also along this expedition I will be making a series of videos titled Visions that I will post to my YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXbpK6ZdmLPl5A...) and will be accessible from my blog as well. While I do have some money saved up for this voyage, any extra funds would be greatly appreciated to help me along this journey, for there is some equipment I need to acquire before I depart. In order to give you the whole experience through the podcast, videos, and blog I will need a camera body, a few lenses, a flash, tripod, a couple of microphones, pop filters, an audio recorder, preamps, an audio interface and all compact enough to backpack around with, and also various softwares and subscriptions just to have all the right essentials for the podcasts, videos and blogs. For the itinerant portion of my expedition I will need a much bigger pack than I have now, a sleeping bag and pad, for most of my wandering will be resting inside of a tent, but also a hostel and couch surfing, the occasional train ride, bus pass and various other needs to keep me clean, healthy, warm and cool along this journey. At this point I have saved up around $10,000 for this expedition and I am in pursuit to obtain the funds to match it, so that I am able to get all the appropriate necessities I will need to survive, and be able to start a collective of arts to reveal the these stories, people and places to the rest of the world, in hopes of encouraging other humans to #SEE what else is out there to #SEE and initiate that same sense of wonder that is inside of me. Thank you all for your tremendous support and for providing me this opportunity to circuit around the world. Ciao Ciao!

story:
Summary

Fireside is a labor of love created by two people that love hearing new and different stories. Dyllan Becker is one of the writers and an executive producer of the show. He spent a lot of time in high school and college working both on and off the stage. He has been an actor as well as a set designer, stage hand, and sound technician for upwards of fifteen theatre productions. He has been writing for as long as he's been on the stage and this will be his debut as the head writer of a project of this calibre. He has been published in a short story anthology called "From the Ashes, Rise (The Apocrypha Files)," which can be found on Amazon. 

Gaby Halligan is the co-producer and writer of Fireside, and is returning to the creative world after a long hiatus. Having experience in acting, singing, and directing, she is now having a blast with audio engineering and composing in the podcast world. She is an avid tea connoisseur and proud dog mom, and has dreams of one day moving to a cabin in a magical Canadian forest.  

Art and Graphic Design created by Anna Meyer. Anna can be found on Instagram @brusierkee.

 

Everyone says something to the effect of "Create the art you want to see in the world" and that's the idea behind Fireside. Fireside is the story of a member of a small town bringing a local radio tower back from the brink. It's filled with technical difficulties and crazy happenings in a town that focuses on high tech and future forward research. This is the first major project that this production team is embarking on and we want to start with a bang. 

By contributing to this campaign, you are allowing us to create a high quality show with paid actors and artists. You are also allowing us to have a quality website and marketing style that will allow us to get the show out as professionally and quickly as we can. The funds of this campaign will allow us to create a professional show and hopefully launch us into a position where we can go on to create an even better Season 2. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

For Season 1 of Fireside we are looking to raise $1200. 

Here is a breakdown of the funds: 

Logo Design/Show Art: $200.00

Artists' work takes time and effort and we think they deserve to be paid for their work. This amount includes the logo you see on the front page of the campaign page as well as artwork for our forthcoming website.

Microphones: $250.00

Professional sounding shows use professional equipment! We are hoping to use this money to refund our already sunk cost for cheaper microphones and use the rest to provide better quality microphones for all recording characters. We want to bring you guys the best show possible and that involves getting great mics.

One year of RSS hosting: $60.00

RSS hosting is a fancy phrase for the place that stores the podcast episodes and disperses them to the various podcatchers like Stitcher, Spotify, iTunes, the Google Play Store, etc. We are ballparking this price so it will probably be more and we may need a more expensive package depending on how many downloads we get throughout the run of the show. 

Actor Stipends: $250.00

Just like artists, actors need money, too! They can't all do their work for free or no one would ever go into acting again...or, maybe they would, but we think actors deserve money. This amount is also a ballpark but it will provide our main actors with about $15 per episode. More funds will most likely go their way, but we want to have a nice base to start with. 

Website Domain and hosting: $150.00

These funds will be used to get us a good, succinct domain name as well as give us the server space to host our website. We will most likely be using a site like Squarespace that let's us do all of this at once, hopefully minimizing the costs on this front.

The rest of the money will be used for taxes and fees and anything that we haven't thought of yet. Any extra will likely go to our artists or our creative team so they can keep bringing Fireside to you!

All of our perks have been well thought out and we have made sure to provide new perks for each level up. We also wanted to make sure there was a wide variety of perks and things that directly related the show so that we can give back to the people who are going to make our show possible!

If we do not fund fully, we will reapportion the money that we get and continue with the project as planned. We may potentially try to crowdfund again and some of the perks may be delayed but we still plan on making the show no matter what the cost. 

 

The Impact

Our work is incredibly inclusive and dynamic. The characters are fleshed out and diverse in every sense of the word. We are trying to add to the burgeoning art of audio drama podcasts and we are hoping to make  lasting impact on the art form and bring our story to any and all receptive ears. We have worked on creative projects since high school so now we're taking a stab at a podcast. Donations will help us bring our dreams to fruition so every little bit helps!

 

Risks & Challenges

Creativity is hard and time consuming. This work will take a lot of time in order for it to be the best product for you, the donors and the listeners. The production team works full time jobs and has to use their off time to live life and also produce a podcast. This is a very high priority, however. We have already written eight plus episodes of the show, which makes the time commitment less right off the bat. We are dedicated in creating the most amazing show we can. We won't stop until it's amazing. We are hard working, problem solving people who are determined to produce a show and put it out on time and you can hold us to that. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate or you want to help some more, share our campaign with your friends and family any way you can! Send an email or link on Facebook or write the campaign URL on piece of paper and put it in a bottle and send it out into the ocean. If that doesn't sound appealing, be sure to follow us on Twitter (@Fireside_Radio) or find our Facebook page and give us a like. You can share both of those and get the word out on the show. Talk about the idea with friends and get them interested. Anything you can do to spread the word would be incredible and we would be forever thankful. Don't forget that IndieGoGo has an easy share tool to help you spread the word!
story_txt:
Summary
Fireside is a labor of love created by two people that love hearing new and different stories. Dyllan Becker is one of the writers and an executive producer of the show. He spent a lot of time in high school and college working both on and off the stage. He has been an actor as well as a set designer, stage hand, and sound technician for upwards of fifteen theatre productions. He has been writing for as long as he's been on the stage and this will be his debut as the head writer of a project of this calibre. He has been published in a short story anthology called "From the Ashes, Rise (The Apocrypha Files)," which can be found on Amazon. 
Gaby Halligan is the co-producer and writer of Fireside, and is returning to the creative world after a long hiatus. Having experience in acting, singing, and directing, she is now having a blast with audio engineering and composing in the podcast world. She is an avid tea connoisseur and proud dog mom, and has dreams of one day moving to a cabin in a magical Canadian forest.  
Art and Graphic Design created by Anna Meyer. Anna can be found on Instagram @brusierkee.

story:
The Don't Flinch Podcast is a Horror Anthology podcast in the same vein as the old radio horror dramas of the 30s and 40s. We want to take the concept bringing new and innovative radio plays into the modern era via podcasting.

Listen to "Deadly Secret" via the video below.

 

Our goal, $10,000, will allow us to produce 24 single story episodes released every other week for the next year.

But podcasts are free. Why should I pay? It takes a lot of money to produce a podcast as ambitious as this project. Our plan is to write our own scripts, as well as buy scripts from Indie writers. We want to make sure the talented people who come up with these ideas are properly compensated.

Beyond that we are going to be doing most of our own foley work (aka Sound Design) as well as utilizing new composers and voice talents to bring our pieces to life.

If we have enough left over, we will also reach out to some of our friends in the Hollywood horror
business and bring them in to voice a few episodes.

Here is our projected breakdown of where your contributions will be used.

  • 50% - Buying Scripts and Paying Independent Talent
  • 20% - Hosting Costs
  • 20% - Fulfilling Rewards
  • 10% - Equipment for Foley (Sound Design)

  • $15,000 - 2 Stories per episode
  • $20,000 - More episodes per year
  • $25,000 - More horror icons will join the cast
  • $30,000 - We'll take on a full length feature of one of the classics (Night of the Living Dead, Dracula, Frankenstein, etc).
  • $40,000 and above - We will turn select Season 1 podcasts into videos

If we meet our stretch goals, that's only better for everyone. It means more episodes, more independent creatives getting their work out there and better equipment for higher quality episodes.

We are a team of people who love the horror genre. Halloween is our favorite holiday and Fall our favorite season. Our team consists of people who have been producing, hosting, and enjoying podcasts for years.

(Shaun Burris, Brandon Peters, Michelle Suter, Brad Shoemaker)

Shaun Burris is the former host of A&E's Extreme Paranormal and the current host of the Shadow Nation Podcast where they interview actors, directors and more from the horror and paranormal genre. Some of their guests have included Dan Aykroyd, Michael Rooker, Tim Matheson, Robert Carradine, Kane Hodder, Ron Jeremy, Doug Jones and many others.

Brandon Peters is the host of Cult Cinema Cavalcade and reviewer for WhySoBlu.com. Brandon has extensive knowledge of the horror genre and Cult films in general.

Brad Shoemaker is the founder and owner of Creative Zombie Studios. Hailing from the local radio and TV world, he left a comfortable job in a dying medium to create a studio for podcasting.

Michelle Suter is a talented new voice actress and host of the Two Elle's Podcast.

Each of these people are bringing their skills, and combined networks together for the love of creating something fun and interesting in the horror podcast genre.

We are looking for creative scripts to fill out our season one episodes. We will be paying $100/script to make this possible. Get details here

 

 

Help Us Bring you Fun and Horrifically Fun Entertainment.

Donate today and enjoy some great rewards

story:
4oG's Podcast

9th & Penn Entertainment LLC. has found the path to what we are sure to bring decades of positive change in not only our community but all across the nation. The very idea of taking on today's youth is one that many people tend to shy or just plain run away from, but the cast of the 4og’s have over 30 years of knowledge and wisdom on how to rise from the streets and change your life.   

Our cast consists of Harold Berry, Eric Lipscomb, Jaitee Jackson, and John Nelson. We have been friends for over 30 years and the foolishness has only grown with us. The 4oG’s are fathers, husbands, sons, brothers, uncles, and granddads that have a true understanding of their community and what it takes to navigate the streets of Indianapolis, Indiana. The 4oG’s are a group of friends that have decided to use the knowledge that they have acquired over 3 decades to try and tackle an issue that seems to be growing at a wildfires pace. The 4og's will be bridging the gap between old schools that still love hip hop and also care about today's youth and the problems that plague our children through the means of hip hop while allowing them to display their unique hip-hop talents.  

 Hip hop and community outreach have always been hand in hand being that they were created to fight the same set of circumstances. Some of the ways to help the community and youth is to return to the community to give back the lessons you have taken away. The lessons learned from hardships must be shared with the youth in order to try and clear their path for success. Thus, decreasing the cycle of recidivism and violence for the next generation. People have been using hip hop as a means of escape from the moment it was created. Throughout the years hip hop has faced a number of criticisms to say the least. The truth is that hip hop is a tool, not a weapon and it can be used to help rebuild communities.   

Why should we donate to you? 

 Just so you know there is a difference between oG and sugar daddy. Lol, we would love to be able to say that we could financially finance all of the events ourselves, but this is just not our reality. The truth is that we could use your help. Whether it be through volunteers or monetary means we appreciate all of your support.   

Our goal is to raise $7,000 in order to purchase production software, recording equipment, promotions/ marketing, and of course to take care of our beloved backers. The funds we are asking for are to make sure that we create an atmosphere that is conducive to our guest, will give us the necessary tools we need to reach out to the youth, and allow us to fulfil our promise to our backers. Our Perks were designed to let you truly be a part of the 4oG's. We don't just want to give you trinkets and toys. We want you to become part of the village. Please check out our perks and join us on making a real change for our youth. 

$2,423.00 https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Rodecas...  

$299.00 https://www.amazon.com/dp/B082VYHHSC/ref=sspa_d...  

$119.99 https://www.amazon.com/Linco-Lincostore-Photo-S...  

$375.00 https://hindenburg.com/products/hindenburg-jour...  

The Community Impact

These numbers are frightening to even look at, but this is what we are facing in our city of Indianapolis, Indiana. We are ranked 12th in the cities of the highest homicide rates. In 2018 there were 171 homicides, and we are at 33 homicides currently just in 2020. In 2019 660 people were killed or wounded by gun fire in our city. We are not naïve in thinking that the 4oG's are the answer to end the violence in our city, but we are willing to do our part to reach out to the youth and go out into the streets from which we come to give back the knowledge and wisdom that we have acquired through our mistakes. We may not be the answer, but we will definitely be a part of the solution.

One of the 4oG’s missions will be to work with the Indiana Educational board and other educational programs to help introduce basic criminal justice courses for 7th through 12th grades. Maybe it’s what our children don’t know that is getting them into trouble.  

Working closely with programs like M.U.M (Made Up Minds) to ensure that the individuals that are placed on work release, probation, or parole will be given the necessary tools they need to become productive members of society.   

The 4oG’s are committed to working with local groups, schools, activists, and our community in order to deliver informative and helpful content. We strive to reach the youth and share the knowledge and wisdom we have collected over a lifetime. We hope to become a strong tie between the youth and the programs developed to help them. The 4oG's will be reaching out to mentoring groups such as the bloomProjectinc.org  in order to place young people with the right groups and mentors to ensure better success.  

Indiana has done a wonderful job working with our youth and collaborating with programs throughout our state in order to bring more caring individuals and programs together to create change and invest in our youth. The 4oG’s hope to be a part of that change and work right alongside the true pioneers of this amazing journey. One of the benefits of becoming an oG is that you meet a lot of good people along your journey that are willing to help your mission.   

 How did this happen?  

4oG’s podcast is a platform that has never been tried. 9th & Penn Entertainment was created by John Nelson “Five” as an entertainment company to house the 4og’s podcast.   

John Nelson has a true love for helping troubled youth and incarcerated adults. He has mentored incarcerated youth at the Marion County Juvenile Division, holds a BA degree in criminal justice rehabilitative services, and utilized his job as a correctional officer at Indianapolis Re-Entry Educational Facility (IREF) as a platform to help mentor young adults re-entering into society.    

This podcast was created by someone that not only cares about troubled teens but was also a troubled teen and incarcerated adult himself. The knowledge, wisdom, and humor offered by this panel and its guests are sure to be one of a kind and create a positive change for years to come. The guys on this podcast have seen what the streets can do to you first hand if you are caught up in them.

 We hope that by giving these kids the open door for dialog thru their love for hip hop, it will give way to a different type of community activist. Someone who has walked the same streets that these young people are dying on. No we are not politically correct, we are not religion driven, we are not wanting to run for office, we are not here to show face,  and WE WILL NOT DIVERT FROM WHAT WE CAME TO DO!

This is our city and our children, and we will not give up on them.  

Go Run Tell That!

Any help offered will be most greatly appreciated. Monetary means are not the only way to support the 4oG’s, you can also help us by spreading the word to your family, friends, and community that the 4oG’s are coming! We appreciate any support that you may be able to offer and that includes your precious time. So, tell someone about us, send us your ideas, help us find sponsors, SHARE US ON SOCIAL MEDIA, and most importantly just support us! We believe that the wave of support that we receive will give this vessel the proper push it needs to head out to battle.

story:
What This Is

The Dragoning is a podcast that takes place in the not so distant future, wherein there is an epidemic of women turning into dragons. It's fictional, don't worry, even if right at this moment a strange epidemic feels a little weirdly possible. So in the middle of a pandemic, we're going to make a show about a dragon epidemic. Here's what we're going to do:

  • Hire actors, musicians, visual artists and designers, many of who have had their work pulled out from under them
  • Create a community-made project in a moment where we cannot be in rooms together
  • Share a story that a lot of us are hungry for 

Your support of the podcast will not only get you the feminist dragon content you've been dreaming of, it will also help get artists meaningful work at a time when there is none.  

What We Need & What You Get

How will this work? Actors will record their text at home, using their home recording set-ups. Musicians will record music at home. Visual Artists will create images for the show in their homes. We need to pay each and every one of them, as well as a sound designer to help us create the atmosphere of this world and an audio engineer to help us navigate this independent recording situation. 

  • We're planning on paying everyone the SAG podcast day rate, which is $200. We need at least 10 actors. We also need to pay a composer, sound designer and audio engineer to help us get each of our 18 episodes sounding good.
  • Donors will get access to the podcast long before the general public. Other perks include thank you notes, stickers, audio thank you on the podcast and maybe even some visual artist designed merch. Also - we're a non-profit, so you also get a tax deduction! 

The Impact

Many of us feel helpless, scared and trapped as the world changes so dramatically around us. As theatre practitioners, our entire art form, the one we've dedicated our whole lives to, has been ripped away from us. To have a juicy creative project to work on will be incredibly meaningful to a lot of artists whose lives have always depended on making theatre. 

  • Whether you want to hear a new engaging podcast about dragons or want to support some artists who not only need financial support but a creative project or both, your donation will help us help a lot of people. 
  • We've made so much theatre to be performed in live spaces, with live human beings in a live experience and now it's time for to experiment with a new form. Emily has made two solo podcasts without any funding. This one needs some financial wind under its sails but making it and setting it up will be a piece of cake. We got this. 
  • We're continually looking for ways to include more people, to bring excitement and creative spark to as many people as possible. As this project evolves, we're sure there will be more community driven aspects.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       Risks & Challenges

Making things from afar is not easy. None of us know how to do social distance creativity. It is unprecedented. Our audio will inevitably be a little uneven due to being recorded in multiple locations by multiple people without audio engineers to organize us. It requires a lot of independent performance without other actors and no director in the room. We're going to be cobbling together a lot of disparate elements into one cohesive story. It will not be easy. But we're up for the challenge and we're going to bring you along with us for the ride. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It is not an easy time for a lot of people to give a donation, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can add your voice to the collection for the titles: https://www.speakpipe.com/TheDragoning
  • You can share this campaign with your social networks.
  • And if you're an artist that wants to contribute your artistry to this project, let us know!
story_txt:
What This Is
The Dragoning is a podcast that takes place in the not so distant future, wherein there is an epidemic of women turning into dragons. It's fictional, don't worry, even if right at this moment a strange epidemic feels a little weirdly possible. So in the middle of a pandemic, we're going to make a show about a dragon epidemic. Here's what we're going to do:

Hire actors, musicians, visual artists and designers, many of who have had their work pulled out from under them
Create a community-made project in a moment where we cannot be in rooms together
Share a story that a lot of us are hungry for 

Your support of the podcast will not only get you the feminist dragon content you've been dreaming of, it will also help get artists meaningful work at a time when there is none.  

What We Need & What You Get
How will this work? Actors will record their text at home, using their home recording set-ups. Musicians will record music at home. Visual Artists will create images for the show in their homes. It will not be easy. But we're up for the challenge and we're going to bring you along with us for the ride. 
Other Ways You Can Help
It is not an easy time for a lot of people to give a donation, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

You can add your voice to the collection for the titles: https://www.speakpipe.com/TheDragoning

You can share this campaign with your social networks. 
And if you're an artist that wants to contribute your artistry to this project, let us know!

story:
About the Campaign 

 

Why Contribute 

Contributing to this campaign will help launch and grow the  ‘Hot Drinks - Adventures Stories From the Field’ podcast. The podcast will highlight the best stories from outdoor education instructors from organizations like NOLS and Outward Bound.

Your contribution will help these outstanding stories be shared around the globe! 

The concept of the podcast is to have outdoor educators share the best stories from their days leading expeditions. The idea came to me a few months ago when I was telling my kids (another) bedtime story from an expedition I led. It made me think--wouldn't it be great if there was a platform for audiences to hear myself and all kinds of other instructors that have led outdoor education expeditions?

Apparently, the concept of a NOLS Instructor podcast, sharing stories from the field, has come up many times in the past but has never come to fruition. Now is the time to make this idea a reality.

Looking back at my outdoor education career, some of the best times were over a hot drink with an instructor team in camp sharing epic stories or sitting in a staff house with an adult beverage or a pint of ice cream after a course swapping tales from the field. This podcast aims to recreate those feelings while sharing these adventurous, impactful, educational, and funny stories with the world. 

Hot Drinks podcast will be the hub of these outstanding stories.

This podcast is very much a passion project that will need funding to launch and be maintained.

About Shawn  

I am Shawn Stratton, the guy behind the ‘Hot Drinks - Adventure Stories From the Field’ podcast. I worked in Outdoor Education for 15 years, including 9 with NOLS, gaining over 2000 nights in the field on expeditions around the world.

After leaving the outdoor education industry in 2009, I earned a Master’s degree in Leadership. Since 2007 I have worked as a professional speaker and corporate leadership consultant and author. In 2013 I published my first book TEAMS ON THE EDGE highlighting leadership lessons from six significant stories from my career at NOLS.


In 2018 I founded the International Vegan Film Festival & World Tour and in 2019 I launched the Plant-Based Profits Show podcast.

These days I am still active in the outdoors, mostly with mini family adventures, cross country skiing, and trail running. I have completed 2 Ironman triathlons and in 2019 I completed my first 100-mile trail run in the Canadian Rockies.

I live in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada with my wife and 3 girls (3, 7 & 9). 

 

How will your contribution be used?

I am looking to cover the costs of making the podcast. 

Here's the breakdown of our $4,068 goal:

Equipment: 

Fortunately, I already have all of the equipment needed already including: 

Computer: $1200

Microphone: $100

Headphones: $50

Pop Filter/Wind Screen: $55

Microphone Boom Arm/Mic Stand: Low: $50

Shock Mount: $40

Computer Monitor: $150

Total $1645

Items that campaign funding would cover include:

Hosting:

Podcast Hosting Service Monthly Plan:

$240/year (Libsyn) 

Website Hosting

$168/year (Wix)

Website Development 

Donated (for now)

Audio Editing: 

$2880/year ($60 per show, 4 shows a month)

Writing/editing show notes

$240/year

Additional Costs:

Cover Art: Donated

Intro/Outro Creation:

$100

Zoom Subscription 

$150/year

Calendar Scheduler

$96/year (Calendly)

Crowdfunding Platform Fees - $194.00

Indiegogo charges a 5% platform fee, as well as a credit card charging fee on each payment. This is an estimate of what it will end up being (and if those costs end up being less, it'll go towards hosting!).

Minimum funding required to cover costs:

$4068

But what if we raise all of that?

Once we hit our goal of $4,068, we've got some very exciting stretch goals in-store including!

Creating or contributing to a NOLS or Outward Bound scholarship fund

Creating merchandise to give to some donors and have available for purchase 

Creating a book highlighting stories from the podcast 

Posting interviews in video format on YouTube or other platforms
 

What if the $4068 does not get raised?
 

I will self-fund the podcast for a few months or along as I can with the hope of attracting some funding or sponsorship. If the funding goal is not reached the podcast may not be able to continue. 

 

What You Get 

Contribute $1-$49 you will receive eternal gratitude and the pleasure of listening to incredible expedition stories from around the world by like-minded people. 

Contribute over $50 you will receive the audiobook of my bestselling TEAMS ON THE EDGE book (not currently available to the public).

Contribute over $100 you will receive a signed paperback copy (free shipping) and the audio version of TEAMS ON THE EDGE and get mentioned on a podcast as a show supporter 

Contribute over $1000 receive a signed paperback copy and the audio version of TEAMS ON THE EDGE and get mentioned on every podcast for 6 months as a show supporter.  Of course, you can remain anonymous as well. 

Track Record 

I am a self-starter and have never been afraid to take the lead on new projects. This will be my 3rd podcast so the learning curve will be limited. I currently host the Plant-Based Profits podcast and several years ago I hosted the Home Office Dad podcast. Other projects I have started from scratch include the Paradise Triathlon (St. John’s, NL), writing TEAMS ON THE EDGE book, and starting the International Vegan Film Festival. 

Risks & Challenges

There is a very low risk involved with this campaign. 

Not finding enough guests 

If we do not reach our fundraising goal the quality of the podcast may suffer as there will be cutbacks to the production costs i.e. audio editing, show notes, social media marketing

There is a small chance of equipment failure (mic, computer, etc) causing unexpected expenses in order to continue the podcast 

Family or other unforeseen emergencies could use up time carved out to record interviews and produce the show. Despite the pandemic causing 2 of my 3 kids to be schooling from home right now, I believe I have the time to take on this meaningful project. As the pandemic subsides and the Fall of 2021 rolls around I will have all 3 kids in school and even more time to focus in this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell all your friends and family who you think may be interested in listening to the podcast and supporting this campaign. 
Offer help with social media management, audio editing, writing simple show notes, etc.

And that's all there is to it, thank you so much for your support!! 

Shawn
