story:
Brief Summary

Four Elements is in essence a storytelling podcast. This story is told via roleplaying, using a game system developed just for this project called Destiny RPG. The podcast features a diverse, queer cast of characters navigating deadly obstacles in an intricate world filled with danger and supernatural power. 

The World

The Land of Mezara has a human history spanning 1000 years, from the time the refugee tribes first set foot on Mezaran soil, fleeing from that which they had left behind. Since then humanity has expanded over the once-wild land, inhabited previously only by spirits and wildlife. Cultures formed, empires rose and fell. Most notable among these empires was Zhougo, also known as the Earth Empire. Today's calendars are dated from the fall of this Empire, which spanned Mezara's largest continent. This marks the start date of the podcast's timeline as 118 years After the Empire, or 118 AE. 

Listen to a few minute Lore Episode at https://anchor.fm/fourelements/episodes/The-Lor... for more on the world.

The Overarching Story

Four Elements tells a universal story about the role humanity has in the fundamental balance of nature, and how it effects us all when that balance is broken. 

It is a cautionary tale of the rise of fascism in times of great crisis, and the role that hope plays in both giving rise to and defeating evil.

Through storytelling, we strive to approach real-world issues in a setting that is completely disparate from the real world.

The Personal Story

Four Elements follows a cast of young heroes on a journey of self discovery, exploring the relationships between people forced into an impossible situation. 

The story explores the boundaries between hero and antihero, asking the difficult questions that come with heroic figures.

Moments of great strength and of great weakness accompany moments of levity, a reminder that laughter can be found in the hardest of times.

The Cast

Tommy Schuberth (he/him) is the Creator, Storyteller, Editor, and Game Developer for Four Elements. Born and raised in Chicago, Tommy has always been fascinated by stories. He also has a background in theatre, music, and gaming, all of which have been combined to create Four Elements. At 20 years old, this is his first professional project, which he has been working on for the past year. Tommy can be found @WaywardTommy on Twitter.

Aram Vartian (he/him) is a producer, writer, and game designer from Washington, D.C. He writes and edits the actual play podcasts Godsfall and Rise of the Demigods, and is planning a superhero podcast called Eveolution Earth for late 2020. Aram can be found @vartian on Twitter.

Kari Betton (they/them) is an arts educator, actor, music composer, and audio engineer for independent films and games. They hold their Master of Fine Arts from Columbia College Chicago. Their most recent collaborations have been with Storycatchers Theatre, Steppenwolf Theatre, and the Chicago Lyric Opera. In their spare time they love computer programming, hiphop dance, raising plants, and volunteering with local mental health centers. 

Arvey Basa (he/him) has played D&D and other ttrpgs most of his life. He recently made his podcasting debut as Janus de Cassiel in Rise of the Demigods. Arvey has a background in Classical and Ancient Greek archaeology, and has a passion for researching and developing fantasy worlds steeped in ancient real-world cultures. Arvey can be found @TheEscapistRPG on Twitter.

Seraphina Violet Cueller (they/them) is a playwright, director, and performance artist. They enjoy producing avant-garde and absurdist works rooted in activism and post-modern philosophy. They have worked in productions with Runaway Labs, High Concept Labs, and No Nation Tangential Space, and are a resident poet at several local poetry events. They are a proud member at the Pilsen Art House, where they host storytelling events and emcee for the Pilsen Unplugged series. Seraphina can be found @seraphinavioletcueller on instagram.

Budget Breakdown

Overall Budget: $3800, plus the 5% for IndieGogo = $3990

Total Actor Budget: $1260

  • Team Unity: $15 per episode with 3 actors for 13 episodes = $585
  • Team Peace: $15 per episode with 3 actors for 13 episodes = $585
  • Intro Episodes: $15 per episode with 1 actor for 6 episodes = $90

Total Art Budget: $1440

  • Map of Mezara: $750
  • Character Art: $115 per character for 6 characters = $690

Total Editing Budget: $1100

  • Editor/Storyteller Pay: $960 for 29 episodes
  • Music Loops: $80
  • Reaper Software: $60

Levels of Support

Acolyte

"Those who choose to join The Order of the Allweaver must first become an Acolyte, a trainee who assists and learns from the Disciples of The Order in order to become a working member."

As an Acolyte,

  • you get your name listed in the Four Elements Book (Coming 2021) as one of the early patrons of the project. 
  • HD versions of all 6 pieces of Character Art. (Coming Early 2020)
  • HD Worldmap, depicting the world of Mezara in all its glory.

Disciple

"Disciples are the every day members of The Order. They spread the word, and will fight in the armies of the Allweaver when the time comes."

As a Disciple, you get all rewards from previous levels as well as 

  • A personal thank you on the podcast,
  • Early Access to the PDF for "Destiny: Four Elements", the TTRPG Game System developed for the podcast,
  • Small metal pin with Four Elements Logo.

Adherent

"Adherents are the veterans of The Order. They will serve as officers in the Allweaver's armies, and each Adherent has sworn to die in the name of defeating That Which Comes. Adherents conduct rituals to strengthen Mezara's connection to the spirit realm, having practiced these rites over the course of their entire lives to attempt to undo the damage humanity has done."

As an Adherent, you get all rewards from previous levels as well as 

  • White T-Shirt depicting the Four Elements Logo,
  • Blooper reel from all episode recording sessions.

Elder

"Elders are the Elite of The Order, forming the core of the Allweaver's advisers and teachers. The title of Elder is only granted to the most worthy Adherents, those who have truly devoted their lives to The Cause."

As an elder, you receive all rewards from previous levels as well as

  • Limited access to learn the Destiny: Four Elements TTRPG from the storyteller himself in a 4-player oneshot where you will get to create your own character within the world. 

​If you would like someone else to play in the oneshot in your place, just email fourelementspod@gmail.com with the person's info.

The Game

Destiny RPG is a tabletop roleplaying game system developed by Tommy Schuberth, Creator of Four Elements. This system uses elements of chance and character building to create an environment built for improvised storytelling. 

Destiny focuses on Heroes, who are essentially any character with a full set of stats. Heroes accumulate Destiny over time, which allows them to reach new Levels of Destiny and become more powerful and skilled. 

Destiny uses d8s, d6s, and d4s to represent the three main categories of statistic: Essence, Abilities, and Skills. Each of the 3 Essences, (Mind, Body, Spirit) have two Abilities which stem from them, and each of the 6 abilities have two Skills which stem from them, resulting in 12 skills total.

Each roll uses the relevant Essence dice (d8s), Ability Dice (d6s), and Skill Dice (d4s). On any die, a result of 4 or higher is a success. An 8 is a double success. The number of successes compared to the difficulty of the check decides to what degree the Hero was successful.

The Gamebook for Destiny: Four Elements is in development, and will be launched in 2021.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on Twitter @FourElementsPod
  • Follow our creator on Twitter @WaywardTommy
  • Share this page on your social media of choice
  • Visit https://anchor.fm/fourelements for the podcast feed! Subscribe and review on your favorite podcasting app
  • Get the word out!

story:
"Through the case files of a young witch, we are shown a truly, scientific and holistic approach to solving the traumas of everyday life. This show also beautifully builds a world outward, creating a specifically designed world around this witch who has been cast out by her coven and is, herself, healing from her own secret traumas. This show is magic- I'm sorry, magick. Highly recommend."

"I am in absolute awe of how much time and passion and dedication has been put into this show. Lisette Alvarez must be a witch of the highest order with how spellbinding her tales is. Just. Gods, this show is incredible. It is beautiful. It is wholesome. It is heart wrenching. It is truly beyond beyond. Thank you, Lisette, for all your tireless warmth and dedication. You made my world a better place with your craft."

"It’s not often that I find a show that I think will sit in the same place in my heart as Welcome to Night Vale, or King Falls Am, or the Bright Sessions. Kalila Stormfire, appropriately enough, just stole my heart away. I’ve fallen head over heels with this show: with its creativity, and its humanity, its humour and its drama. I just can’t wait for more!"

 

About the Project

My name is Lisette Alvarez. I am a queer, Latinx creator passionate about spreading magick and supporting creativity wherever I can find it--including within myself. Kalila Stormfire was my small, personal creative experiment that exploded into an invaluable part of my life. The show that I wrote, acted, produced, and marketed all by myself became something that has generated over 60,000 downloads in less than a year. 

Kalila Stormfire's first season focused on the character's struggles against a mysterious saboteur hellbent on ruining her magick business. The second season forces Kalila to venture out into the greater world of the city of Brushland, where a larger power struggle is at play. Season 2 premieres February 2019. 

The idea for this story came about because yes, I--like Kalila--am a brown, queer witch. While many of the practices, potions, and spells are entirely fictional, they are based in some version of the truth. I’ve picked up plenty of juicy, witchy, storytelling-worthy notes in my years studying and practicing witchcraft, mysticism, the occult, and folk religions. 

I have on-boarded a cast of incredibly talented voice actors--some very new to audio drama and other seasoned professionals in the podcasting sphere. I have also hired a sound designer who will give me more time to focus on writing, directing, and shaping the story. 

What We Need

I believe in paying creators and artists fair wages. I am an indie producer, so I am limited to what I can personally provide. 

Actors are paid $75 for features like character mini-episodes and supporting roles during at least half of a full episode, and $20-40 for small features like 1-2 short scenes or lines in a full episode. In order to keep cast list short so people can receive a decent paycheck from this project, most actors will be asked to play multiple roles. Luckily, Patreon funds most of the cast wages. 

Our sound designer, Sarah Buchynski, will be paid $100-$150 per episode. 

Ideally, I would like to pay myself for my work. I put around 8-10 hours of writing and acting per episode. I also work as the sole marketer, from pushing merch to engaging with folks on social media about 5 hours per week. In total, that's about 15 hours per episode. According to where I live, in the DC-area, living wage would be about $17 per hour. Just paying myself would add up to about $255 per episode. 

In total, my goal is to fully fund the sound design for Season 2, create a buffer for the actor wages, and possibly raise some funds to pay myself.

That is why the goal is set for $3,000. Any additional funds raised will be evenly split between raising the actor's wages, sound design wages, producer wages, and savings towards Season 3. 

Now For The Fun Stuff: Rewards

I have developed a number of incredible rewards in order to thank you for your support. 

Sigil Tokens

These hand-burned wooden tokens will be etched with a special sigil for protection. 

Buttons and Stickers

You will receive one of three designs for your sticker and button!

Official Show Art Prints

I have teamed up with an incredible artist to illustrate Kalila Stormfire. Marion is a non-binary Filipinx artist and animator in LA. You can follow them on  Twitter @marion_draws and see their other work on their website: https://mariondrawsart.carbonmade.com/.

Kalila Stormfire's Grimoire

That's right! You will have a hand-bound grimoire filled with Kalila's favorite meditations, spells, and tricks. 

Personalized Spell Bag

Do you need an extra boost for creativity? Maybe you travel a lot? Do you wish for sweet dreams? My handmade spellbags will be tailored to your needs.

Virtual Tarot Reading

Want to meet a witch face to face? Well, with this perk you will receive a personalized tarot reading from me, Lisette Alvarez, over video/phone chat!

Risks & Challenges

Of course, there's always a risk in any production. Whether it is pushed deadlines for episode releases due to external circumstances (i.e. a car crash involving an actor...which happened last season) or delays in shipment of rewards. However, I am committed to being transparent about the process to my patrons, supporters, and cast & crew. I have a production newsletter to keep my cast & crew updated on any changes. My patrons on Patreon can also attest that I will address any issues with rewards as soon as possible, including issues with shipping (i.e. pins being lost in the mail...which has also happened). 

If we don't reach the stretch goal of $3,000, I will not be taking a paycheck from this campaign. If we don't reach the goal of $2,000 to safely pay for all the sound design and incidental acting costs of the season--I will likely have to go back to doing a chunk of the sound design myself. The current income generated from Patreon covers paying the cast so far. At worst, I will have to pay the actors out of pocket.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want other special rewards and access to bonus content, consider becoming a supporter on Patreon! You can also find awesome merch (shirts, hoodies, bags, journals, and more) in our TeePublic store. 

I definitely understand that some people just can't contribute financially and that's super okay. There are other ways you can help!

  • Share this campaign to your friends and family! Even if they aren't listeners, you never know who may need a spellbag or an insightful tarot reading. 
  •  Listen to the show and share your love on social media! You can follow on Twitter and Tumblr @kalilastormfire. We love hearing from listeners!

Finally: thank you.

This show would not have gotten this far without listeners and supporters like you.

May your world be filled with just a little more magick than before.

story:
*Scroll down for English version*
 

Mi a Szabad Pécs?

Független híroldal, ahol betartjuk a szakmailag megalapozott újságírás követelményeit és szeretünk műfajokkal kísérletezni. Elsősorban Pécsre, Baranyára, Dél-Dunántúlra koncentrálunk, de számos országos jelentőségű üggyel is foglalkoztunk, foglalkozunk.

Ahogy bizonyára Te is tudod, a független újságírás helyzete egyre nehezebb, ennek okait rengeteg helyen mások sokkal alaposabban leírták. A szélsőségesen torz magyar hirdetési piacon egyre kevesebb tisztességes kiadvány tud megélni. Már ott tartunk, hogy nagy múltú, nagy elérésű szakmai műhelyek is sokszor közvetlen olvasói támogatásra szorulnak. 

Mi is tennénk a dolgunkat, nem panaszkodunk, megoldást keresünk. Ennek egyik módja, hogy segítséget kérünk tőletek.

Segítsetek nekünk, hogy az elkövetkező évben nyugodtan dolgozhassunk!

Eddig is támogatásokból működött a Szabad Pécs (amit, ezúton is köszönünk), azonban ez ebben a formában már nem fenntartható. A rendes működéshez ennek a kampánynak a sikerére, hirdetési bevételekre, és pályázati finanszírozásra is szükség van. Mindhárom szempontból bizakodóak vagyunk. 

Mit kérünk? 

Ahhoz, hogy a munkakörülményeink az alapvető minimumoknak megfeleljenek számításaink szerint évente 13-15 millió forintra van szükség. Ebből nagyjából két főállású, egy mellékállású újságíró munkájának a költségeit, adminisztrációs, irodai, technikai és jogi költségeket tudnánk fedezni. A teljes összegnek kicsit több mint a felét, azaz kb. 8 millió forintot szeretnénk a segítségetekkel összegyűjteni.

Ha valamennyivel több jön össze, mint a kitűzött cél, akkor újabb, kisebb projekteket indítunk, hogy jobban elérjük a potenciális olvasóinkat. De konkrét terveink vannak arra az esetre  is, ha a kitűzött célunknál lényegesen több jön össze -- ebben az esetben újabb kiadványokat indítanánk az ország más régióiban.

Miért itt?

Az Indiegogo rengeteg hasonló projektnek segített már elindulni, fennmaradni. Azért választottuk a közösségi finanszírozásnak ezt a formáját, mert szeretnénk, ha a kampány eredménye nyilvános és átlátható lenne. Még akkor is, ha ennek költségei vannak.

Nehézségek?

Na, azok vannak.

Hogyan segíthetsz még?

Ha nem tudsz anyagilag hozzájárulni a kampányhoz, de egyetértesz a céljainkkal, kérünk, hogy oszd meg ismerőseiddel a videónkat és ezt a kampányoldalt.

Minden támogatást köszönünk!

*About Szabad Pécs*

Szabad Pécs (Free Pécs) is an independent, news site in Pécs, Hungary. We focus mainly on local, regional issues but we often have breaking news that enter the national news cycle. The site was founded in 2017 by ex-journalists of the daily Dunántúli Napló after Prime Minister Viktor Orbán's old friend Lőrinc Mészáros bought the publisher Mediaworks, one of Hungary's biggest media enterprises.

You can gather information about the desperate situation of press freedom in Hungary from many sources. The story of Szabad Pécs has been covered by several international news outlets including German, French, American, Finnish etc. sites.

We don't complain, we only would like to do our job. And we are looking for solutions.

The site was operated until now exclusively by micro donations, and we are very thankful for the support, but this model isn't sustainable anymore. That's why we ask for help.

What do we ask for?

According to our business plan we need about 50,000 USD (or 47,000 EUR) to cover the costs of 2 full time and 1 part time journalists, utilities, legal expenses etc. We ask for a little bit more than half of this amount during the campaign, since we believe that advertising and third party funding can help us with the other half.

What if we can collect more?

We would start new mini projects to reach our audience even better. And we have a plan for kickstarting similar outlets around Hungary if we can get significantly more funding.

Why Indiegogo?

Because it helped a lot of similar projects to achieve their goals. And we did choose this platform because its transparency and trustworthiness.

How you can help?

You can help us achieving our funding goal by donating as little as the price of a coffee, but we are also very thankful if you could share this campaign and our story.

Thanks!

Thanks!

story:
The Arbitration Station is a podcast about international arbitration with co-hosts Brian Kotick and Joel Dahlquist Cullborg. It covers both investment and commercial arbitration. It is a perfect blend of 66% serious substance and 33% of general ponderings and musings of the arbitration world.  

There is no other podcast that focuses exclusively on international arbitration. This podcast is the first of its kind. With one lawyer with firm experience, and one lawyer working to finish a PhD, the podcast blends both theoretical and practical points of view in an entertaining and informal manner.

In the preliminary stages of this podcast, the hosts have used moderately professional recording equipment and edited the episodes themselves. However, in order to ensure the marketability of the podcast to an international listening base, the podcast requires a few additional resources. Although we have already received some funding, the additional amount we estimate that we would need for an amazing season is EUR 5,000. This would help us hire a legal research assistant, a professional editor with proper editing programs, as well as help us promote the podcast at conferences and speaking engagements.

We rely on our listener base for support. In return, you will enjoy being part of a community of arbitration nerds. We will also thank more substantive supporters on air and online, reaching thousands of fellow listeners.

story:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.

Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.

Si no nos conoces 

Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.

O suscribirte en iTunes.

O seguirlo en Spotify.

O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.

Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.

Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.

Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.

Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Santiago, en Chile.

Qué es el No sé, dime tour SANTIAGO

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Santiago de Chile, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de Chile para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.

Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.

A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.

Por qué nosotros

Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.

Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 

Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 

a los Shorty Awards...

Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.

Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.

Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.

Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.

Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.

Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.

No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.

El problema

Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.

Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...

Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.

Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Santiago de Chile nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.

Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 

Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.

Lo que nos hace falta

  • Al menos entre 600 y 850 superdiamantes en cada ciudad  que compren una entrada a un precio súper asequible.
  • Recaudar con la venta de esas entradas al menos $20,000 para ir a Chile.
  • Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
  • Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Cómo lo utilizaremos

  • Alquiler del Teatro (entre 30% y 50% de lo recaudado)
  • Merch
  • Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
  • Alquiler de equipos
  • Honorarios de producción
  • Mercadeo de la gira

Lo que ofrecemos

Además de entradas para que nos acompañes a dejar el corazón en un teatro de la hermosa ciudad de Santiago de Chile en un show que tú mismo crearás con nosotros, tenemos perks para superdiamantes que quieran y puedan contribuir con un poquito más para obtener desde cosas súper especiales como franelas que sólo van a estás disponibles si hacemos el tour, estar en los créditos de la serie como productores, o hasta ser invitados especiales en un podcast con nosotros (¡la pizza corre por nuestra cuenta!).

Por qué te necesitamos

Hemos estado haciendo encuestas. Sé qué nos hemos puesto fastidiosos, pero necesitamos estar 100% seguros de que en las ciudades a las que vamos hay suficientes de ustedes para hacer esto.  

Te necesitamos porque no sólo no tenemos dinero para pagar la gira de nuestro bolsillo, sino porque si no logramos que esta gira pase hay muchísimas cosas que muy probable tendremos que también dejar de hacer.

El reto

Queremos arrancar la gira oficialmente después del 15 de Septiembre, por lo que necesitamos producir todo durante el verano. Por eso debemos recaudar el dinero de cada ciudad en sólo 10 días. De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

La idea es comenzar con una ciudad y si logramos la meta, hacer otra y otra y otra hasta que podamos llegar a la mayor cantidad de ciudades posibles.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Esto es lo que queremos: si logramos hacer al menos 5 ciudades podemos seguir haciendo el podcast.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.

Tal vez no vives en Santiago de Chile, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.

Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.

Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.

¿Contamos contigo?

Maiah y Gabriel
story_txt:
Quienes somos

Hola, somos Maiah y Gabriel, los dos loquitos que desde hace un año hacen No sé, dime tú, un podcast en español para todos aquellos que alguna vez han sentido que no pertenecen.
Todas las semanas nos escuchas desde Colombia, España, Chile, Argentina, Perú, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Cuba, Puerto Rico, Panamá, Canadá, México, Inglaterra, China, Italia, Francia, Estados Unidos y hasta en Bakú, Azerbaijan.
Si no nos conoces 
Lo puedes escuchar completico aquí.
O suscribirte en iTunes.
O seguirlo en Spotify.
O verlo cada semana en wedontbelong,com.
Tenemos un año y más de 50 episodios haciéndolo.
Ahora estamos aquí para que nos ayudes a conocerte en persona.
Para eso inventamos el No sé, dime tour.
Y queremos que una de sus paradas sea la bella ciudad de Santiago, en Chile.
Qué es el No sé, dime tour SANTIAGO

Agarrar nuestras maletas para ir a Santiago de Chile, encontrar un teatro para grabar en vivo nuestro podcast contigo muerto de risa en el público, invitar a un "salmón" famoso de Chile para que se siente con nosotros (si no has escuchado el podcast, no sabes qué es un "salmón"... ¡cambia eso de ti!) y nos deje entrevistarlo para que nos cuente por qué también siente que no pertenece, documentar todo nuestro viaje con un equipo de profesionales audiovisuales de cada ciudad y convertir nuestro pequeño podcast casero en un programa de TV de verdad en el que los protagonistas son los #superdiamantes que nos escuchan en todo el mundo.
Cómo queremos hacerlo

Hacer un programa como este es súper ambicioso. No solo tienes que invertir en la producción del evento, en los pasajes, en el alojamiento, sino también en trabajar con un equipo de profesionales con la experiencia suficiente para garantizar que el resultado final no tenga nada que envidiarle a programas que puedes ver en lugares como Netflix o HBO.
A lo mejor no lo sabes, pero un sólo episodio de un programa así puede llegar a costar cientos de miles de dólares en el mundo real.
Por qué nosotros
Si nos conoces sabes que desde hace años hemos desarrollado proyectos para Youtube, Facebook, Instagram, Snap Inc, Batanga Media, AOL, Microsoft, HLN, Univision, Discovery, NBC Universo, Mitú, Fullscreen, Clevver TV, Broadway Video y marcas como McDonalds, Bud Light, AT&T, Volvo, Ford, Covergirl, Makeup Forever, Best Buy, Target, Google, Johnny Walker, entre muchas otras.
Parte de las cosas que hemos hecho las puedes encontrar aquí. 
Juntos hemos estado nominados a los Streamy Awards 3 veces (más veces que cualquier creador Latino)

 
a los Shorty Awards...
Y hasta teníamos nuestra sección en un noticiero todas las semanas.
Luego creamos este podcast y han hablado de él en E! Entertainment Television, en Radio Caracol, en CNN y hasta nos metieron en la lista de los podcast que definitivament deberías escuchar de la revista Latina.
Pero nada de eso importa tanto como que tú lo veas y escuches cada semana.
Por eso esto queremos llevarlo a otro nivel y hacerlo teniendo control del proyecto y dejando que seas tú mismo quién está detrás de esto.
Queremos algo de superdiamantes para superdiamantes.
Y aunque nosotros somos buenos consiguiendo ayuda y haciendo que cosas de ultra bajo presupuesto se vean bien, aún así necesitamos un monto mínimo para poder llevar el No sé, dime tour a cada país.
No hacemos esto para hacernos millonarios, pero sí creemos que con tu ayuda podríamos hacer algo que nos gusta a nosotros y a ti por muchísimos años más.
El problema
Montar esta producción tiene costos operativos importantes.
Desde conseguir el teatro hasta conseguir alojamiento, los pasajes, grabar, editar todo para que esté al nivel de un programa de televisión...
Así que si vamos a hacerlo, vamos a hacerlo bien y repetir esto en todos los países que podamos.
Pero si nuestros superdiamantes de Santiago de Chile nos han dicho la verdad, no sólo podemos hacer esto sino cualquier cosa.
Tenemos en ustedes todo lo que hace falta para lograrlo. 
Y lo mejor es que podremos seguir escribiendo el libro que lees semana a semana en wedontbelong,com y podemos seguir grabando series como One Girl Show y seguir luchando por nuestros sueños locos en Hollywood.
Lo que nos hace falta

Utilizar parte de ese dinero para producir un evento genial y convertirlo en un episodio de nuestro programa.
Usar el resto para seguir haciendo el podcast y todo nuestro contenido cada semana.

Merch
Logística (Alojamiento, pasajes, transporte, comidas)
Alquiler de equipos
Honorarios de producción
Mercadeo de la gira

De esta forma podemos hacer esta misma campaña en las siguiente ciudad hasta completar todas las que podamos comprometernos a visitar este año.

Como ves, estamos apostándolo todo a esto.

Si no, tendremos que cancelar todo.
Tal vez no vives en Santiago de Chile, pero conoces a alguien que vive allá y que crees que puede gustarle nuestro podcast, pues mándale esta campaña para que vaya por tí.
Luego, cuando le toque a tu ciudad ya sabes lo que tienes que hacer.
Y así hasta que los superdiamantes conquistemos el mundo.
¿Contamos contigo?
Maiah y Gabriel

story:
Bella 2017

Bella Caledonia offers fresh thinking for a new Scotland, a forum for challenging ideas giving space to new writers and engaging beyond the narrow confines of the echo chamber. Independence is a process not an event and we will only get there by independent thinking, solidarity and innovation.

We want to create more film and podcast content, and need to pay people to do that. We don't take advertising we want to keep our journalism as open as we can. That's why we need to ask for your help. Bella's takes a lot of time and hard work to produce. 

We currently give you:

  • quality daily articles from a  range of writers on Scottish politics and culture
  • weekly podcasts and music playlists
  • a range of content on social media platforms
  • a monthly print magazine

 

We Need your Support to Develop

Here's what your support can achieve:

  • The funding will be given to very specific projects: supporting a diversity of new writers whilst maintaining the very best analysis and commentary (all with very low overheads) 
  • Build a platform that engages with other new media projects and campaigns, consolidating radical Scotland in one place
  • Reaching out beyond the echo-chamber to a wider and wider audiences
  • Creating a platform for film makers and artists to go beyond text to attention-grabbing film and artwork

The Impact

Without your support the project can't continue. It's been maintained on a shoestring for several months now and desperately needs you to support it:

  • We believe Bella is a crucial part of the media landscape which attracts readers from across the political divide through its quality of writing.
  • We have successfully built and expanded our readership over the past two years on a range of platforms and have been listed as the top blog in Scotland  – and one of the top six in the UK. 
  • Your support is vital - even a small amount would be appreciated.

story: Again, if you haven't already heard why I'm doing this there's probably not much I can write here that will convince you to contribute.

story:
Short Summary

I am a comic book writer, author, and screenwriter trying something new. For more than a year, I've had a story idea in my head that harkens back to my love of 80's science-fiction movies (ALIEN, ALIENS, THE TERMINATOR, THE ABYSS, THE THING), all of which were (and still are) major creative inspirations for me. 

The story became DERELICT, which followed a "Dirty Dozen" style group of scientists and engineers -- all people at the end of their respective roads, each seeking redemption where they can find it. Their desperate straits lead them to accept a dangerous contract: explore a mysterious derelict spacecraft that has been found in an unexplored star system, unravel its mysteries, and bring it back to human space. 

The frightening realities of what they find there, however, are not what any of them expect.

As the story formed, it wasn't something that seemed like a new novel (it felt like it should be more visceral than that) and it wasn't something I wanted to just sell as a script and be done with.

This is when the idea of doing the story as a narrative podcast occurred, which was very compelling.

 

The most exciting part was the idea of being able to take an audience on a journey with the characters. With just creative imagination, sound (and your eyes closed) listeners can viscerally experience the exploration of the ship. And the fact that a majority of the story is told through the "radio communications" of the team, makes it feel all the more real, like you're listening in to events as they transpire. 

We hope you as a fan of good science fiction, or just good stories in general, will help bring it to life...

The Story

Thirty seven hours ago, the IWS Crichton discovered the remains of a derelict vessel in an unexplored star system. 

Eleven hours ago, all contact with the Crichton and her crew was lost...​

When the galaxy's most powerful corporation discovers that the derelict ship belongs to them, they send the only people they can, a group of washed up engineers and scientists who would do anything to reconstruct their shambled lives.

Their objective: find out what happened to the crew of the Crichton, and bring the derelict back...at any cost.​

But, as they soon learn, there are some mysteries that should remain buried. And there are some things lost that should never be found.

Where We Are

We have recorded and produced the first episode from our first season, and it will officially premiere August 24th, at the Science Fiction and Fantasy Convention Bubonicon, in Albuquerque, NM. But you can listen to it right now, using the video version in the media gallery at the top of this page, or by visiting the DERELICT website. 

We recorded the first episode in my basement office, which was converted into a sound studio for episode one.

 

While this served its purpose to get us where we are, to continue to do this story in the way it deserves to be done, we are going to need a few things...

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for an initial investment budget of $30,000. But where does all that money go... 

Roughly half of the investment will help us form our production studio where we can record all our actors at once. This means:

  • Five separate Rode based microphone stations, with sound dampening enclosures
  • A new USB audio processor that can handle that many stations
  • Sound proofing
  • Studio space rental, including utilities
  • All the little necessary odds and ends - cabling, headphones, speakers, mic stands, boom arms, script stands, lighting, storage, printing paper, chairs, desks, you get the idea.

Having this space will enable us to not only produce other seasons of DERELICT, but eventually other stories as well.

As far as the second half of the budget, any story is only as strong as the performers in it, so it's imperative that we cast accomplished actors and actresses. In my biased opinion, I would say we knocked it out of the park in this regard. You can read more about our amazing cast below, but the remainder of our budget will go to taking care of them. Here's why:

  • Many of our actors are not local, and will require travel expenses for the production.
  • Our two actresses are Screen Actors Guild (SAG) members, which increases their pay rate significantly, and requires contributions to health care and the purchasing of production insurance. 
  • Because we respect those pursuing artistic and creative lives and careers, we want to pay all of our actors the same rate as those who are SAG.

In addition to the budget allotted for our performers, we have other expenses:

  • Music and effects licensing and creation
  • Marketing
  • Craft services

So, what do you get out of helping us make our goal? We have some great perks to contributing, no question, but the main thing you get is DERELICT itself.

We are trying to do something pretty unique; bring exciting, high-concept, feature film level genre experiences to the audio format. If you're a fan of genre stories like the movies I mentioned above, you're going to love DERELICT. And you're going to want to see this story not just come into the world...but continue to grow and develop.

All I ask is that you listen to episode one yourself, and then see how you feel after that. 

The Cast and Team

Everyone involved on this project is passionate about seeing it completed. Our actors have already traveled on their own expense to New Mexico to record the first episode, and deferred their own payments. It will happen one way or another, but you have an opportunity to help us make it happen in the best form possible.

J. Barton Mitchell - Creator

J. Barton Mitchell is a writer and photographer living in Santa Fe, NM. As a writer, he’s developed properties for Warner Bros, Twenty First Century Fox, Sony, Valve Software, and Boom! Studios, and is a published author of four novels. His third novel, VALLEY OF FIRES was awarded Best Science Fiction Novel of 2015 by the RT Book Review, and his fourth novel, THE RAZOR, was published by TOR Books in November. 

Kirsten Rudberg - Producer

Kirsten is a writer and producer, working on both her Masters of Divinity...and the final edits of her book, WE RULE THE WORLD for Microcosm Publishing. A journeywoman, she is a published essay writer, has worked with Dave Eggers at THE DAILY ILLINI, and, besides DERELICT, is currently developing a web series, a TV series, a graphic novel and a little bagatelle of a book series. In short, she's very busy. 

Chad Morgan - Raynor

Chad Morgan has been fortunate enough to have worked in film and television for the last twenty-five years. 

Her first film was opposite Emilio Estevez in THE WAR AT HOME, and her first starring role was in the Sundance Film Festival sweetheart and coming-of-age film WHATEVER. Since then, she's worked with Michael Bay (PEARL HARBOR), for Steven Spielberg (the SyFy channel mini-series TAKEN), alongside Seth McFarlane (FAMILY GUY), and has played a plethora of pop culture icons (and a few Popsicle sticks) on ROBOT CHICKEN and ROBOT CHICKEN: STAR WARS.

Michael Mau - Blayne

Michael Mau is a writer, teacher, father, runner, actor, tinkerer, artist, and snappy dresser. 

His short fiction has appeared in Black Warrior Review, Portland Review, Fifth Wednesday, Mount Hope, Jelly Bucket, Firewords Quarterly, and other places. 

Michael’s various voices can be heard in BIG SANDY, a narrative podcast based on the novel of the same name; the audiobook HOBO-COP; as well as many radio and television spots. On screen, he's been featured in the films OUR SCRIPTED LIFE, FATHERLESS, and LAST HOLLER. 

Dani Payne - Freed

Dani Payne is an actor, singer, and business coach who has recently moved her life to Albuquerque, NM. She has over 10 years of acting experience and has studied her craft all over the world; Vancouver, Los Angeles, and, most recently, Glasgow, UK. Dani can been seen in numerous television shows, such as THE NIGHT SHIFT, GRAVES, and CHAMBERS, as well as the films REMEMBERING US and THE SHORT HISTORY OF THE LONG ROAD which made its debut at the Tribeca International Film Festival. 

Ian Geiberger - Chambers

Ian Geiberger lives for making sounds people want to hear. He is a Los Angeles/San Diego-based electronic/hip-hop producer, voiceover artist, illustrator and graphic/sound designer. 

J.D. Cerna - Stevens

J. D. Cerna is the voice of Beau Handsome on the Emmy winning animated series WORDGIRL which also stars Maria Bamford. His solo show NOT AS CUTE PICTURE has been performed in several American cities and was nominated for a GLAAD Media Award. Cerna has also appeared in the 1988-89 Troma horror film THE DEAD COME HOME, performed twin brothers in the Miramax feature LIE DOWN WITH DOGS, and played the lead role of Jack in the film ALKALI, IOWA, opposite Mary Beth Hurt.

"Gus" - Consultant

Little is known about the mysterious "Gus" (if that really is his name). Former covert operative? International assassin? Renowned jewel thief? It's safer not to ask. What's less understood (and shrouded in secrecy) are the shadowy contributions he makes to the DERELICT podcast. But it's fairly clear his paw prints are all over the production...

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight for a lot of people. We totally understand that.  Sharing our campaign on your social media accounts and helping us spread the word would go a long way to helping us achieve our goal.  If you enjoyed episode one, and want to hear more, please click that little "share" button on our campaign page and let the world know.

J. Barton Mitchell - Creator


J. Barton Mitchell is a writer and photographer living in Santa Fe, NM. As a writer, he’s developed properties for Warner Bros, Twenty First Century Fox, Sony, Valve Software, and Boom! Studios, and is a published author of four novels. His third novel, VALLEY OF FIRES was awarded Best Science Fiction Novel of 2015 by the RT Book Review, and his fourth novel, THE RAZOR, was published by TOR Books in November. 
Kirsten Rudberg - Producer

Kirsten is a writer and producer, working on both her Masters of Divinity...and the final edits of her book, WE RULE THE WORLD for Microcosm Publishing. A journeywoman, she is a published essay writer, has worked with Dave Eggers at THE DAILY ILLINI, and, besides DERELICT, is currently developing a web series, a TV series, a graphic novel and a little bagatelle of a book series. In short, she's very busy. 
Chad Morgan - Raynor

Chad Morgan has been fortunate enough to have worked in film and television for the last twenty-five years. 
Her first film was opposite Emilio Estevez in THE WAR AT HOME, and her first starring role was in the Sundance Film Festival sweetheart and coming-of-age film WHATEVER. Since then, she's worked with Michael Bay (PEARL HARBOR), for Steven Spielberg (the SyFy channel mini-series TAKEN), alongside Seth McFarlane (FAMILY GUY), and has played a plethora of pop culture icons (and a few Popsicle sticks) on ROBOT CHICKEN and ROBOT CHICKEN: STAR WARS.
Michael Mau - Blayne

Michael Mau is a writer, teacher, father, runner, actor, tinkerer, artist, and snappy dresser. 
His short fiction has appeared in Black Warrior Review, Portland Review, Fifth Wednesday, Mount Hope, Jelly Bucket, Firewords Quarterly, and other places. 
Michael’s various voices can be heard in BIG SANDY, a narrative podcast based on the novel of the same name; the audiobook HOBO-COP; as well as many radio and television spots. On screen, he's been featured in the films OUR SCRIPTED LIFE, FATHERLESS, and LAST HOLLER. 
Dani Payne - Freed

Dani Payne is an actor, singer, and business coach who has recently moved her life to Albuquerque, NM. She has over 10 years of acting experience and has studied her craft all over the world; Vancouver, Los Angeles, and, most recently, Glasgow, UK. Dani can been seen in numerous television shows, such as THE NIGHT SHIFT, GRAVES, and CHAMBERS, as well as the films REMEMBERING US and THE SHORT HISTORY OF THE LONG ROAD which made its debut at the Tribeca International Film Festival. 
Ian Geiberger - Chambers

Ian Geiberger lives for making sounds people want to hear. He is a Los Angeles/San Diego-based electronic/hip-hop producer, voiceover artist, illustrator and graphic/sound designer. 
J.D. Cerna - Stevens

J. D. Cerna is the voice of Beau Handsome on the Emmy winning animated series WORDGIRL which also stars Maria Bamford. His solo show NOT AS CUTE PICTURE has been performed in several American cities and was nominated for a GLAAD Media Award. Cerna has also appeared in the 1988-89 Troma horror film THE DEAD COME HOME, performed twin brothers in the Miramax feature LIE DOWN WITH DOGS, and played the lead role of Jack in the film ALKALI, IOWA, opposite Mary Beth Hurt.
"Gus" - Consultant

Little is known about the mysterious "Gus" (if that really is his name). Former covert operative? International assassin? Renowned jewel thief? It's safer not to ask. What's less understood (and shrouded in secrecy) are the shadowy contributions he makes to the DERELICT podcast. But it's fairly clear his paw prints are all over the production...

Other Ways You Can Help
We know money is tight for a lot of people. We totally understand that.  Sharing our campaign on your social media accounts and helping us spread the word would go a long way to helping us achieve our goal.  If you enjoyed episode one, and want to hear more, please click that little "share" button on our campaign page and let the world know.

story:
Short Summary

Zocial Network (Generation-Z + Social = Zocial) is a NEW Social Media Platform for people of African descent. Our site will help connect, build-up, promote, and celebrate our users. It is a place where you can connect with friends as well as produce your podcast or other forms of online content. The Zocial Network is a a social media live streaming platform where podcasters, content builders and musicians can share their content in real time. It is a place where you can upload videos, chat with friends, host your podcast and so much more.

example, not actual image

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising money to build, maintain and market the website. We want to make sure the site that once the site goes live, it runs fast and efficiently. And, of course, we want everyone to know it exist. Plus, your funding will help build towards future enhancements - cool new features, such as a marketplace and a streaming channel featuring your content! With your help, we can create an online community that supports and promotes its black users.

The Zocial Network is the ultimate content sharing platform. You can join the community or just chat with friends. If you're a content creator, you can upload your videos and share with the world. Are you podcaster? Share your episodes with the community and the world. Connecting with people who look like you has never been easier.

Features:

  • Live videos for podcasting, vlogs and more
  • Get extra income with Premium Membership/Private Spaces
  • Chat, badges and tips
  • Revenue split from video ads
  • Filters for videos
  • Video conversion, downloading and sharing
  • Marketplace (future development)
     

The Impact

There currently isn’t a social media platforms that focuses on connecting and fostering growth, without unfair censorship and fear of demonetization for people of African descent.

With the social unrest flooding the country, there’s never been a better time to connect and grow. Let’s do this together.

Mission Statement

Our goal is to create a space where people of African descent can network, grow and feel empowered.

 

(Images and features are subject to change)

story:
ALL PROCEEDS  FOR ENTIRE CAMPAIGN WILL BE DONATED TO COURAGE CANADA HOCKEY

 

 

About me

I'm a 42-year-old hockey, travel and podcasting nut who is getting a new project underway.

I've been a hockey fan my whole life. Player and instructor in my formative years, dedicated couch observer in my adult years. Hockey runs through my veins.

For the next seven months or so, I have arranged my schedule so that I have the freedom to be location independent and have the time to put all my energy and passion into this project. I can't wait to get started.

The Journey

 

The adventure begins Sept. 29th, bright and early from Highway 40 on the west island of Montreal.

From there I will hitchhike to Winnipeg for the season opener Wednesday, Oct. 4th. Seeing the country, meeting great people and spreading Leafs love along the way. I'm pumped.

Upon my return, I will recount my trip in a few podcasts episodes, and from there, the skies the limit.

If you are in a position to help, please donate what you can to a great cause. And stay tuned for updates on the VagabondingLeafs Podcast. 

 

Dollars and Cents

 

All proceeds at end of campaign will go to Courage Canada Hockey. GO HOCKEY!

This is going to be a special year in LeafLand, looking forward to meeting you guys out on the road. 

GO LEAFS GO

story:
about from field to skin

from field to skin is the online space for chronicling ash alberg's adventures in the canadian fibreshed. ash highlights canadian fibre farmers, mills, natural dyers, tanners, and other direct-source producers through interviews, a growing google map, shared resources, and patterns using fibreshed yarns.

what's a fibreshed? in a nutshell, it's the local food movement but for textiles. in a larger nutshell, 

“A Fibershed is a geographical landscape that defines and gives boundaries to a natural textile resource base. Awareness of this bioregional designation engenders appreciation, connectivity, and sensitivity for the life-giving resources within our homelands.” -fibershed.com

since january 2018, ash has released 16 episodes and identified nearly 100 fibreshed producers across canada, helping both creators and consumers connect with and learn about their textiles. with the fashion industry being one of the most polluting industries in the world, fibresheds are an integral part in the fight against the current climate crisis. now ash needs your help to continue!

about ash

ash alberg is a queer femme and fibre witch who seeks to create beautiful and practical products using sustainable methods. equally importantly, they seek to nurture the skills, knowledge, and creativity of fellow fibre witches to achieve their goals.

what we need & what you get

up until now, ash has been covering the cost of production for from field to skin's episodes from their own pocket, spending about 25% of their self-employed full-time working hours doing unpaid labour and paying for travel, recording equipment, and other costs without receiving compensation. broken down, those costs amount to:

  • $1200 per distance interview (facetime, gmail chats, etc.)
  • $1500 per in-person interview (traveling to visit producers at their workspace/home)

while there are some locations in canada that will require larger funding through government bodies (flights to nunavut from ash's home base in winnipeg average over $2000 round-trip), most locations are more easily accessible, and by batching travel to allow for visiting as many producers within a similar area as possible, ash is able to create additional content - the annual forage collection connects with producers in a smaller region to provide additional context to how fibresheds are able to work together and support one another, while one-off episodes allow different regions and types of producers to be highlighted. 

the $3000 goal will allow ash to conduct two new in-person interviews, which ash has already identified and will be moving forward with in the event that funding comes through. if we make less than the goal, episodes will be determined based on how much money is collected and which type of episode (distance or in-person) is the best option. 

as a stretch goal, ash hopes to raise $5000, which would come close enough to covering their expenses and labour to fund 2020's forage collection, which will be focused on ktaqmkuk in mi'kma'ki, organized with the help of megan samms of live textiles, who was interviewed in episode fourteen. additional funds between or above these goals will go towards funding additional episodes. there are currently 93 producers on the map and only 16 episodes have been produced, so there are at least 77 more potential episodes even without adding new members to the map!

there are perks ranging from $5-$2000, so truly a range to fit nearly every budget! whether you just want a casual thank you, are interested in locally sourced and spun fleece-specific yarns, want a hot cup of tea and herbal skincare, would love a wooly weaving or poster for your wall or quilt on your lap, or even a say in where a future episode gets filmed, there are beautiful intentionally made sustainable gifts to fit any home. feel free to contact ash with any questions you may have if you feel pulled between multiple perk options.

why is this important?

with the current climate crisis hitting the headlines around the world, we can no longer ignore the impact we are having on our planet. while local production does not automatically guarantee an ethical or sustainable product, it is exponentially easier to investigate and connect with local producers than large multi-national corporations, and also shrinks your carbon footprint just by the sheer proximity. investing in local economies also makes it easier to support small producers in implementing climate-beneficial practices across their supply chains and practices. 

for producers, the chance to be highlighted through an interview is even more beneficial. i've already heard from past interviewees who have made new sales as a direct result of their interview. while exposure doesn't pay the bills, sales as a direct result of exposure are pretty great. 

on a larger scale, if we got more people following this project and connecting with their fibresheds, we could use those numbers to press government and private industry to invest in the areas where we see gaps - processing mills to create linen and hemp cloth, more grants for small businesses and farms looking to transition their methods to multi-use and climate-beneficial practices, investing in natural dye gardens producing on commercial levels, and highlighting more stories about local textile economies in the press and through cultural media so that the wider public learns about why local fibresheds are so vital. ⁠

what's the risk?

why should you trust me to follow through on this project? my track record speaks for itself - in the past 22 months, i've released an average of one new episode every six weeks, and the only reason i need to pull back on that level of production is the basic fact that living under capitalism means i can't afford to keep donating all my time and resources when it means risking not covering my bills month-to-month. 

the structure of this crowdfunding campaign is also designed to be flexible, whether we raise less than or more than the goal - each $1200 will mean one new distance interview, while $1500 will mean one new in-person interview. we will record interviews over 2020 according to the amount raised.

additionally, i'll be using the same content shared with this campaign to create a more focused corporate package, approaching patrons, government agencies, and corporations with like-minded values to support future episodes as well. the episodes funded through this campaign will help create a buffer while i pursue longer-term stable funding from these sources.

other ways to help

some other ways to help out that don't involve money:

  • follow & share on social media (@fromfieldtoskin, #fromfieldtoskin)
  • tell your friends!
  • watch the current interviews
  • use the map to connect with new-to-you fibre producers
  • connect with ash via email if you have suggestions for additions to the map or the resources page so we can keep growing those tools
  • use the indiegogo share tools to share this campaign across your own channels!

shipping details

i ship all over the world via canada post, our unionized national postal service. packages shipped within canada all receive tracking numbers while international packages are NOT automatically tracked. if you would like international tracking, please let me know and i will sort that out for you no problem.

ALL PHYSICAL PACKAGES WILL RECEIVE AN ADDITIONAL INVOICE AT TIME OF SHIPMENT FOR THE EXACT COST OF SHIPPING. this is because the costs of shipping across the world, and even within canada, vary widely and cannot be easily streamlined to be covered within a perk. for example, a package shipped to regina can cost $13 while the same package shipped to halifax will cost $25, $22 to germany (ground, untracked), and then $50 to japan (also ground/water, untracked). it's all over the map, which is annoying and unfortunate, but also means that i do not want people to pay extra costs on a perk just to cover shipping costs that may not apply to their location. i will cover all costs of packing materials so that your perk arrives to you safe and sound, barring disaster en route, and supporters will be responsible for their exact cost of shipping. this also means that for international supporters who would like tracking and/or expedited shipping on their packages can do so based on their own preferences and budget levels. those who do not receive a tracking number will be given a timeline range so they know when to expect their package.

story:
Short Summary

Truth Against The Machine has the potential to be a huge force for good in a world where the corporate media circus keeps people distracted and depressed 24/7.  By giving independent journalists a platform to share stories that really matter we can cut through the bullshit and start talking about real problems and real people.

What We Need & What You Get

If we meet our goal we'll have taken the first big step towards proving our model.  We want to be able to say that real journalism is possible with out resorting to click-bait and sensationalism.  

The Impact

If we can make this happen we will have dealt a blow to the standard media paradigm that starts from the assumption that people are stupid and says sensationalism leads to clicks and views which lead to advertising dollars.  Truth Against The Machine offers a new path based on the assumption that people are smart and sick of the bullshit.  We provide informative stories untainted by large corporate sponsorships and we think you've read this far because you value that.

How It Works

Our team is working round the clock (literally) to make the stories that you see.  Our team of superstar journalists are out there getting great content which goes to our amazing editor Lydia who packages it and puts a bow on it before it goes out to the world.  All the while Zee, our producer coordinates an impossible number of moving parts to make every video, article, and live show happen.  In the background Sam tweaks and troubleshoots the website and handles everything "business".  This is all running on pure inspiration and commitment to a common goal.  We're raising money so that these people can keep bringing you the truth.
