story:
The Impact of a Successful Campaign:

By funding this project you will help ensure, first and foremost, that unique content remains available.  I don’t have to tell you that the media is becoming more and more homogeneous. Dirty Roots Radio provides a voice for unique, independent artists that aren’t heard regularly on “mainstream” radio.  It is my goal to introduce you to artists that live off the beaten path that you may not encounter anywhere else.

A listener once told me Dirty Roots Radio was a “shoulders down” experience.  A chance to forget about the stress and responsibilities of the world.  I strive to provide the Healin’ Feelin’ every week and to introduce you to some great music along the way.

Please see additional details below, including information on Dirty Roots Radio, how your gift will be used, and other ways you can help.  You can view playlists from previous episodes of the Dirty Roots Radio Show, and listen to archived broadcasts at www.DirtyRootsRadio.com.

 

OUR STORY

Dirty Roots Radio is an old-school record show specializing in renegade country, raw blues, vintage gospel, greasy soul, punk, and funk.  I’ve been exploring the twisted roots and branches of American music on Dirty Roots Radio since 2006. 

Dirty Roots features artists you recognize and many you’ve never heard before.  I pick the music in real time, creating the playlist as we go.  Almost nothing is pre-planned.  It’s all about the vibe. 

The sound of Dirty Roots Radio has American roots music at its core – old blues, country, etc. – and includes new artists that bear the mark of those old influences.  We play well known legends; bizarre, obscure gems; and local/independent artists.

The show has always aired on WGRN 89.5 FM, the campus radio station for Greenville University, in Greenville, IL.  

The long-term future of WGRN is a bit uncertain.  In the short term, I’ve been hired by Greenville University to serve as the Operations Manager for the station.  I’m an adjunct professor and I work hard to corrupt…um, INSTRUCT…a group of students in running the station. 

As you can imagine, this new opportunity has increased my personal workload and placed more stress on my schedule.  Add to that the fact that my daughter is growing up and becoming more involved in activities and time has become a very valuable commodity for me.

With all this in mind, it is my hope that we can evolve Dirty Roots Radio from a once-a-week live radio show to a weekly podcast, created from my home studio as it fits my schedule. This new format will allow me to branch out a bit further with the show and create additional programming.

I intend to launch three separate podcasts, with an eye on a fourth in the near future:

DIRTY ROOTS

Dirty Roots would be the same show as it is on Thursday night, just presented in a podcast format rather than a live broadcast

THE OUTSKIRTS

The Outskirts will retain the trademark vibe and unpredictability of Dirty Roots, but with an intense focus on the country side of the musical spectrum.  Alternative or Insurgent Country artists, such as Scott H. Biram, Sarah Shook & the Disarmers, and Jason & the Scorchers will play nice with Dirty Roots staples like the Bottle Rockets, Social Distortion, and Marty Stuart & His Fabulous Superlatives and country legends like Hank, Willie, Waylon, and Cash.  The Outskirts will confidently flirt with appropriate “mainstream country”…that is to say, we’ll dip one toe into the waters of the Billboard country chart and feature similarly-minded artists such as Chris Stapleton, Miranda Lambert, and Eric Church to demonstrate how they all fit together.

VINYL EDITION

Dirty Roots: Vinyl Edition will be a short-form podcast that takes a weekly trip through my record collection.  The music on the other shows will come from a variety of mediums, but this one is all about vinyl.  I’ll share a handful of tracks each week and shine a spotlight on new vinyl releases, with a special emphasis on the unique and collectible (colored vinyl, etc.).

 

HOW WILL YOUR GIFT BE USED?

Your financial contribution will be used to purchase new equipment and software to make home-recording of the Dirty Roots Radio Show possible.  I will need to purchase a microphone, speakers, recording/editing software, a higher-quality turntable, a small mixer, and possibly a laptop computer, along with cables and other necessary accessories.

Funding will also be used to upgrade the Dirty Roots website to better accommodate this new way of sharing the show and to cover annual website fees and the annual cost of Podomatic’s hosting services, allowing me to upload the shows.

If you would like to know more about the expenses associated with the show and/or the equipment I’m looking at purchasing, you may contact me directly at dirtyroots@rocketmail.com.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

In addition to your kind gift – or, if you’re not able to give, instead of a financial contribution – please share this campaign on all of your social media accounts and email it to like-minded friends and music fans.  Mention it whenever possible and help us get the word out!
story_txt:
The Impact of a Successful Campaign:
By funding this project you will help ensure, first and foremost, that unique content remains available.  I don’t have to tell you that the media is becoming more and more homogeneous. Dirty Roots Radio provides a voice for unique, independent artists that aren’t heard regularly on “mainstream” radio.  It is my goal to introduce you to artists that live off the beaten path that you may not encounter anywhere else.
A listener once told me Dirty Roots Radio was a “shoulders down” experience.  A chance to forget about the stress and responsibilities of the world.  I strive to provide the Healin’ Feelin’ every week and to introduce you to some great music along the way.
Please see additional details below, including information on Dirty Roots Radio, how your gift will be used, and other ways you can help.  You can view playlists from previous episodes of the Dirty Roots Radio Show, and listen to archived broadcasts at www.DirtyRootsRadio.com.
 
OUR STORY
Dirty Roots Radio is an old-school record show specializing in renegade country, raw blues, vintage gospel, greasy soul, punk, and funk.  I’ve been exploring the twisted roots and branches of American music on Dirty Roots Radio since 2006. 
Dirty Roots features artists you recognize and many you’ve never heard before.  I pick the music in real time, creating the playlist as we go.  Almost nothing is pre-planned.  It’s all about the vibe. 
The sound of Dirty Roots Radio has American roots music at its core – old blues, country, etc. – and includes new artists that bear the mark of those old influences.  We play well known legends; bizarre, obscure gems; and local/independent artists.
The show has always aired on WGRN 89.5 FM, the campus radio station for Greenville University, in Greenville, IL.  
The long-term future of WGRN is a bit uncertain.  In the short term, I’ve been hired by Greenville University to serve as the Operations Manager for the station.  I’m an adjunct professor and I work hard to corrupt…um, INSTRUCT…a group of students in running the station. 
As you can imagine, this new opportunity has increased my personal workload and placed more stress on my schedule.  Add to that the fact that my daughter is growing up and becoming more involved in activities and time has become a very valuable commodity for me.
With all this in mind, it is my hope that we can evolve Dirty Roots Radio from a once-a-week live radio show to a weekly podcast, created from my home studio as it fits my schedule. This new format will allow me to branch out a bit further with the show and create additional programming.
I intend to launch three separate podcasts, with an eye on a fourth in the near future:
DIRTY ROOTS
Dirty Roots would be the same show as it is on Thursday night, just presented in a podcast format rather than a live broadcast
THE OUTSKIRTS
The Outskirts will retain the trademark vibe and unpredictability of Dirty Roots, but with an intense focus on the country side of the musical spectrum.  Alternative or Insurgent Country artists, such as Scott H. Biram, Sarah Shook & the Disarmers, and Jason & the Scorchers will play nice with Dirty Roots staples like the Bottle Rockets, Social Distortion, and Marty Stuart & His Fabulous Superlatives and country legends like Hank, Willie, Waylon, and Cash.  The Outskirts will confidently flirt with appropriate “mainstream country”…that is to say, we’ll dip one toe into the waters of the Billboard country chart and feature similarly-minded artists such as Chris Stapleton, Miranda Lambert, and Eric Church to demonstrate how they all fit together. 
VINYL EDITION
Dirty Roots: Vinyl Edition will be a short-form podcast that takes a weekly trip through my record collection.  The music on the other shows will come from a variety of mediums, but this one is all about vinyl.  I’ll share a handful of tracks each week and shine a spotlight on new vinyl releases, with a special emphasis on the unique and collectible (colored vinyl, etc.).
 
HOW WILL YOUR GIFT BE USED?
Your financial contribution will be used to purchase new equipment and software to make home-recording of the Dirty Roots Radio Show possible.  I will need to purchase a microphone, speakers, recording/editing software, a higher-quality turntable, a small mixer, and possibly a laptop computer, along with cables and other necessary accessories.
Funding will also be used to upgrade the Dirty Roots website to better accommodate this new way of sharing the show and to cover annual website fees and the annual cost of Podomatic’s hosting services, allowing me to upload the shows.
If you would like to know more about the expenses associated with the show and/or the equipment I’m looking at purchasing, you may contact me directly at dirtyroots@rocketmail.com.
 
OTHER WAYS TO HELP
In addition to your kind gift – or, if you’re not able to give, instead of a financial contribution – please share this campaign on all of your social media accounts and email it to like-minded friends and music fans.  Mention it whenever possible and help us get the word out!

story:
Why Wonderment?

Today, finding news, articles, and images, and then sharing those interests with others, requires several steps and multiple Internet sites. Wonderment removes those steps and brings that information directly to you, in one spot, and allows you to share that information with your friends and family.

Sharing with friends and family is one of our core values. One of the connecting pieces of the friendship between our friendship is sharing what excites us, thus allowing us to discover more about the world around us. We became friends through our shared love of Disney and Disneyland, specifically. We would eagerly pass any news we could find back and forth to each other. Bonding over that topic is what formed the foundation of our friendship and now, our company.

At Wonderment, we believe that everyone has something that electrifies them. Whether it is:

  • Locating your next adventure and travel destination;
  • Learning more about your favorite automobiles and how to maintain and/or restore them;
  • Discovering that interesting new DIY project;
  • Uncovering your next favorite book; or
  • Finding the resources to start your own small business,

Everyone has something that fascinates them.

We also believe that sharing is part of the joy of having a passion. When we have an interest, we want others to know about it. After all, part of the fun of finding the greatest restaurant is taking your friends there!

yourwonderment.com Home Page Screen Shot

Wonderment supports these beliefs with a site that has multiple categories spanning a wide range of topics. Learning more about your interest is as simple as clicking “Add.” Likewise, sharing what you find is just as easy! With Facebook and Twitter sharing available, you can ensure your friends and family will be able to discover more along with you.

To help make this site a reality, we are looking for people to share with us. What is it that you can share? Why, your support (and funds), of course! We have several different funding levels that you can participate in. To make it even easier for you to partner with us, we have very cool perks attached to each funding level. Our goal was to make the perks unique and practical, like the site, and like us! Each perk represents not only Wonderment, but are as unique as we are. So take a moment, watch our video, look over the perks, and join with us. Help make this site a reality and help yourself and others discover more. After all, Wonderment is your passions, your interests, your way.

Our Goals

We are currently looking for funding to help us enhance Wonderment. As you can see from the helpful link we've provided, we have the live site nearly ready to launch. However, we have two projects in the works which will increase your experience with Wonderment: 

  • Creation of a Mobile App to help you discover more on the go and,
  • Increased functionality to provide fresh content.

 The money we receive during this campaign will help to cover the costs of these two enhancements. We are excited about these enhancements and want to make them a reality.

For example, the promoted links tie in with our goal of helping everyone find new and interesting information about the world around them. Promoting sites within Wonderment offers bloggers, and others, who create fresh and intriguing content, the ability to reach new audiences. Plus, it allows everyone at Wonderment to find that great new writer or photographer that they just HAVE to tell their friends about!

Even with our awesome perks, listed below, it is possible that we may not reach our goal. If that does happen, the funds raised will still be used to develop the mobile app and promoted links. However every bit helps move us closer to our goal.

Timeline

Our Perks

We aren't just asking you to donate, though. We have several fantastic perks that we are offering to anyone who donates. Our purpose in choosing these perks was not only to make it worth your while to donate, but to also reflect who we are as individuals. We know you'll agree that our perks are fun and represent the values of Wonderment.

The different perks are:

  • $5 - Contributor Credit on yourwonderment.com​ - ​Gain Immortality! When the site is live, everyone who contributes at least $5 will be recognized on our "Thank you to Our Supporters" page and will be forever known as someone who believed in our vision. Plus, if we meet you, we'll give you a hi-five as a thank you! You can't beat that!
  • $25 - Chico Bag with Wonderment Logo and Contributor Credit

​

  • ​One thing we believe in here at Wonderment is individuality. Supporting that theme of providing perks which reflect who we are, we have partnered with the wonderful people at Chico Bag to offer a high-quality tote bag with the amazing Wonderment logo. Chico Bag designs the highest quality, longest lasting reusable bags and we are proud to offer their bags to you as a thank you for supporting us. Not only can you show your support for us here at Wonderment (and get that hi-five) but you can avoid this:

​

  • $50 - 25 ounce Chute water bottle with Chico Bag and Contributor Credit

​

  • By supporting us at this level,  you will receive a Camelbak Chute Water Bottle with our Wonderment logo proudly emblazoned on it. In addition, you will also receive a Chico Bag, Contributor Credit and that hi-five!
  • $100 - Highlighted Ad on yourwonderment.com, plus all prior perks - Do you have a business you want to promote? Maybe you have a creative project, like a song or film you want to spread the word about? Here's your chance to not only help us achieve our goal but help advertise your project! At this level, you will not only receive the Chico Bag, Wonderment Water Bottle, and Contributor Credit, but you can also promote on our site! By choosing this perk, you will ensure that everyone who logs on to yourwonderment.com will see your family-friendly ad  for six months. The rotating ads are targeted to visitors within 25 miles of your zip code and, as we all know, every bit of awareness helps!
  • $500 - Your Own Category on yourwonderment.com, plus Chico Bag, Wonderment Water Bottle, and Contributor Credit​ (limit 10)- As you can see from our demo site, yourwonderment.com has multiple categories on a wide-range of topics. However, you may want to create a family-friendly category about your own particular interest. Here's your chance! Say you are a Disney fan like Tara and I. You can create a Disney category, filled with links to Disney content and have it immortalized with your name on it! We will keep this category on yourwonderment.com for up to a year, allowing everyone to see how creative you are in picking what you want to share with the world! And if that doesn't deserve a hi-five, I don't know what does!

Other Ways You Can Help

So you've read this far, picked a perk and STILL want to do more to help? Fantastic! The biggest way you can help is by spreading the word. Like our Facebook page, share our updates on your Twitter, and post our pitch video. The more people that know about yourwondement.com, the better! Each person logging on to the site helps to build a community of people sharing their interests with one another. As the site grows, so does the ability for us to continually update and enhance the site. We believe in yourwonderment.com and we know others will as well. So spread the word and use the share tools provided by Indiegogo to do so! Together, we will discover more. 

Our Team

David Quintanilla          Tara Boutwell

Creative Co-Founder    Technical Co-Founder

Tara Boutwell

I have a comprehensive background in team development and project management. I thrive on taking on product ideas and streamlining efficiency. Some examples include:

  • developing an internal production team that led to an immediate $200,000 savings after the product was produced within 1.5 year timespan
  • Onboarding a global project management tool to streamline company wide processes and visibility.
  • Developing yourwonderment.com, of course!

Without motivation & leadership, teams would not be as productive. As a project manager, I have found creative ways to motivate diverse teams into collaborating & problem solving. This is done through listening first, determining root cause analysis and guiding the team to meaningful solutions.  There is also maintenance that has to be done to ensure that the changes are implemented as well as determining any additional blockers.

David Quintanilla

I firmly believe that excellent communication is essential to any business. Steve Burnett, of the Burnett Group, said, “Regardless of the changes in technology, the market for well-crafted messages will always have an audience.” As a highly-motivated, entrepreneurially-minded individual, I bring my experience in many different aspects of production and content creation to Wonderment. In the past, I have begun several initiatives, such  webinar series, educational videos, and statewide messaging campaigns. In addition, I have developed content that has been recognized for its ability to distinctly deliver its message. One recent video on Financial Aid services has been adopted as part of California campaign, StepFoward, to inform community college students about resources available.

story:
Sacred Stream Video Archival Project

The Foundation of the Sacred Stream is a small non-profit organization and school for consciousness studies in Berkeley, CA. As part of our mission, we provide a platform for artists, teachers, and thought leaders to share their ideas and insight in person at the Sacred Stream Center and online. Our Artist & Lecture series has already brought many thought leaders, artists, and healers to the Sacred Stream Center, including author and scholar, Robert Thurman, the Dalai Lama’s English translator Thupten Jinpa, spiritual teacher Matthew Fox, Enneagram scholar Helen Palmer, Grammy nominees Liz Story, Barbara Higbie, and Lisa Lynne, The Marin Chamber Singers, internationally acclaimed Sarod master Rajeev Taranath, and many more.

One of our goals is to preserve this wisdom and culture for the future, and to share these events with the world for free. Our Video Archival Project is already underway, but the costs far exceed our capacity as a small non-profit to produce and distribute. Total production and post-productions costs per 60-minute video are, on average, $5000. However, with many of our projects, we have already completed filming and just need help financing the editing and rendering before releasing them on our YouTube channel.

Our limited budget has only allowed us to produce about a tenth of the content that we have already begun. For just a few thousand dollars per project, we can continue our efforts. If you have enjoyed our free videos in the past, or think that you might benefit from them in the future, or you just want to participate in something worthwhile that helps others, you can make a big difference by making any size donation now.

Anything that you contribute to this important project – no matter how small – will go a long way to helping us meet our goal.

Thank you for your consideration and support.

 

Gift Descriptions

Thank You: Optional Facebook or Twitter shout-out.

Khata: A beautiful Tibetan ceremonial scarf decorated with the eight auspicious symbols of Tibetan Buddhism.

 

Meditation on Light (Download): For defining, clearing and recharging your body’s subtle energy system, this meditation helps with burn-out, energy drain, and cultivating the overall health of body, mind, and spirit.

 

Eco-Friendly Flash Drive: With a stunning natural hardwood shell made from certified eco-friendly European Maple Wood, these Sacred Stream branded flash drives are the perfect blend of modern technology and sophisticated styling.

Tibetan Prayer Flags (Set of 5): These popular prayer flags are handmade in Nepal and include 5 sets of 10 flags each. Flag colors are the traditional yellow, white, red, blue and green and feature images of the Windhorse on each flag. Each flag measures approximately 8 x 6 inches, and each string is about 8 feet long. 

 

Robert Thurman and Matthew Fox: Cultivating Peace in Difficult Times (Video): Own this historic discussion between NY Times bestselling author and Buddhist scholar, Robert Thurman, and bestselling author and Christian theologian, Rev. Matthew Fox, in full. This is the first and only time Bob and Matt have shared a stage and it is delightful, humorous, and filled with insight. It is a rare and special video for your collection and something you will turn to again and again. Available exclusively as part of this fundraiser.

 

Man of Peace: the Illustrated Life Story of the Dalai Lama of Tibet by Robert Thurman (Signed Collector’s Edition): Here, in full color for the first time, is the story of the Dalai Lama’s lifelong struggle to preserve his peoples’ culture and defend them against one of the last great empires, the People’s Republic of China. This beautiful trade paper graphic novel tells the story of how he took on an empire, calling for truth, peace, and justice for his Tibetan people. Written and signed by Robert Thurman.

 

Coming to Peace by Isa Gucciardi, Ph.D. (Signed Collector’s Edition): Isa Gucciardi’s inspiring book on conflict resolution and finding peace internally and externally reached number one in Religion and Spirituality on Amazon within the first week of its release. This groundbreaking book shows how the processes of Coming to Peace meet those in conflict and provides them a pathway to reconciliation and wholeness.

 

Isa Space Clearing Sprays (3-Pack; Travel Size): Isa’s space clearing sprays are just the thing for clearing and revitalizing energy in your home, office, car, or healing space. This travel size trio is perfect for people on the go. They can be carried on a plane, or easily kept in a glove box, purse, or briefcase. All sprays are a proprietary blend of 100% botanical essential oils and flower essences.

 

The Sacred Stream Digital Video Collection (Download): This exclusive video collection features several outstanding talks given at the Sacred Stream Center, including Thupten Jinpa’s talk, “A Fearless Heart”, Robert Thurman and Matthew Fox’s talk, “Cultivating Peace in Difficult Times,” and Isa Gucciardi’s talk, “The Intersection of Shamanism and Buddhism.”

 

Exclusive Sponsorship Opportunity: For those interested in offering the maximum support to our archival project, supporters at the $500, $1000, and $1500 levels will be mentioned in upcoming videos and podcast episodes. Your name (or company name) will also be listed on our podcast and video webpages (There is also an option to remain anonymous.) In addition, sponsors will receive digital copies of their videos for their collection. See perks for details.

Matthew Fox, in full. This is the first and only time Bob and Matt have shared a stage and it is delightful, humorous, and filled with insight. It is a rare and special video for your collection and something you will turn to again and again. Available exclusively as part of this fundraiser. Man of Peace: the Illustrated Life Story of the Dalai Lama of Tibet by Robert Thurman (Signed Collector’s Edition): Here, in full color for the first time, is the story of the Dalai Lama’s lifelong struggle to preserve his peoples’ culture and defend them against one of the last great empires, the People’s Republic of China. This beautiful trade paper graphic novel tells the story of how he took on an empire, calling for truth, peace, and justice for his Tibetan people. Written and signed by Robert Thurman. Coming to Peace by Isa Gucciardi, Ph.D. (Signed Collector’s Edition): Isa Gucciardi’s inspiring book on conflict resolution and finding peace internally and externally reached number one in Religion and Spirituality on Amazon within the first week of its release. This groundbreaking book shows how the processes of Coming to Peace meet those in conflict and provides them a pathway to reconciliation and wholeness. Isa Space Clearing Sprays (3-Pack; Travel Size): Isa’s space clearing sprays are just the thing for clearing and revitalizing energy in your home, office, car, or healing space. This travel size trio is perfect for people on the go. They can be carried on a plane, or easily kept in a glove box, purse, or briefcase. All sprays are a proprietary blend of 100% botanical essential oils and flower essences. The Sacred Stream Digital Video Collection (Download): This exclusive video collection features several outstanding talks given at the Sacred Stream Center, including Thupten Jinpa’s talk, “A Fearless Heart”, Robert Thurman and Matthew Fox’s talk, “Cultivating Peace in Difficult Times,” and Isa Gucciardi’s talk, “The Intersection of Shamanism and Buddhism.” Exclusive Sponsorship Opportunity: For those interested in offering the maximum support to our archival project, supporters at the $500, $1000, and $1500 levels will be mentioned in upcoming videos and podcast episodes. Your name (or company name) will also be listed on our podcast and video webpages (There is also an option to remain anonymous.) In addition, sponsors will receive digital copies of their videos for their collection. See perks for details.

story:
Who we are

Hi, we are Steve Anderson and Mathew McCabe, two long-time youth pastors in Maryland. We serve at two different medium-sized churches in our area. We aren't special or superstars by any means, but we have been great friends for more than a dozen years and we've both been in youth ministry for nearly 30 years. We are passionate about Student Ministry, and we care deeply for those who have answered the call to be a part of the tribe called "Youth Workers." As youth ministry "veterans," we talked for a couple years about ways we could encourage more youth workers to stay in the game for the long haul. We finally saw our dreams come to fruition in January of this year when we started the "Youth Ministry Sherpas Podcast."

We chose the name because it represents what we are about. Sherpas are mountain people. You've probably read about them in great mountaineering stories. Sherpas know their terrain and are acclimated to the climate. Sherpas shoulder other's burdens along the trail so they can survive and thrive. Sherpas are essential for completing the journey.

We started from scratch. We scraped together some money for a website, microphone, logos, and stickers to give away. We read up on how to do a podcast. We created all our social media accounts. And then we recorded. And recorded. And recorded. In fact, we've made 24 full-length episodes in just 7 months, plus 26 mini-episodes we called Sherpa Shorts. We've built a small following, and are having a blast doing it. Our podcast is two friends having a conversation, laughing a lot, telling stories about youth ministry success and failure, and encouraging others to keep going.

Which is what we plan to do! We want to take our podcast to another level. But we need your help, and we need some capital. That's where this campaign comes in.

What We Need 

Help us get to the National Youth Workers Convention!

  • We are planning to represent ourselves at the National Youth Worker Convention in St. Louis this November. There will be 4500 youth workers there! We need to cover vendor fees, create a dynamic display booth, and buy promotional stuff to give away so people will remember us.
  • We are buying new equipment so we can improve our audio quality and record online interviews with great youth ministry guests! We already have some amazing ones lined up.
  • If we don't meet our goal, we will do what we have always done--figure out a way to make it work with what we have! Hey, we're youth pastors---we go with the flow.

The Impact

The more youth workers we can encourage to stay in the game for the long haul, the better shape youth ministry will be in. The better shape youth ministry is in, the more students who will be impacted with the life changing message of Jesus. 

What You Get

To say thanks for helping support our Podcast, we will provide the following gifts:

  • $10-$49 = Sherpa Stickers and Show Mention
  • $50 - $99 = Above, plus Sherpa T-shirt
  • $100 + = Above, plus Guest Appearance as Intro Voice
  • $500 + = Above, plus 2-pack of Yeti Wine Tumblers or Coffee Mugs

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this opportunity with your friends and followers. Please!
  • Know a Youth Worker? Share the Youth Ministry Sherpas Podcast with them through any podcast app, iTunes, Spofify, or www.youthminstrysherpas.com

And that's all there is to it. Thanks!

story:
Welcome! 

If you've made it to this page, chances are you know one of us! 

Lizzie is an NYC based comedian who performs regularly all over the city and headlines all of her family functions as the "one from New York". Arden is a politics wonk and civics dork who’s worked on local, state, and national campaigns, and is the Policy Director for Manhattan Young Democrats.

There! Now you know both of us! 

Let's Get Civical  is a comedy podcast that deep dives into a new civic or political topic each week. And it's our baby. Seriously, she's been in incubation for 8 months and she's ready to be seen and heard. She's greeting the world on January 30th!

 

Federal Funding

Like all governments, things like infrastructure, national parks, education and public health all require funding. Here at the Let's Get Civical podcast, your federal funds will be used for:

  • Producing equipment- we want to make sure our citizens have the highest quality experience 
  • Advertisements- to reach far and wide to all corners of this country 
  • Live show recordings- so you the people can see us in action! 
  • Research- We, like you, don't know everything but we're committed to learning and researching to bring you the best podcast possible. 

 

Grassroots

Can't contribute? No worries! There are so many things that you can do to get involved!

  • You can follow us on Twitter/IG @letsgetcivcal. 
  • Search for Let's Get Civical on your fav podcast platform or head over to http://letsgetcivical.com and subscribe, rate and review!
  • Tell a friend! Create your own civical community to help share the knowledge!

story:
Fable Gazers - award winning indie podcast company

Each season of Fable Gazers’ podcasts is a deeply researched narrative story produced to the highest quality. Sara-Mae Tuson, senior producer, spends years crafting our projects, with help from Beth Keehn and a few other friends. 

We want to make audio stories that hook people in and inspire multiple recommendations and listens forever. Excitingly, Season 1: The Sugar Baby Confessionals has won bronze at the 2019 British Podcast Awards and we’d love to make season 2 just as good.

That’s why we need your help.

This year, we’ve given ourselves a massive challenge: we want to create a series twice as long, with over 39 participants, original music, a cinematic investigation and a book club rolled into one. 

It's going to be hilarious, poignant, insightful, historically fascinating, smart and full of fabulous guests (who? Glad you asked... Stephen Fry, Joanne Harris, Harriet Evans, Mary Jo Putney...to name just four).

What’s season 2 about?

Heyer Today: a podcast about Regency romance queen Georgette Heyer 

“I think myself I ought to be shot for writing such nonsense.”

As a bestselling author, Georgette Heyer hasn’t been out of print since 1921 – so why hasn’t Hollywood snapped up her plots for a big screen franchise?

  • Jane Austen – 6 best-selling Regency romances; 6 major screen adaptations.
  • Georgette Heyer – 34 best-selling Regency romances; 0 major screen adaptations.

One major film producer has been trying to get the first big screen adaptation of Heyer’s ‘The Grand Sophy’ made for years, but what’s been standing in the way? We’ll investigate the difficulties facing film makers when it comes to period work. 

Plus, find out what the uber-Heyerites think of Sophy’s choice. We chat to Peter Buckman (agent for Heyer's estate) about his struggles with trying to get a Heyer film made, and we  chart his journey towards adapting one of her books himself.

Join our Regency romance book club!

Every alternate week, we'll attempt to convert people who've never heard of Heyer, including comedians Emma Moran, Glen Tickle, Dom Patmore, Rhiannon Shaw and Kate Hinksman.

Discover what Hollywood producers, Australian biographers, British national treasures and worldwide readers think about Heyer’s popularity. And join super-fans and newbies as they discover and discuss some of the top-selling novels of our time – in Heyer Today.

Listen to a teaser clip here

Highlights include:

  • Actor Stephen Fry on how he came to be hooked on Heyer
  • Author Joanne Harris on why adapting books into film can be problematic
  • Producer Andy Paterson discusses a mystery project and the difficulties of bringing Heyer’s work to the screen
  • Best selling historical romance novelist, Mary Jo Putney, on writing Regency romance through a 21st century lens
  • Acclaimed biographer Jennifer Kloester shares some anecdotes about her journey in discovering never before seen letters from Heyer and doing Heyer justice
  • Peter Buckman on his joy in adapting Heyer's work
  • Romance novelist Harriet Evans lists her all-time favourite Heyers and why
  • Susannah Fullerton, head of the Jane Austen Society in Australia, compares Austen and Heyer
  • Blogger Eleanor Turner (Jane to Georgette) discusses Heyer related on-dits and crim cons
  • Comedians who’ve never read Heyer, fall in love (or not!) with her work
  • Author Jane Holland and literary agent Alison Bonami from LBA on Heyer’s greatest romantic heroes
  • Audio drama inspired by Heyer’s life
  • Music from the incomparable Emma Gatrill plus original music composed especially for the podcast

 

Why do we need your help?

Editing/production costs - Heyer Today is a much more ambitious project than The Sugar Baby Confessionals. We have over 60 hours of audio to edit and produce, having interviewed over 39 people. 

Scriptwriting/voice casting - We want to create audio drama to create to bring Heyer’s life and work to your ears in a vivid way.

Marketing - As a small team of two people (with some friends helping out) we do all our promotion ourselves. Your contributions will help us to market our work and create a buzz to generate more listeners. We’ve managed more than 31,000 downloads for season 1, and hope to keep our momentum going strong - but we can't do it without you!

Music - We really wanted to create an original soundscape so, apart from amazing music from Emma Gattrill, we’re writing an original score of piano and harpsichord based music (Regency instruments).

This is also our longest season yet, at 24 episodes, and we need your help to give us the time to lavish on our work.

All this work, which we love, will be totally free and available on as many platforms as possible, so any donations you can make will buy us time to craft our podcast into something we can all be proud of.

By supporting our crowdfunder, you’ll get:

  • The satisfaction of supporting an indie podcast company with a proven track record of excellence 
  • Be an intrinsic part of our team – we can’t do it without you!
  • Get your name read out in the credits
  • First listens to episode 1, featuring Stephen Fry
  • First listens to bonus material (we’re working on catch up episodes for The Sugar Baby Confessionals)
  • How to start an award-winning podcast consultancy and mentorship from Sara-Mae
  • Beautiful signed prints of original Cathy Tuson’s Heyer Today inspired artwork

 

What we need the money for:

  • Editing, production - £2,500 
  • Composing & recording new music for score, paying musicians - £400
  • Research & admin - £500
  • Marketing - £1,600

Who are we?

Apart from being a podcaster for over four years, senior producer Sara-Mae Tuson  is a writer and editor with nine years of editorial and copywriting experience working for charities and advertising agencies. She's had work published in variety of publications and edited The London Magazine and Trespass. Also creating audio drama, her work ‘Finger in the Pie’, first published as a short story in The Norwegian American, won through to the Leipziger Hörspielsommer audio drama fest in July 2019.

Beth Keehn helps with research and managing our web presence. She’s also a writer, editor, street photographer (and learner-drummer), and has been producing digital and print content for more than 15 years in London and Australia – with clients ranging from small charities to global giants.

Be a part of our journey, as we continue our adventures!

story:
It's back!

International Podcast Month (IPM) is back for round two! Our inaugural year (2018) was immensely successful and wonderful. With over 10,000 downloads and over 70 podcasts represented, we were blown away by our inaugural month-long event. It's a celebration of podcasters, podcasts, and listeners.

What is IPM?

September Is International Podcast Month (IPM)! IPM is a wonderful opportunity for podcasters to cross-promote, celebrate each other, and share the love of podcasting with the world. For IPM, creators are making special episodes to release during this upcoming September on the IPM feed. We've brought together Non-Fiction, Audio Fiction, and RPG Actual-Play creators to put together amazing content for us to deliver directly to your ears this September.

With a focus on marginalized creators, we're building communities together and extending the love to sharing listeners and boosting each other's voices. For 2019, IPM features a collaboration of many diverse and inclusive podcasting folks on Audio Fiction Minisodes, Creator Conversation Episodes, Non-Fiction Episodes, RPG Actual-Play One-Shots, and a month-long blog. The Non-Fiction and Audio Fiction episodes will be special minisodes made by their creators and casts, while the RPG Actual-Play One-Shots are made up of a variety of creators across the podcasting medium who have gotten together just for their one episode (though whether or not they decide to continue their campaigns is up to them!).

The first International Podcast Month was incredible. And now we've got big goals and we're doing it all over again! Welcome to the second annual International Podcast Month!

IPM 2019 is brought to you by founder Tess Cocchio and the organization team Cole Burkhardt, Therin Stapp, Fay Onyx, Gnome, Anne Baird, Jess Ross, and Madelyn Grace.

Who all is participating?

We don't want to let all of our secrets out of the bag, but here are are just few participating podcasts:

RPG Actual Play Podcasts: Tabletop Potluck, The Broadswords, Heroes Not Included, Prism Pals
Audio Drama/Fiction: Take The Mass Pike, The 12:37, Kalila Stormfire's Economical Magick Services, Moonbase Theta Out
Non-Fiction: Mise En Podcast, Popcorn Prattle, Accession, Burst Your Bubble

Where's the money going?

For our inaugural year, the founder, Tess, paid for everything out of pocket, from website and RSS hosting all the way to giveaways. She also put in over 200 hours of work into making the event go smoothly, and that was one person. While the event was more than she could ever hope for, the unfortunate reality is that she ended up suffering some major burnout.

This year, to protect Tess' health, the organizational team is a powerhouse of eight folks collaborating and sharing the workload. Our team members are putting in at least 30 hours worth of work, and at a minimum wage of $15/hour, that would put their time at being worth at least $450 each, so we want to make sure they're getting some kind of compensation.

So the base goal of this Indiegogo covers RSS hosting, website (and associated) costs, graphic design, some giveaways, and a small honorarium of $200 for each team member as compensation for their time.

Here it all is broken down:

Giveaways

In 2018, most of the giveaways were either donated or paid for directly by Tess. This year, we want to prevent her from going in the red and we want to be able to do bigger and better listener AND creator giveaways! As the Indiegogo campaign progresses, we'll be able to announce what some of these are!

IPM 2018 In The News

Audio Dramatic: "Celebrating International Podcast Month", Elena Fernández Collins

Celebrate Your Podcast Love with International Podcast Month, Wil Williams

What folks say about IPM

Can I still access the 2018 IPM Content?

YES! You can listen to all the 2018 audio episodes by subscribing in whatever podcatcher you're using. Here's the direct RSS feed link. You can also access ALL of the 2018 written content by going straight to our website: https://www.internationalpodcastmonth.com/blog-2018

What folks say about IPM
Can I still access the 2018 IPM Content?YES! You can listen to all the 2018 audio episodes by subscribing in whatever podcatcher you're using. Here's the direct RSS feed link. You can also access ALL of the 2018 written content by going straight to our website: https://www.internationalpodcastmonth.com/blog-2018

story:
Who the Heck Are We??

Theatre Contra is a Philadelphia theatre company dedicated to bringing to life stories of conflict and conviction. We strive to make all of our work accessible and approachable - for audiences, artists, and administrators alike. Theatre Contra was born out of the desire to create a space where people could try something new without fearing failure. 

Over the past year, we took a break, but now we are back with a new project that we are so excited for you to be a part of - and you can be a part of it, in more ways than one.

The Project

The Stickie Detectives is an interactive podcast - you are encouraged to explore Philadelphia, and help unravel the mystery through a series of clues. 

Jenna Kuerzi and Adam Howard approached us with an idea: they both independently discovered a unique sticker that has been popping up around town, and they were instantly propelled into action. There seems to be no indication on where the stickers are coming from, but Adam and Jenna are determined to crack this mystery. 

We thought this would be a quick, simple project, but it has spiraled into an epic journey. What began to unravel was a series of characters, questions, frustrations, and discoveries.

As we begin to unearth more and more, we need your help. Every dollar contributed will go directly to this project - the people involved, resources for solving the mystery, and more.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a total of $1,000. These contributions will be spent on: 

  • Paying those involved - we have always committed to compensating those that work with us and as this project has unraveled, the community has enlarged), 
  • Buying podcasting supplies - microphones, subscriptions, classes, etc. We’ve found we need to get on the street more and more and relying on our headphones and phone mics can only get us so far. We’ve also never done a podcast before, so we are actively trying to educate ourselves!
  • Post-Covid Contra Comeback Fund - We have A LOT more in the works we are looking forward to sharing with you once the world is back to normal (or whatever normal is). Any extra donations beyond this project will go directly into this fund for use on future projects.

Every dollar is helpful toward achieving this goal: the more you donate, the more you get!

The Impact

Your contribution will help us propel this project farther than we had originally anticipated. Coming out of the COVID-19 Pandemic, we are excited to try a new twist on an old piece of entertainment - leading to more unique theatre experiences in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share on social media! Follow us on Facebook and Instagram (@theatrecontra) and share our progress. 
  • Tune in! When we launch, the more listeners, the better!

story:
Short Summary

Witchever Path is an anthology series where your decisions effect the story. Since January 2019, we've told two seasons of interactive stories featuring a diverse cast  tackling complex themes.  Our show has grown, mostly through word of mouth and recommendations and we've got a growing, rabid fanbase. 

And we’re looking to do more. 

As we approach the beginning of our next season, we'd like to bring our stories to the next level and that requires an investment into the business. And our chief concern is paying actors for their performances, making sure our editing and sound design continues to improve, and that we can invest in the art in the music that enhances the Witchever Path experience. 

Never heard us before? Check out our most recent storyline here.

What We Need

We're looking to raise $3,000 US. Here's where it will go:

  • Actors: We believe representation matters as much as talent, and we want to be able to provide our actors more than our undying gratitude. We want to be able to pay our actors a decent wage for their work, and help them further their own careers. 
  • Writing, Editing, and Maintenance: Writing and producing are pretty time consuming, and we also work full-time. The money allows us to invest in technology, hosting, and time to create, edit, and get these stories out to you in a timely fashion. 
  • Art and Music: We want to invest in artists to make new pieces that serve as companion pieces to our stories as well as music that helps set the tone of our episodes. Your help can make this a reality. 

If we don't make our goal, your money will focus on actor pay, because without the voices, an audio fiction podcast isn't as compelling. 

What you Get

Besides just a thank you, we've got a list of perks on this Inidegogo, ranging from exclusive, subscriber-only episodes to being listed as  co-producer of our whole season. 

With Your Help

  • We'll continue to tell stories featuring protagonists from all walks of life that don't often see themselves in those narratives.
  • We are going to be able to grow our audience, which will make the interactive polls between episodes more dramatic (more voting raises the stakes).
  • Together, we'll create interactive stories that hold up long after the voting is done.

Risks & Challenges

We're undertaking this, knowing there is a huge glut of these right now, and we know the COVID-19, calls for justice for BIPOC, and the civil unrest in the United States has many people wondering why they should give money to a fiction series when there are people needing money everywhere. We hear you. And we may not make our goal... but if you do donate, you're funding:

  • Stories with strong Black and other People of Color that pay service to their humanity and cultures while avoiding stock tropes.
  • A strongly, queer-affirming space.
  • You'll help pay people in minority groups to write, produce and act in a world where their perspectives are more vital than ever. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Stick around, listen to our show and maybe help us with this:

  • Make some noise for the campaign and show by using the hashtag #ChooseThePath.
  • Get people to listen to the show, and leave reviews for us on Podchaser, or wherever you get podcasts. 

Thank you! 

Jas and Steven

story:
Jesus Pancake is a nine episode audio fiction series collaboratively written by the Soapbox Audio Collective, a team of writers based in North Carolina. 

******

Microwaves, family secrets, spiders, friendship, and the Power of the Pancake converge in this dark comedy about a middle-aged woman reckoning with her power for the first time. Aimee is intrigued when a pancake she makes looks just like Jesus, until she realizes something truly profound and dangerous is at work. 

*******

The first season of Jesus Pancake includes 32 characters, almost 4 hours of content, original music, and lots of quirkiness. Forty two artists will be involved in this production (including production staff, designers, writers, and actors). Like all of our audio content, Jesus Pancake will be available for free via all podcast platforms. 

If you like audio fiction and like to pay the artists who make it, please contribute. In return, we will make awesome and compelling audio content for you to enjoy!

Thanks to a generous grant from Manbites Dog Theater Fund, we are 1/3 of the way toward our funding goal. We need your assistance to make it the rest of the way! We'd be grateful if you support our campaign with dollars, sharing this page, and spreading the good word far and wide about Artist Soapbox and the work we do. 

Jesus Pancake is the fourth audio fiction project produced by Artist Soapbox. We released Master Builder in 2019, The New Colossus in 2020, and the Declaration of Love audio anthology in 2020. Due to its length and complexity, Jesus Pancake would be our most ambitious project yet!

Season One of Jesus Pancake, our newest original audio drama serial was written by the Soapbox Audio Collective Team One (Tamara Kissane, Mara Thomas, Katy Koop, Juliana Finch).  The co-producers and co-directors for this project are Aurelia Belfield and Tamara Kissane.

Episodes 1-3 of Jesus Pancake were workshopped at University Theatre at NC State in September 2019. The writers conducted a Zoom reading in summer 2020 and have completed the second round of edits. 

We have begun the pre-production work (casting, scheduling, rehearsing) with a plan to record in person in the studio in late fall 2021.

We estimate we will need 4-5 rehearsals and about 20 hours of studio time.  Jesus Pancake will be released to the public when all nine episodes are completely sound designed. 

WHAT IS THE MONEY FOR?

Paying the people! Only about $2000 of this campaign will go to non-people (hosting and website, marketing, catering, etc). The rest of the funds raised will go to pay artists in our community. The more we raise, the more we can pay them for their awesome hard work. 

WOULD YOU LIKE A TASTE?

It's a pre-celebration to get everyone excited about the Jesus Pancake that's to come!!

Announcing: ASBX Audio Shorts ~~ six original audio pieces written and performed by NC creatives ~~ specifically contributed to aid in fundraising for JP. Aren't they awesome?!

We'll be dripping out the Shorts over the next few weeks, so stay tuned and follow ASBX on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter to stay in touch. All deets available on www.artistsoapbox.org.

Thank you so much for your support. 

Reach out to us at artistsoapbox@gmail.com with questions.

story:
We make Digital Media, usually for free, to the benefit of local artists. But Digital Media is expensive.

We get most things second hand or discounted. This mic? We found it in my mom’s attic. This camera? It was the display model at Best Buy. 

We’re expanding our video capacity. We’re currently self-producing a documentary video series, but we dream big. We want to do bigger and better.
That’s why we’re starting the Scapi Tech Fund. We’re raising $2100 for the newest 4k DJI drone on the market and a robust portable audio system, the ZOOM H6 with lavalier microphones. We can get both of these for $2100, and it will revolutionize the way we work.

Most of the time, shelling out this amount of money for technology has diminishing returns. A big price tag doesn’t always mean a huge leap in quality. That’s why when we shell out big money for tech, we go for function.

The DJI drone is reliable, its innovative zoom technology allows for DYNAMIC shooting, and its internal systems will greatly prevent damage to the machine.

The Zoom setup will complement our portable audio setup in a major way, and will become our new portable mixer. 4 XLR inputs means we can get near studio quality leveling on the go. Its built-in microphone combined with our currently owned zoom products means we’ll be able to set up multiple mics without having to bust out XLR if the situation calls for it.

So, that’s why we’re doing this. We want to make groundbreaking digital content to spotlight the artists of Chicago. If that’s not for you, feel free to move on. But if you want to learn more about Scapi Magazine, including seeing all of our free content, podcasts, articles, videos, and more, head on over to scapimag.com.

Help us make something.

story:
Tides is a science fiction audio drama about life in extreme circumstances. It follows biologist Dr. Winifred Eurus, a member of the first manned expedition to Fons, an Earth-like moon wracked by extreme tidal waves due to its orbit around a nearby gas giant. When surveying ocean life her submarine is destroyed, leaving her alone to walk to higher ground before the wave comes back. Along the way, she makes notes about what she finds in the intertidal zone, and gradually realizes that some of the life there is more than what it seems.

Tides is created by producer Ayla Taylor and writer Jesse Schuschu and is sound designed by Bridge Geene. 

Dr. Winifred Eurus is brought to life in all of her curioius and slightly misanthropic glory by the immensely talented Julia Schifini. 

We also have a wonderful supporting cast, including:

  • James Oliva as Dr. Robert Montague, the mission's geologist and general pain in the neck
  • Jordan Higgs as Dr. Victor Stevens, Dr. Eurus's long-suffering assistant
  • Emily Wang as Dr. Melissa Wang, the insightful astrophysicist who is one of the few people Dr. Eurus openly considers a friend. 
  • Zach Libresco as Captain Ed Ricketts, the paternal captain who just wants the minimal amount of people to die. 
  • Several crew members that we will be hearing from in season 2!

The first season was completed in August and we are hard at work on season 2. We need your help to make this season even better than the first!

What we need

We want to make the best show we can, but we also need to eat and pay bills. The first season was paid mostly out of pocket, but we want to be able to properly compensate out whole cast and crew for their time and energy. 

We estimate that this will cost $3800. We are going to set the initial goal at $3000. 

The budget is broken down as follows: 

  • $2400 ($600 each) for the main cast and crew (writer, producer, sound designer, lead actress) at $50 per episode.
  • $1000 for the supporting cast at $25 per episode. 
  • $200 for hosting and fees for a whole year
  • $200 for perks and fees for this campaign. 

Any funds raised beyond the estimated budget will be used to increase the payments to the cast and crew.

Stretch Goal

If we reach $4000, we will produce a full length extra episode set during the journey to Fons. It will involve scheming, romance, betrayal and dubious cake.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us monetarily, know that we appreciate you so much for supporting us by listening and enjoying this show. You can also help by getting the word out about this campaign!

story:
Hello, my name is Christian

Throughout my teen years and young adulthood, I was a dedicated Christian. I was counter-culture and liberally-minded, and even though I was constantly fighting with churches, I kept working for them. Stupid, I know.

on our way to a Christian punk show... the 90's were interesting

I left the church over a dozen years ago, and there are still family and friends who I haven't talked to about it. This is normal, it seems... to ignore that part of our past.

But this isn't really about me. I do plan to share a lot of the crazy stories from my life, but most episodes will be about the funny, bizarre, and sometimes terrifying experiences of the people I interview. 

 

A Podcast for Apostates

What happens to someone after they leave religion? What does their family say? Who doesn't speak to them anymore? Or maybe more important: What crazy things may have happened that made them leave?

HERETIC PARTY is part narrative, part personal interview. We hope to produce episodes at least 3 times a month. Episodes range in length from 30 minutes to over an hour, depending on the topic. 

Interviews we have already conducted include brothers who were raised to become prophets, and a guy whose church encouraged his mental illness because he believed his hallucinations were the voices of angels. And we have a huge list of episodes planned, all with happy lost souls who have offered to be interviewed. It turns out, people want to share their stories.

This is not an angry, anti-religious podcast. We hope to include many voices and perspectives. Our fascination with someone changing their beliefs is what will drive these stories. We have already reached out to multiple churches and religious schools in order to hear their side of these stories. In general, though, these are stories about things going wrong in a religious experience.

We need better recording equipment

All the work we have done so far has been completed with one crummy microphone, a Tascam portable recorder, and freeware editing software.

  • In order to interview the way we want, we hope to put together a modest mobile set up with three microphones, stands with shock mounts, a mixer and preamp, and a heavy duty carrying case. 
  • There is also a stretch goal that includes a higher-end setup and laptop for editing on the go. 
  • If we do not raise enough, we intend to prioritize new equipment, upgrade what we can, and get back to work!

We also need funds for hosting, legal advice, and travel

  • Proper podcast media hosting can be expensive. We would like to pay up front for at least a year of quality hosting.
  • Future topics include several organizations that have a history of legal bullying. Before we begin working on stories concerning these organizations, we would like to have a thorough legal strategy for avoiding lawsuits and prudent action if they happen.
    • If you or someone you know is a legal pro with this sort of experience and is willing to provide some inexpensive or pro bono  assistance, please contact us at hereticparty@gmail.com 
  • Among our super-secret episode plans are several stories that would be best served if we can explore the locales themselves. Our dream for Heretic Party has always been a podcast that travels to location in order to tell stories in a raw and real way. 

 

With your help

We hope to have this podcast up and running within a few months. We already have:

  • Three full episodes worth of VOIP interviews.
  • Dozens of episodes planned including interviews scheduled and scripts written 
  • Music provided for us by rad artists.

 

Episodes in the works right now!

  • A family splintered by a church declaration expelling gay members
  • Children without legal protection against parents who choose prayer over medicine
  • A church cover-up of missionaries who father children in foreign countries
  • Why many young people redirect their faith to neo-paganism
  • How class determines membership in youth mission organizations
  • The Satanic Panic and Dungeons and Dragons in the 80's and 90's

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay of you can't support us financially, or if you're not into all our rad merch. You can help us out tremendously by: 

  • Sharing this campaign on social media. Tell your friends and followers why you think this project is worth checking out.
  • Contact us with your story. We are always looking for more voices. 
  • Talk about religion with your friends. Many of us have old traumas that we are trying to overcome. Conversation helps.

Thanks for checking us out. Peace.

HERETIC PARTY is part narrative, part personal interview. We hope to produce episodes at least 3 times a month. Episodes range in length from 30 minutes to over an hour, depending on the topic. 
Interviews we have already conducted include brothers who were raised to become prophets, and a guy whose church encouraged his mental illness because he believed his hallucinations were the voices of angels. And we have a huge list of episodes planned, all with happy lost souls who have offered to be interviewed. It turns out, people want to share their stories.
This is not an angry, anti-religious podcast. We hope to include many voices and perspectives. Our fascination with someone changing their beliefs is what will drive these stories. We have already reached out to multiple churches and religious schools in order to hear their side of these stories. In general, though, these are stories about things going wrong in a religious experience.

We need better recording equipment
All the work we have done so far has been completed with one crummy microphone, a Tascam portable recorder, and freeware editing software.


In order to interview the way we want, we hope to put together a modest mobile set up with three microphones, stands with shock mounts, a mixer and preamp, and a heavy duty carrying case. 
There is also a stretch goal that includes a higher-end setup and laptop for editing on the go. 
If we do not raise enough, we intend to prioritize new equipment, upgrade what we can, and get back to work!

We also need funds for hosting, legal advice, and travel


Proper podcast media hosting can be expensive. We would like to pay up front for at least a year of quality hosting.
Future topics include several organizations that have a history of legal bullying. Before we begin working on stories concerning these organizations, we would like to have a thorough legal strategy for avoiding lawsuits and prudent action if they happen.If you or someone you know is a legal pro with this sort of experience and is willing to provide some inexpensive or pro bono  assistance, please contact us at hereticparty@gmail.com 

Among our super-secret episode plans are several stories that would be best served if we can explore the locales themselves. Our dream for Heretic Party has always been a podcast that travels to location in order to tell stories in a raw and real way. 

 

With your help
We hope to have this podcast up and running within a few months. We already have:

Three full episodes worth of VOIP interviews.
Dozens of episodes planned including interviews scheduled and scripts written 
Music provided for us by rad artists.

 

Episodes in the works right now!

A family splintered by a church declaration expelling gay members
Children without legal protection against parents who choose prayer over medicine
A church cover-up of missionaries who father children in foreign countries
Why many young people redirect their faith to neo-paganism
How class determines membership in youth mission organizations
The Satanic Panic and Dungeons and Dragons in the 80's and 90's


Other Ways You Can Help
It's okay of you can't support us financially, or if you're not into all our rad merch. You can help us out tremendously by: 

Sharing this campaign on social media. Tell your friends and followers why you think this project is worth checking out.
Contact us with your story. We are always looking for more voices. 
Talk about religion with your friends. Many of us have old traumas that we are trying to overcome. Conversation helps.

Thanks for checking us out. Peace.

story:
Support the campaign to finish the stories of Rudyard, Antigone, Eric, Georgie, and Piffling Vale.

Wooden Overcoats tells the story of rival funeral parlours on an island in the English Channel.

Rudyard and Antigone Funn run the oldest, and only, funeral home on the island of Piffling. They provide terrible funerals in which the schedule outranks the mourners and there's always the risk of someone throwing a punch. When Eric Chapman sets up a parlour across the square and provides joyful celebrations of the deceased's lives, happy memories (and a bowling alley), the Funns can't compete. Their business drains away and they are riven with envy.

Wooden Overcoats is a podcast sitcom which launched in the Autumn of 2015. In Summer 2020, the fourth and final season will finish the story.

Over the series, we've listened to Funn Funerals (attempt to) compete with Chapman's and heard the effect on the wider village, seen Rudyard repeatedly try to undermine his rival, Antigone learn what it is to step outdoors, Georgie find a family she can call her own. With your help, in Season Four we will solve the show's great mystery: Why did Eric Chapman come to Piffling Vale?

Season 3 Episode 3 Cast & Crew © Odinn Orn Hilmarsson

Season One of Wooden Overcoats was eight episodes long.

Season Two was eight episodes and a backers-only Christmas Special.

Season Three was eight episodes and a backers-only Summer Special.

For Season Four, we are asking £15,000 to make a bumper TEN EPISODE season.

Wooden Overcoats launched with the idea that it's possible to make a professional audio sitcom independently. We hire studios, actors, writers, directors, producers, a production manager, a PR manager, a composer, an artist, and the Piffling Philharmonic aka our orchestra.

Support from our listeners is vital to ensure these professionals are paid fairly for their time and talents. The full season will cost more than £25,000 to make. We have been working hard to raise the rest of our budget through live shows and sponsorship here in the UK, but we need help from our listeners to close the gap.

This is the last season. In consequence, this is our last fundraiser. If you have ever considered donating to Wooden Overcoats but have not had the opportunity before, now is the time. This is the one.

Composer James Whittle. Img © John Wakefield

If we hit out stretch goal of £17,000 we will make a backers-only holiday special. Every donor, no matter what you contributed, will get a copy of Rudyard Ruins Hallowe'en. We had so much fun making and releasing the Christmas and Summer specials thanks to our listeners' generosity. We hope you will help us add one more to the set.

Look through our Perks (click to view), including THE COMPLETE LIVE SHOWS for £25, and support this fundraiser in whichever way makes sense for you.

During this fundraiser, we will release a new mini-series of Funn Fragments. Over five weeks, we'll drop five new episodes by writers from all over podcasting:

  • Sarah Shachat (Wolf 359, Time Bombs, Zero Hours)
  • Mac Rogers (Steal the Stars, The Message, LifeAfter)
  • Ella Watts (The Orphans)
  • Chris and Jen Sugden (Victoriocity)
  • ...and Felix.

David K. Barnes, Ciara Baxendale, Tom Crowley, Felix Trench, Beth Eyre and Kieran Hodgson. Img © Viktor Erik Emanuel/Kings Place

Emily Stride and Beth Eyre. Img © Odinn Orn Hilmarsson​

We love this show. 

It has been a massive part of our lives for four years and we want to see it off in style. Since 2015, we have been privileged to meet audience members from all over the world when they flew to our live shows, amazed at the outpouring of artwork inspired by our stories and voices, won awards, been featured in publications from the US to India, and travelled the country.

By donating to Wooden Overcoats, you help us complete a story that many, many people are waiting for.

Every creative project comes with risk. People fall ill. Transport links go on strike. Computers fail. One time one of our studio cables picked up a French radio station.

Everything is surmountable with cool heads. And most things are preventable with cool planning.

Andy Hamilton and Andy Secombe. Img © Odinn Orn Hilmarsson​

If you're not in a position to donate to this fundraiser, help us by spreading the word.

Tell someone who doesn't yet listen to the show about it. Let the world know there is a fundraiser. Retweet, share, or spread the word in your own way to help us make the last season of Wooden Overcoats.

Ciara Baxendale. Img © Odinn Orn Hilmarsson​
