story:
• For several years I have been toying around with the idea of starting a podcast. In the 2018 thanks to the encouragement from my role model in podcasting Joe Rogan and my lovely girlfriend Cristina I got started. In learning more about podcasting and other media platforms I learned about Gary Vaynerchuk and Voicecon. Through the development of this podcast, I learned the incredible value of networking and putting yourself out there. 
  • With your help and my hard work, I can reach my goal of raising $1,500 before the deadline of April 20 only a few days. I will document my entire journey for you guys and share all the valuable information I learn.
story_txt:
For several years I have been toying around with the idea of starting a podcast. In the 2018 thanks to the encouragement from my role model in podcasting Joe Rogan and my lovely girlfriend Cristina I got started. In learning more about podcasting and other media platforms I learned about Gary Vaynerchuk and Voicecon. Through the development of this podcast, I learned the incredible value of networking and putting yourself out there. 
With your help and my hard work, I can reach my goal of raising $1,500 before the deadline of April 20 only a few days. I will document my entire journey for you guys and share all the valuable information I learn.

story:
‘El viaje de anicha’ es un proyecto de dos años en el que viajo sola por diferentes países de Medio Oriente, Europa y Asia, aprendiendo y practicando Meditación Vipassana en centros de meditación especializados.

¿Quién es Andrea?

Soy salvadoreña, psicóloga de profesión, comediante, practicante de yoga y meditación Vipassana que desde hace años ha estado interesada en la adquisición de conciencia emocional y el desarrollo espiritual vinculada al desarrollo social.

Quiero que las personas viajen a través de las imágenes e historias que voy recopilando en este proyecto de Videoblog para que se maravillen del milagro de existir. Quiero que descubran junto a mí, las diferencias entre culturas, pero sobre todo las similitudes, la esencia que compartimos entre toda la humanidad.

Sé que el desarrollo social sólo es posible cuando adquirimos mayor conciencia individual, y quiero trabajar para apoyar a otros a alcanzarlo, pero un ciego no puede guiar a otro ciego, Por tanto medito el equivalente del tiempo que viajo para profundizar en mi propia psique.

Les cuento mi historia para que vean que es posible conocer el mundo, no necesitamos millones, solo saber cómo movernos y a través de mis videos, les cuento las maneras que voy descubriendo para que quien quiera también pueda viajar.

Mi campaña es importante porque:

Todo lo recaudado en la campaña ‘Viajera con causa’, servirá para adquirir equipo de grabacion para continuar creando videos que permitan a otros viajar conmigo. Los fondos también permitirán compartir todo lo aprendido. Al regresar mis servicios están a disposición de mi país a través de diversos programas sociales. El Salvador es un país con muchas carencias y desigualdades sociales, pero todxs tenemos un potencial de cambio y mejora continua, todxs nos merecemos una vida mejor y con los fondos de la campaña, CONTRIBUIREMOS, trabajando meditación con grupos vulnerables y de manera personalizada en las recompensas.

¿Qué logrará usted como colaborador?

Usted como colaborador esta transformando una realidad social. Empezando por el Viaje de Anicha, pasando por las personas que lo sigan y terminando en aquellas que se beneficiarán del conocimiento adquirido después de 1 mes y medio de trabajo, meditación y viaje; Además , contribuye a las actividades presenciales de formación en mi propio país.

A través del viaje y la meditación, observo y comparto lo que aprendo de nuevas formas de ver la vida. Esto me hace feliz por que con mi ejemplo espero inspirar felicidad para que sigamos nuestros sueños. 

Cuando viajo en mi país comparto el aprendizaje con mis herramientas de psicología, meditación y juego. aportando al proceso de transformación social de los salvadoreños, desde el autoconocimiento emocional para una aumentar la conciencia personal y contribuir a una transformación social.

Así que con tu dinero estás invirtiendo en la creación, edición y producción de material audiovisual y me permite servir a otros para incrementar la conciencia y vivencia emocional. Haz de caso que estas pagando para ver una película, y que además ayudas a otros a que sean parte de ella.

¿Y si no logramos la meta total, a dónde irían los fondos que dones?

El proyecto 'El viaje de anicha' no se va a dar por vencido, continuaremos con bajo presupuesto, más lento, pero continuaremos:

  • Desarrollo de talleres presenciales en posible colaboración ONG´s y gobierno con niños de El Salvador.
  • Compra de equipo de producción adecuado al presupuesto
  • Salario al equipo de colaboradores 

   

¿Cuánto financiamiento necesitamos?

El viaje de anicha necesita $3000 para seguir creciendo y mejorar en el equipo de grabación, así como los talleres de formación para brindar mejor calidad de producción a las personas.

  • GoPro hero 5: $600
  • Karma Grip, Drone and estabilizador: $800
  • Estuche a prueba de agua: $50
  • Trípode multifunción: $70
  • Arnés para la cabeza: $20
  • Soporte de boca: $30
  • Organización y ejecución del programa meditar y jugar por salud mental en distintas instancias de sociales
  • Ejecución de programa en institutos de niñez y adolescencia: $450
  • Ejecución de programa en Asilos  $450
  • Gastos de publicidad y marketing $300
  • Reconocimiento monetario para recurso humano: $300
  • Otros gastos: $250

Recompensas

Viajar y no compartir lo aprendido con tu gente no es viajar

  • $1 Nadie se queda pobre sin un dólar al menos que ya seas pobre(!) Al alcanzar el primer dólar taller en #1 centro de niños y niñas.
    La jornada "meditar y viajar por salud mental" constan de un momento de juego que lleva a la base el reconocimiento de las emociones a través de las sensaciones corporales, en segundo lugar, introducción a la meditación Vipassana. La jornada se llevará acabo en una modalidad de aprender-haciendo que tendrá a la base la actitud de viaje, cambio... Anicha.
    - -Al alcanzar la primera meta de diez dólares realizaremos la segunda jornada de "meditar y viajar por salud mental" 
     
  • $10 ¿Queres saber como viaje por Israel y Jordania por 6 meses con menos de 3500$?Te cuento todo lo que aprendí sobre las nuevas maneras de viajar por periodos extendidos de tiempo y con bajo presupuesto. Además de una que otra historia de viaje o de amor.
     
  • $18 Los recuerdos físicos ayudan a mantener la dirección. Se entregara un frasquito con arena del Río de Jordanía adornado por Artesanas de la Isla Tasajera.
     
  • $48 La unión hace la fuerza. Taller de Yoga con mi maestro de yoga, Koru que tiene una especialidad en el reconocimiento de las emociones e una Introducción a la meditación Vipassana. Juntos trabajaremos para brindarte herramientas para identificar las sensaciones que acompañan a las emociones y permitir un mayor control individual.
     
  • $95 juguemos. La casa sombrilla, arte y circo social, es la primera escuela de formación en circo social de El Salvador. A través de los malabares se trabajan aspectos de autoestima, autoconcepto y capacidad de agencia; además de los beneficios en la meditación como la concentración y la perseverancia. Con esta recompensa también asistes en un taller introductorio a la meditación Vipassana y finalmente una sesión de preguntas y respuestas conmigo, recuerda que después de horas y horas de silencio y meditación se pueden ver las cosas con nuevas perspectivas.
     
  • $180. Sesión psicológica enfocada en el reconocimiento corporal y la consecuente identificación de las emociones y reconocer el impacto a nivel de pensamiento y acciones.
    La sesión puede ser para grupos, empresas o individuos que quieran encontrar en sí mismos la herramienta para tomar mejores decisiones y afrontar las vicisitudes de la vida.
     
  • $495 Sesión psicológica para grupos o individuos + taller introductorio a la meditación Vipassana + diploma de participación + Un viaje al estilo Anicha 

  El impacto

  ¿Por qué mi proyecto es valioso para el mundo?

‘El viaje de anicha’ es un proyecto único. Soy una salvadoreña, latinoamericana que medita y viaja sola por el mundo. Pocas chicas toman la decisión de salirse de su zona de confort y mucho menos aventurarse e irse solas a países desconocidos para aprender de sus culturas y meditar. En este proyecto incorporo elementos de crecimiento espiritual, social y de empoderamiento femenino, toco temas poco habituales en los medios digitales, que pueden ser de gran ayuda al desarrollo integral de los seres humanos en general. Pretendo capturar en video, la cultura de otros países, sus paisajes y su gente para poder aprender del resto del mundo mediante la filosofía de la impermanencia, es decir, anicha.

Nuestro historial de éxito en proyectos

  • En 2013 fundé junto a otros estudiantes y amigos de la Universidad José Simeón Cañas, UCA una organización ecologista denominada Somos Tutal, vinculada a la conciencia ecológica y a la consecuente lucha social, esta organización sigue viva a la fecha con diferente administración.
  • En 2013 contribuimos junto a mi ex-novio, a crear el primer circo social en una comunidad de alto riesgo en El Salvador: Vacilarte. El proyecto aún está vivo gracias al apoyo de diversas organizaciones no gubernamentales y el arduo trabajo de la comunidad.
  • En 2013 fui elegida como presidenta estudiantil de la Facultad de Humanidades de la UCA, durante mi gestión realicé junto con el equipo, la campaña de identidad “Yosoyuca”.
  • En 2014 desarrollé junto con colegas un programa de empoderamiento femenino a través del arte y bisutería en la Isla Tasajera, la Paz. El proyecto continúa y lo pueden encontrar como ‘Artesanas’ (son las que decoraran una de las recompensas).
  • En 2014 formé parte del primer grupo de mujeres malabaristas “Buruka colectiva”
  • En 2015 formé parte del grupo de Stand Up Comedy “ComediaEs”, dirigido por Fernando Rodríguez y producido por Grupo Caverna donde realicé y presenté mi propio material cómico. La comedia sigue viva en mis videos.
  • 2016 Trabaje para mejorar la calidad del cuidado infantil en El Salvador en una organización no gubernamental pero con alianza con el gobierno.

 

Riesgos y desafíos de la campaña

  • Desconocimiento sobre como realizar las contribuciones
  • Poco interes en recibir o permitir el desarrollo del programa.
  • Baja audiencia y receptividad de parte de los participantes.

¿Cómo lo superaremos?

  • Primero explicar detalladamente los pasos a seguir para la creación de una cuenta en indiegogo.com y la manera de realizar la contribución.
  • Jornada de planificación y ejecución con altos estándares de calidad
  • Distribuir el material en nuestras redes sociales.
  • Planificación previa de las rutas de acceso y promocionales en las redes sociales

   ¿Cómo colaborar con el proyecto de manera no económica?

Todas las personas que no puedan colaborar económicamente, pueden suscribirse al canal de YouTube del proyecto y a todas las redes sociales de ‘El viaje de anicha’, Facebook, Instagram y todas las demás que aparezcan en la historia. Las personas también pueden utilizar el hashtag #MeditarYViajar en sus propios videos y fotografías de viaje e incluso menciones al proyecto en el contenido de los materiales. En estos espacios comparto experiencias de viaje que considero enriquecedoras para todxs.

¡Hey gente compártan! Agradecería mucho pudieran difundir la campaña ‘Viajera con causa’ por todos los medios que les sea posibles, en sus redes sociales, comentar con sus amigxs incluso invitarme a realizar entrevistas en medios de manera virtual o presencial (cuando me encuentre en mi país). Estoy abierta a participar en actividades en los medios de comunicación. Y si de repente se les ocurre que desean que realice un taller virtual o presencial, no duden en escribirme, lo haré con mucho gusto elviajedeanicha@gmail.com.

¡Quiero agradecer a Indiegogo por existir!

Realmente es una plataforma muy completa, que permite el desarrollo de ideas, sueños y desarrollo profesional a través de metodologías innovadoras de trabajo. si desean ayudar a promover la campaña, el sitio posee varias herramientas para la difusión de la misma: ‘Viajera con causa’.

GoPro hero 5: $600
Karma Grip, Drone and estabilizador: $800
Estuche a prueba de agua: $50
Trípode multifunción: $70
Arnés para la cabeza: $20
Soporte de boca: $30
Organización y ejecución del programa meditar y jugar por salud mental en distintas instancias de sociales
Ejecución de programa en institutos de niñez y adolescencia: $450
Ejecución de programa en Asilos  $450
Gastos de publicidad y marketing $300
Reconocimiento monetario para recurso humano: $300
Otros gastos: $250
RecompensasViajar y no compartir lo aprendido con tu gente no es viajar
$1 Nadie se queda pobre sin un dólar al menos que ya seas pobre(!) Al alcanzar el primer dólar taller en #1 centro de niños y niñas.La jornada "meditar y viajar por salud mental" constan de un momento de juego que lleva a la base el reconocimiento de las emociones a través de las sensaciones corporales, en segundo lugar, introducción a la meditación Vipassana. La jornada se llevará acabo en una modalidad de aprender-haciendo que tendrá a la base la actitud de viaje, cambio... Anicha.- -Al alcanzar la primera meta de diez dólares realizaremos la segunda jornada de "meditar y viajar por salud mental"  
$10 ¿Queres saber como viaje por Israel y Jordania por 6 meses con menos de 3500$?Te cuento todo lo que aprendí sobre las nuevas maneras de viajar por periodos extendidos de tiempo y con bajo presupuesto. Además de una que otra historia de viaje o de amor. 
$18 Los recuerdos físicos ayudan a mantener la dirección. Se entregara un frasquito con arena del Río de Jordanía adornado por Artesanas de la Isla Tasajera. 
$48 La unión hace la fuerza. Taller de Yoga con mi maestro de yoga, Koru que tiene una especialidad en el reconocimiento de las emociones e una Introducción a la meditación Vipassana. Juntos trabajaremos para brindarte herramientas para identificar las sensaciones que acompañan a las emociones y permitir un mayor control individual. 
$95 juguemos. La casa sombrilla, arte y circo social, es la primera escuela de formación en circo social de El Salvador. A través de los malabares se trabajan aspectos de autoestima, autoconcepto y capacidad de agencia; además de los beneficios en la meditación como la concentración y la perseverancia. Con esta recompensa también asistes en un taller introductorio a la meditación Vipassana y finalmente una sesión de preguntas y respuestas conmigo, recuerda que después de horas y horas de silencio y meditación se pueden ver las cosas con nuevas perspectivas. 
$180. Sesión psicológica enfocada en el reconocimiento corporal y la consecuente identificación de las emociones y reconocer el impacto a nivel de pensamiento y acciones.La sesión puede ser para grupos, empresas o individuos que quieran encontrar en sí mismos la herramienta para tomar mejores decisiones y afrontar las vicisitudes de la vida. 
$495 Sesión psicológica para grupos o individuos + taller introductorio a la meditación Vipassana + diploma de participación + Un viaje al estilo Anicha 
  El impacto  ¿Por qué mi proyecto es valioso para el mundo?‘El viaje de anicha’ es un proyecto único. Soy una salvadoreña, latinoamericana que medita y viaja sola por el mundo. Pocas chicas toman la decisión de salirse de su zona de confort y mucho menos aventurarse e irse solas a países desconocidos para aprender de sus culturas y meditar. En este proyecto incorporo elementos de crecimiento espiritual, social y de empoderamiento femenino, toco temas poco habituales en los medios digitales, que pueden ser de gran ayuda al desarrollo integral de los seres humanos en general. Pretendo capturar en video, la cultura de otros países, sus paisajes y su gente para poder aprender del resto del mundo mediante la filosofía de la impermanencia, es decir, anicha.Nuestro historial de éxito en proyectos
En 2013 fundé junto a otros estudiantes y amigos de la Universidad José Simeón Cañas, UCA una organización ecologista denominada Somos Tutal, vinculada a la conciencia ecológica y a la consecuente lucha social, esta organización sigue viva a la fecha con diferente administración.
En 2013 contribuimos junto a mi ex-novio, a crear el primer circo social en una comunidad de alto riesgo en El Salvador: Vacilarte. El proyecto aún está vivo gracias al apoyo de diversas organizaciones no gubernamentales y el arduo trabajo de la comunidad.
En 2013 fui elegida como presidenta estudiantil de la Facultad de Humanidades de la UCA, durante mi gestión realicé junto con el equipo, la campaña de identidad “Yosoyuca”.
En 2014 desarrollé junto con colegas un programa de empoderamiento femenino a través del arte y bisutería en la Isla Tasajera, la Paz. El proyecto continúa y lo pueden encontrar como ‘Artesanas’ (son las que decoraran una de las recompensas).
En 2014 formé parte del primer grupo de mujeres malabaristas “Buruka colectiva”
En 2015 formé parte del grupo de Stand Up Comedy “ComediaEs”, dirigido por Fernando Rodríguez y producido por Grupo Caverna donde realicé y presenté mi propio material cómico. La comedia sigue viva en mis videos.
2016 Trabaje para mejorar la calidad del cuidado infantil en El Salvador en una organización no gubernamental pero con alianza con el gobierno.
 Riesgos y desafíos de la campaña
Desconocimiento sobre como realizar las contribuciones
Poco interes en recibir o permitir el desarrollo del programa.
Baja audiencia y receptividad de parte de los participantes.
¿Cómo lo superaremos?
Primero explicar detalladamente los pasos a seguir para la creación de una cuenta en indiegogo.com y la manera de realizar la contribución.
Jornada de planificación y ejecución con altos estándares de calidad
Distribuir el material en nuestras redes sociales.
Planificación previa de las rutas de acceso y promocionales en las redes sociales
   ¿Cómo colaborar con el proyecto de manera no económica?Todas las personas que no puedan colaborar económicamente, pueden suscribirse al canal de YouTube del proyecto y a todas las redes sociales de ‘El viaje de anicha’, Facebook, Instagram y todas las demás que aparezcan en la historia. Las personas también pueden utilizar el hashtag #MeditarYViajar en sus propios videos y fotografías de viaje e incluso menciones al proyecto en el contenido de los materiales. En estos espacios comparto experiencias de viaje que considero enriquecedoras para todxs.¡Hey gente compártan! Agradecería mucho pudieran difundir la campaña ‘Viajera con causa’ por todos los medios que les sea posibles, en sus redes sociales, comentar con sus amigxs incluso invitarme a realizar entrevistas en medios de manera virtual o presencial (cuando me encuentre en mi país). Estoy abierta a participar en actividades en los medios de comunicación. Y si de repente se les ocurre que desean que realice un taller virtual o presencial, no duden en escribirme, lo haré con mucho gusto elviajedeanicha@gmail.com.¡Quiero agradecer a Indiegogo por existir!Realmente es una plataforma muy completa, que permite el desarrollo de ideas, sueños y desarrollo profesional a través de metodologías innovadoras de trabajo. si desean ayudar a promover la campaña, el sitio posee varias herramientas para la difusión de la misma: ‘Viajera con causa’.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Star Wars fanatics and lifelong friends Josh Combs and Stefan Spallino are going to be getting loose and talking Star Wars every Wednesday night, along with a variety of guests. We provide the latest Star Wars news and rumors, we cover a variety of topics including deep character histories, movie breakdowns, animated series, video games, Star Wars Land, ridiculous and awesome fan theories, our own predictions for the future of the franchise and give you a closer look at the history and making of the Star Wars Universe.

There are tons of Star Wars fan podcasts, but there aren't any "adult" Star Wars podcasts, in video, on YouTube, in the back corner of the Mos Eisley Cantina... so we're doing it. We just need the Galactic Credits to travel to Tatooine!

What We Need & What You Get

With your support, we will be able to upgrade equipment,  make the editing process quicker and the listening (and VIEWING) process more enjoyable. Here's what your contribution will help us with :

Camera(s)

Lighting

Set Decoration

Misc Cables and Adapters

Software

and More Monthly Giveaway Items for you!​

 

For a $1 donation you will receive one free entry to our monthly Star Wars giveaway. 

This month we are giving away one very rare Black Series Imperial AT-ST Walker and Driver (3.75 Inch Scale) WALMART EXCLUSIVE

Other Ways You Can Help

Rate, Review and Share our videos, and Follow/Subscribe to Star Wars After Hours for a new episode every Wednesday!

http://www.starwarsafterhours.com

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClr8vyRR3vZO8q...

http://facebook.com/starwarsafterhourspodcast

http://www.instagram.com/starwarsafterhours

http://www.twitter.com/swafterhours

story:
Short Summary

Dave and Ethan constantly talk about Weird Al for hours at a time. It’s not unusual for them to be on the phone discussing Al into the wee hours of the morning, so it was kind of a natural progression to start up a podcast. Their conversations would be fun for anyone with the appropriate level of nerdiness, and they want to share them with you. And as much as this podcast is an outlet for Dave and Ethan, it’s meant to be one for you, too. Our goal is not only to entertain you, but also to engage you in conversation!

 

About Us

Dave "Elvis" Rossi & Ethan Ullman are two of the biggest Weird Al fans in the world!   

You may recognize Dave as the fan who got Al the Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and raised the necessary $40,000 to pay for it. He is also known for his extensive Weird Al collection, his Weird Al tattoos, and soon will be known for this podcast!

Ethan is amassing an impressive Weird Al collection of his own, as well as spending time as a comedian and comedy radio show host, having interviewed Jimmy Fallon, Tracy Morgan, Marc Maron, Kate Flannery, Awkwafina, Margaret Cho, and even Weird Al himself.

 

What We Need and What You Get

Besides paying off our professionally recorded podcast theme and professionally drawn podcast logo, there is equipment that we need to purchase to make our podcast sound great, and fees associated with hosting and streaming the podcast to you.  We are happy to absorb some of these costs ourselves, but it does add up.

We realize that our goal is ambitious.  We are just asking that if you can help us keep costs down, please do.  Either way, we hope you listen and enjoy the podcast as much as we enjoy making it!

For those who are able to help, we have some amazing perks to share with you!  On top of autographed pictures from Al himself, rare out-of-print tour passes, and hard-to-find promotional material from UHF, we are digging deep into their personal collections to bring you amazing items you can't live with out.   And if physical perks aren't your thing, you can sit in on a podcast with us, or get exclusive access to digital perks.

 

The Impact

Our podcast will feature current news and events, discussions about rare collectibles and songs, and interviews with celebrity fans and people relevant to Al-related projects.  

We're not taking the decision to raise funds lightly.  We are both passionate fans, and would do pretty much anything for Al.  Dave's passion helped get Al his Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.  All the money raised for Al's Star came from you guys, the fans, so we know the power Al's fans hold!  We sincerely believe in this podcast and we hope you do too!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, some people just can't contribute financially.  But that doesn't mean you still can't help.  Please share our campaign with your family and friends and anyone else you think might be interested.  You never know who is an Al fan until you ask.

Also, please listen and subscribe to our podcast.  It really means a lot to us to know that we are reaching Al's fans.  There's details how to subscribe and follow us on social media on our website 2000inch.com

 

Stretch Goals

$2,000

At this level, we have covered the expenses we’d already put into making Dave & Ethan’s 2000” Weird Al Podcast the best podcast ever, plus we will be able to continue commissioning amazing artists and musicians for fun artwork, original songs and more!

 

$2,666

But If we collectively reach our $2000 goal + $666 we will commission a very special "Extra Gory Version" of our theme song! What does it mean to have an "Extra Gory Version" of our theme song? We don't know either, but we'd so much love to find out!

 

$40,000

If we raise $40,000, we will attempt to get Dave & Ethan’s 2000” Weird Al Podcast a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

story:
Hello friends!

The Nerd Report is a podcast that we would like to eventually add to radio stations or TV show that can be shown around the world. Imagine a talk show that talks about all aspects of nerd/geek culture that includes Cosplay, Movies, TV, Video Games, and much more. We can make that happen and you will have a voice here too! 

Luis Lecca, from the website Nuke the Fridge & Nerd Report, is one of the hosts & program directors. He has worked on the air with many radio stations including Power 106, Groove Radio, B100 FM, and more. We will not have a problem bringing top Hollywood celebrities and insiders for interviews. Also interactions with you - The listeners. 

Today we are asking for your help

Our mix board (Responsible for the audio on our videos) is dying and it needs to be replaced. 

This fundraiser will help us purchase the Rode RODECaster Pro Podcast Production Studio

Thanks for your consideration!

story:
What is "Omegaman"?

Omegaman is an audio drama about super heroes, villains, and those caught in between. The first half of Season 1 takes place mostly within a prison specifically designed for super-villains, and follows Jennifer Jeanne, a reporter on a mission to uncover a secret conspiracy within the ranks of those who were mostly all placed there by Omegaman. 

The first seven episodes are free!

You can check out the first seven episodes online at www.omegamanpodcast.com or wherever you download podcasts. I hope that the cliff-hanger of an ending will leave you wanting more. 

What We Need & What You Get

The first 7 episodes were paid for out of pocket by me, Jason Chao, the writer, director, and editor of Omegaman. But I need more funding to help finish the season and attempt another. Much of the cost is to help feed my family while I write, record, and edit, but also to help pay the actors and crew what they are worth and to be able to access the tools and libraries to really make the audio drama come alive. 

What you get is the advancement of the story that hopefully you already like.  And if you give extra, you may even score a cameo in an upcoming episode. 

Our current perk levels are:

  • $20 donation = I'll include your name  in the show notes of each episode and online at our website.
  • $50 donation = previous perk as well as a 1 week exclusive sneak peak when the rest of the season drops. 
  • $100 donation = Previous perk as well as your name will be credited by me at the end of every episode for the remainder of season 1.
  • $200 donation = You will be credited with a special thanks at the beginning of every episode in the remainder of season 1 (which you can voice record your name yourself).
  • $300+ donation = All of the previous perks as well as a minimum one-line cameo in one of the upcoming episodes. 

If you don't wish to be credited, please let me know and I will keep you anonymous. 

What I can do with each of our goals:

For each of our goals, I can gauge the interest in the show and spend time and resources accordingly.

  • $4000 - Finish Season 1 and call it a day. I have an idea for a ending that will take around 3-4 episodes more. It will conclude Omegaman. 
  • $6000 - Finish Season 1 on a budget and leave room for Season 2. This will be about another 7 episodes. The budget will come from the fact that I won't be adding many more character and also will be keeping sound effects free and simple.
  • $8000 - previous one but just better. I can get more actors to fill in some of the roles that we haven't heard from yet (Warden Jeffries, William and Anikka Gaines, and more) and also gain access to higher quality recording equipment and sound libraries. 
  • $10,000+ - Everything and more. I will probably start writing season 2. I really doubt I'll get here so if I do, I'll have to think about more of what I can do

The wonder and cost of audio dramas

I personally love audio dramas because of the potential of imagination that they can inspire. Audio has the power to unlock our own vivid dreams to fill in fantastical visuals that would be unachievable on such a small budget. For film, if I wanted a helicopter, then I'd have to rent a helicopter. For audio, I can just cut in the sound of a helicopter and your brain fills in the rest. The budget therefore for audio dramas goes to the time that it takes to make it, and the tools and the actors who can really help bring it to life. 

For the first seven episodes, most of the actors took far below what they are worth because they loved the story or did it as favors to me and my producer, Selah Victor. But as a Christian and a man of integrity, I would love to be able to pay them suitably for their time and talent. I also have a family to feed. The first seven episodes took about 3 months of writing, recording, and editing and I would love to be able to dedicate my time to helping bring season 1 to full fruition. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially there are some powerful ways you can help.

  • Listen and subscribe! It helps boost the algorithms to get it to others.
  • Share it with others. Whether it's on facebook, instagram, or even in person, telling people about the first seven episodes that are entirely free will help tremendously in getting support for the show.  You can find graphics for download at www.omegamanpodcast.com
  • Leave a review on Apple Podcasts. It helps to show that people like, and positive reviews make me feel good and more inspired to keep going.

For each of our goals, I can gauge the interest in the show and spend time and resources accordingly.

$4000 - Finish Season 1 and call it a day. I have an idea for a ending that will take around 3-4 episodes more. It will conclude Omegaman. 
$6000 - Finish Season 1 on a budget and leave room for Season 2. This will be about another 7 episodes. The budget will come from the fact that I won't be adding many more character and also will be keeping sound effects free and simple.
$8000 - previous one but just better. I can get more actors to fill in some of the roles that we haven't heard from yet (Warden Jeffries, William and Anikka Gaines, and more) and also gain access to higher quality recording equipment and sound libraries. 
$10,000+ - Everything and more. I will probably start writing season 2. I really doubt I'll get here so if I do, I'll have to think about more of what I can do


The wonder and cost of audio dramas
I personally love audio dramas because of the potential of imagination that they can inspire. Audio has the power to unlock our own vivid dreams to fill in fantastical visuals that would be unachievable on such a small budget. For film, if I wanted a helicopter, then I'd have to rent a helicopter. For audio, I can just cut in the sound of a helicopter and your brain fills in the rest. The budget therefore for audio dramas goes to the time that it takes to make it, and the tools and the actors who can really help bring it to life. 
For the first seven episodes, most of the actors took far below what they are worth because they loved the story or did it as favors to me and my producer, Selah Victor. But as a Christian and a man of integrity, I would love to be able to pay them suitably for their time and talent. I also have a family to feed. The first seven episodes took about 3 months of writing, recording, and editing and I would love to be able to dedicate my time to helping bring season 1 to full fruition. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute financially there are some powerful ways you can help.

Listen and subscribe! It helps boost the algorithms to get it to others.
Share it with others. Whether it's on facebook, instagram, or even in person, telling people about the first seven episodes that are entirely free will help tremendously in getting support for the show.  You can find graphics for download at www.omegamanpodcast.com

Leave a review on Apple Podcasts. It helps to show that people like, and positive reviews make me feel good and more inspired to keep going.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there,

I'm Ian Knowles, creator of Neon Shadows A Noir Tale and voice actor of Frank Dixon.  This campaign exists to help fund our second and and most ambitious season yet of Neon Shadows A Noir Tale.  Neon Shadows is a noir drama podcast series. We absolutely love noir and feel it is an underserved genre especially in new media. If you haven't heard season one yet you can listen here  https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/thank-you... consider the first season a success and a solid proof of concept. Help us keep it alive and well!

What We Need

We are asking for at least $500 for equipment upgrades such as microphones and sound proofing , advertising, and being able to pay voice actors who are currently working for fun and passion alone. If we are only partially funded the money will prioritize equipment upgrades and providing voice actors with a "work from home" setup where they can record remotely. Especially given the covid -19 circumstances this will be the highest priority. 

Risks & Challenges

Covid-19 and pandemic regulations put a damper on creative projects, planning, and gathering together to work on the project.  Production is a slower process when we adhere to these new standards of procedure. However,  the digital age affords us alternatives and with the right equipment and management the effect should be minimal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand in these tough times money may be scarce. But let's say you love the idea or you love season one but, how do you help? We've gotten thousands of downloads by word of mouth and organic discovery and thats where you come in! Share this fundraiser campaign with those who may be interested.  Follow us on all our social media such as Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. Heck, we are even on LinkedIn! Share our posts and tell people to check out Neon Shadows on Patreon as well!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Harleigh Nelson, and I am looking to fund a creative and educational podcast series that shines a light on women that have made contributions to our societies! I first started my collegiate career as a History major, and chose to follow my passion for Media Production and Performance Art. During my time as a History major, I discovered incredible women that have made astounding contributions that I firmly believe would have enriched our everyday lives if we had known about them. I discovered that we women, weren't just sitting there twiddling our thumbs. We work working, educating, and creating. I have been fortunate enough to find a way for my two passions to come together, and I want to share that with people. I don't want my nieces and future daughters to have to get to the collegiate level to be inspired by other women.  

What We Need & What You Get

This funding is to help with the initial cost of the podcast. 

  • $550  for Portraits of 3 ladies
  • $400 for Creators hours
  • $200 for writing and transcribing software 
  • $100 for editing software
  • $65 for Microphone

Enjoy stickers, posters, mugs, and your pick of a lady!

The Impact

Your contributions will allow me to gather research over more women, create poetic art pieces over a woman's life, record the piece, and bring on a guest for a 20-30 minute discussion over the woman. 

Risks & Challenges

I have faced a few obstacles while producing this podcast. The biggest, being time and money. I have been working full time while going to school to finish my Bachelors degree. With this crowd funding, I will be able to take the time off of the day job that has been supporting me throughout college, and dedicate it to this podcast. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sending good intentions, and sharing with your friends and family would be so appreciated if you are not able to make monetary contributions

story:
Who We Are

A team of High School and College students but first of all science enthusiasts who want to bring to the community a good and short podcast about hot topics like AI, renewable energy and pollution.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Microphones, Editing software, microphone stands, audio interface, RSS feeds, headphones.
  • You will get an original podcast totally free 

The Impact

This podcast will make people enthusiast about science, even of the hardest topics.

This podcast will be totally free and shared on a lot of platforms to spread our love to science to everyone, also to children.

Only with your help we can make this possible and buy all the stuff we need to start recording a good quality podcast in the shortest time possible.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge of this project is to find interesting topics and make short but didactic podcasts, this goal can be achieved also with the help of our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us sharing our project to your friends, specially italians one.

The best way to start is making a big community so don't forget to follow our totally free podcasts.

story:
How It Started...

As the global pandemic disrupted countless aspects of life for many people, fandom communities anticipating in-person events had to find new ways to come together.

In an effort to support the new era of virtual events, former media company Multifacetedacg Productions, LLC created a 1-day online event to celebrate the diverse podcast community within the Korean Wave. The festival and its 6 sponsors brought together over 60 fans and media guests, 12 podcasts and online radio shows, and contributed a donation to the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI).

Where It's Heading...

The event will return as a 2-day online experience with increased focus on raising awareness and funds for NAMI. While the festival will bring together people from many areas of the fanbase, the festival hopes to continue advocating for minority mental health month.

Kpop Social Night (KPSN) is a family-friendly fandom event that promotes fun and fandom pride and, now as a stand-alone entity, aims to annually host KPSN Podcast Fest as its leading affair.

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign will make:

  • Help many in the Hallyu fanbase access fact-based information about mental health
  • Advocacy for quality mental healthcare and safe resources easier for minorities in the U.S.
  • Creating an annual fundraiser an accessible fan-driven experience for Hallyu fans at an affordable price

Goals

Though the event is several weeks away, we cannot meet our goals without your support. Through this crowdfunding, we are making steps towards achieving these goals:

  • Securing at least 20 podcasts/online radio shows as special guests 
  • At least 100 General Admission pre-sale tickets sold at the 2020 price of $5.00 USD
  • At least $150.00 USD towards the fundraising goal of $500.00 USD

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Share tinyurl.com/kpsnfun21 and Indiegogo's share tools
  • Retweet, repost, and share social media posts from our Facebook, Instagram, and/or Twitter accounts (@kpopsocialnight)
  • Volunteer to help with the event

 

Thank you for your support. We'll see you this summer!

story:
Who we are and what we're about

Just so you know, we are a father daughter team, we aren't crazy (well, just a little) and we actually like each other and most of all, we're residential designers.  We meet homeowners every day that have questions.  Questions that come tumbling out at mach speed in the grocery line once they find out what we do for a living.  Invariably, they want to do something to their house but they have no clue where to start.  They are often lost or have been told conflicting information and quickly approaching panic stage.  So in an effort to cut down our time in the grocery store and speed the lines along, we have chosen to embark on the noble journey of a podcast.  The problem is, with every google search you are drowning in people trying to sell you "a solution".  When you talk to a hammer salesman, every problem looks like a nail.  Good news!  We don't want to sell you a damn thing and we've been doing this for forty years.  We are doing this podcast business without sponsors so that we can keep the content unadulterated from retailer's grubby hands.  In case you don't know, this isn't exactly easy 'cauz makin' us look this pretty ain't cheap.  So we need you!  Actually, help us help you.  Take a gander at our video and pledge a few bucks.  Hell, pledge a lotta bucks!  If you need a little more convincing, zip over to our nearly finished website and learn how delightful we can be.  We are nerds and deeply love everything about homes from design through construction and truly want to help every one of you we can.  Can you smell our despiration?

What we need and where we're headed

Like I said, we’re residential designers. Although a career we enjoy very much, the odds we are going to retire rich are slim to zilch. Launching  a podcast isn’t something you throw into the budget very easily. Despite that, we have invested about $50k in modifications to our design studio to begin the process of showing you the real world of home design and renovation construction. No scripts allowed. We want you to see how it really happens. To our chagrin, we pretty well tapped out our nest egg.  Aaron is pondering standing on a street corner with a metal cup to clink around for pocket change. Help save her from this humiliation. You’d think as her father I wouldn’t let her do that, but I’m not a proud man. Seriously, to complete everything necessary to bring this production to full video production and routine weekly operation, we’ll need $100,000 in a perfect world. To launch the podcast in an audio only format and neutralize our debt, we need $60,000. Did we mention, you don’t get rich in design?

At this point, we have installed boom mics, fixed cameras, an audio mixing station, a state-of-the art editing system and office space for the poor soul that will work tirelessly to make us look pretty every week. However, we aren’t done yet. We still need body mics, software, field cameras, and a slew of other equipment. Moreover, we need operating cash to launch and sustain the podcast and related personnel for at least six months as our fan base expands. We do have sponsors standing in the wings that don’t violate our ethic of avoiding retail influence. In fairness, these are all companies you’re going to want to know. Unfortunately, they want to see us catch air before they dive into the deep end with us.  So this is where you come in. We need your couch cushion change (or tax refund) to get this fun produced.

What does this mean to you?

When you read my bio, you’ll see I have been doing this for forty years. 27 of those years I was concurrently a builder. For four decades I have watched this industry change in so many ways, I cannot begin to list them here. The over arching result of these changes, is that this industry have become complicated, confusing, frustrating and often just daunting for the venturesome homeowner. The most enjoyable part of the process is the day you come up with the idea you want to do something profound to your home. Just about everything after that leads to what we call ‘Maalox moments’. Our mission is to ratchet down the need for antacids, empowering you with knowledge. My industry has devolved into a retail based poop tornado. A poop-nado of misinformation. We are asking you to invest in what we are confident will be the best resource for an honest perspective and realistic management of expectations. Please partner with us to right the course of this wayward ship we call residential home building. The long term format of this podcast is a subscription base. It’s the only way we could practically foresee maintaining a quality broadcast without the influence of retail sponsors.  Just so you know, this isn’t the last time we’ll ask you for money. So what’s the downside? If we don’t fund, we will still produce this program, as our passion runs too deep (and we’re in too deep) to abandon ship. However, without your generosity, we will have to limit the frequency of our broadcast and forgo video for an indefinite period. Let’s be honest, this will be far more exciting if you can see our mugs and watch Aaron do a faceplant from time to time (she’s not the queen of grace). So now you have an idea of who we are and what we need. Besides a fabulous program and a wealth of knowledge that you can delight fellow homeowners with, check out the perks to see what you get (other than bragging rights).

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello there,

We are building an AI-based "dark web news service".

We aren't very good at writing long descriptions.

We are much better at  collecting crumbs of information from various sources. Stuff most people can't find. Then arranging them into presentable news items for these people. Something like the evening news, but with real news.

You know what we mean. If you don't, your donation is still be appreciated.

May Terry Davis smile on us all.

story:
My name is Mike, a screenwriter with fifty-two ten minute scripts ready to be told. I am putting together a set in my home to film ten minute story teller videos for YouTube. This is more than a dream. I have leukemia and want to a make a living.

I need to raise $800 to purchase a camera, tripod, microphone, teleprompter, and  lighting. 

Most of my stoeies are dramas, but I have other genres as well. I believe people will enjoy my work.

story:
Assumptions of the project

The realization of a project and in particular of a videogame on an independent level poses technical and motivational difficulties that can overwhelm anyone.

Always in the balance between dream and regret, the journey towards the creation of a video game in my opinion needs sharing and motivation even more than the necessary skills.

The indieGo.xyz project (indie for independent game development, Go stay for start your project, don't give up and keep dreaming and xyz recalls to the three Cartesian axes foundation of the development of a video game) is born from the passion of a single person and wants to be a natural meeting point and a technical and motivational sharing point for anyone who embraces the dream of creating their own game, whether for passion or for work.

The project has already been born and can be found at this link: https://www.indiego.xyz

Already then why apply for funds you are wondering?

Because a good idea and a good realization are not enough. It is necessary to make yourself known and get to every possible developer out there and in order to do it in the end you come up against the need to go through the expensive channels available on the web like socials, YouTube and more.

Since its birth, hundreds of developers have joined together on indieGo.xyz, but to make the necessary quality leap, while keeping the project open and free, the personal budget of a single person is not enough.

Without considering the thousands and more ideas related to design, t-shirts, partnerships, mobile apps, events, hosting improvements and more.

Ideas that also come from the same community that is small but passionate.

The project can become a real job with callaborators but now this can be only a dream.

My personal dream has found a concrete form that is also a guarantee for you that you read that there is more than words here but it is also clear that for great results the passion and a necessarily limited personal budget are no longer enough.

Clearly the first way to support the project is to sign up now @ https://www.indiego.xyz and take an active part in the discussions but if you believe (and of course you want) that this project may have a great future as it is in my head and as I wrote above or even want to offer a coffee (I drink too many in reality) or maybe a pizza (I'm Italian on the other hand) to this poor dreamer I could only be grateful, first of all because you'll let me know that this my idea (which could have died many times) also has value for many others.

I would like to insert below a part of an article that I wrote and visible on indieGo.xyz site which is the genesis of everything.

Thanks so far.

Where it all begun

A new site dedicated to games development? With all the ideas can you throw money and energy to accomplish just that?

Certainly these and other questions can be made to me and for sure someone who will end up on these pages will do it for sure.

 

So why not talk briefly about what prompted me to do this.

 

It all started in the 80s for me when I was a kid and my parents gave me a Commodore 64. On the switch on, incomprehensible words immediately appeared on the cathode ray tube in my bedroom:

64K, RAM, BYTES that resounded in my mind like an arcane rebus born from some kind of brilliant and superior mind.

And then that cursor immediately after the word READY.

 

A blinking cursor.

 

I could write!

 

Yeah, but what?

 

I would like to be able to tell the story of a wunderkind who in just a few days created an elegant algorithm out of nothing or who managed to program under some kind of inspiration a puzzle called Tetris which then entered the history of video games.

Yes, I would like...but it wasn't like that.

 

But something changed forever and the passion of video games before and then programming accompanies me ever since until the idea of ​​combining these two aspects flashed into my mind like something serious and possible.

And I'm not talking about a profession but something more noble not necessarily linked to a job.

 

Passion.

 

Creating a small videogame even just for personal pleasure could have represented in my heart one of those dreams that, if suffocated, can then turn into regret.

"So why not start studying?" I said to myself. After all, nowadays there are many resources that were not available at the time: online tutorials, free and paid courses, many books and reviews with which to find your way and, above all, development engines and free or low-cost graphics tools that are very powerful and that open the doors to anyone wishful to try.

 

It was all within my reach; but creating a video game requires different skills often delegated in a team to the most heterogeneous people: programming, music, sound effects, gameplay, design, graphics and animations for example.

And it is clear that in front of this mountain enthusiasm is immediately overwhelmed by a sea of ​​doubts.

 

"I will never have time to complete this endeavor" - I said to myself at times.

And here it is the biggest challenge, finally showing itself in all its crudeness. Even greater than the competence needed to carry out the project itself.

 

The crossroads that stood before me (and on which I still find myself) ask me whether to let go, and risk regret, or continue to dream one step at a time by investing time and energy in something that could never really take shape.

But with my feet on the verge of that crossroads, while I was looking for technical answers (and not of course) on the Internet and I came across numerous sites and forums of video game engines, populated surely even by competent people, no one mentioned that crossroads made of possible risks and regrets.

 

I then began to feel the need to take a step back. Before answering my personal crossroads I had to try to understand if I could respond to this need that I felt, for myself and maybe even for someone else.

 

Is it possible that others hear it?

 

Having a single virtual place that could represent a meeting point both for the exchange of skills, as impartial as possible and therefore without a "flag", but also a meeting point for the genuine exchange of ideas, advice, perplexities, disappointments, encouragement.

 

Why can't people united by the same passion during a complex and tortuous journey not travel at least part of it together? So what to do? A forum? A sort of wiki? A market? All these things?

"Is it worth adding on my shoulders a further project instead of investing time (and money) to create your game?" - I said to myself.

I had to answer this and other questions within myself.

I didn't know, and in some respects I don't know yet, whether this need for sharing is mine alone or not.

 

I like to think that other people were somehow waiting for something like this and in the meantime, with regards to my game, I'm still with my feet firmly planted on that fork and I often find myself asking a question.

 

Few details, but contrasted and fascinating:

Keep dreaming or wake up?
story_txt:
Assumptions of the project
The realization of a project and in particular of a videogame on an independent level poses technical and motivational difficulties that can overwhelm anyone.
Always in the balance between dream and regret, the journey towards the creation of a video game in my opinion needs sharing and motivation even more than the necessary skills.
The indieGo.xyz project (indie for independent game development, Go stay for start your project, don't give up and keep dreaming and xyz recalls to the three Cartesian axes foundation of the development of a video game) is born from the passion of a single person and wants to be a natural meeting point and a technical and motivational sharing point for anyone who embraces the dream of creating their own game, whether for passion or for work.

story:
Hello! My name is Timur, I am 32 years old, I live in Russia and I am a traveler. Look at my instagram, there I post pictures of my travels.
In Russia, a lot of space for travel. Imagine, to get from one end of Russia to another, you need to fly an airplane, 11-12 hours or 9 days to go by train!
And this time my friend and colleague conceived something very worthy, cool and unique - in September 2019 we will go on a trip to Kamchatka. And we need your help!

What we need and what you get

Friends, we really need your help. Travel is expenses. A trip to the edge of the world is a big expense. Only plane tickets will cost us almost $ 1,000. And if you looked at Google maps in Kamchatka, you will understand that this is a very inaccessible area.
But we are trained tourists and are able to implement such a project to tell the whole world how to repeat our journey. We have our own professional travel equipment, photo and video equipment, and we also invest at least $ 1,000 of our own funds, because we believe in what we do.
Our main expenses are movement on the territory of Kamchatka itself. This is very expensive, and we ask you to help us with this. We have prepared for you the coolest thanks: postcards made from photos of our trip, video greetings from the top of the volcano and much more.
No matter how much you can collect for us, we will add our own funds and still go to Kamchatka. But the more we get your support, the more interesting our journey will be, which means that we can take more photos, videos and podcasts that can help thousands of people like us.

Influence

On the Internet you can find many artistic photographs and films about the wildlife of Kamchatka. But there is almost no information on how to get there, what to see there, how to get to the sights, what to fear and how to make the trip as cheap as possible. Many practical questions and almost all of them are unanswered. But this is one of the most beautiful places on earth. Therefore, we want to rectify this situation and open the doors of Kamchatka for ordinary tourists. And with your help we will do it!

Other ways to help

If you cannot help us with money, you can still help us! Share this information on social networks, tell your friends, write words of support in the comments and the like. This will be very useful for us now and when we will be in Kamchatka. Thank you very much!

story:
NLP & EFT Practitioner Launches Life Coaching Clinic

NLP & EFT therapy expert is opening a brand new clinic in the UK. Clients will learn how to take control of their emotional state without dangerous drugs or costly therapy, in order to help everyday people change from ordinary and disillusioned to self-confident and looking to the future.

 

Did you know that 1 in 4 people suffer from Mental Health Problems in one form or another? Panic Attacks, Anorexia, Anxiety to name but a few are rearing their ugly heads and although today’s society is beginning to recognise this as a major problem, there are still not enough resources to help those in need.

Until Now

We all want a better life for our children. However, today’s youth are burdened. There are more Mental Health Problems amongst young people than ever before.

With Your Help, We Can Help Them.

Even those who are just looking to change their lot, but don’t know how.

 

The owner and founder of this company, Sue, has first-hand experience with the problems that so many of us face these days. About 5 years ago her daughter started suffering from Anorexia Nervosa. Feeling completely helpless and realizing there was a total lack of appropriate resources, Sue discovered NLP and EFT therapy. This not only helped her to cope, but gave her an understanding which enabled her to effectively help with her daughter's recovery.

Sue knew she had stumbled upon something special.

Neuro Linguistic Programming (popularized in large part by Tony Robbins) has been shown to help people have amazing breakthroughs. Under the right circumstances, we can help almost anyone improve their lives.

Therefore, Sue is going to start her very own clinic to help as many people as possible alongside creating coaching courses and workshops, writing a book and setting up a strong internet presence in order to help those further afield.

No matter how small the problem, NLP/Life Coaching can help to revitalize and bring back motivation and self-confidence in order to change attitudes for life.

It is well documented that the lack of funding in this area is causing Health Authorities the world over, major headaches.

We are therefore looking for funding of approximately £10,000 to not only get our operation up and running but also to put money into marketing and advertising our services along with the inevitable costs of producing books and courses.

Considering the Vastness of the Problem, This Amount will go Towards Making A Lasting Positive Change

People can struggle for years to make any kind of enduring change in their lives for the better.

Unfortunately, we are continually hearing about those suffering from Mental Health Problems. This not only affects their lives but the lives of those around them, which can also impact the futures of everyone involved.

What is it that separates the people who break through the emotional problems, (that surround us all) and those who fail?

The people who succeed have specific information and resources to make the lasting changes that so many people desire.

We can help people change their lives no matter how big or small the problem. Whether you just want to quit smoking or you need psychological help but cannot find/afford the resources. When you work with us, you can practically “steal” our favorite techniques for lasting life improvement.

We have an opportunity before us, that should NOT be WASTED. With your help, we can build a better future, not only for those of us already trying to cope, but for our children who need to learn to create the desire for a prosperous and peaceful future without the anxiety that they are now dealing with.

Thank You For Supporting Us!

Every single donation brings us that much closer to turning our dream into a reality. Our business will shed a beam of positivity and hope to many people in our community and beyond.

If you feel unable to contribute at this time, we would be grateful if you could share this opportunity with everyone you know, using the tools below.

We’re so lucky to live in a time where we can support one another – all at the click of a button.

We appreciate your generous support. Just $/£ 1.00 could change someone’s future.

Until Next Time,

Sue & Family

P.S. Making a lasting change doesn’t have to be a difficult and tiresome process anymore, we’ll help you step by step to make that change. We’re here for you.

P.P.S. If we are lucky enough to reach beyond our target of £10,000, all extra proceeds will be put towards the charity BEAT that deals with Mental Health issues.

story:
Hi, my name is Bradley. I am 22 years old, I live in Ukraine, Lviv. I graduated from the University, Faculty of Geography. I working in an administrative office now.

And here is my story ....

Since childhood, I have been trying to do something new, interesting and unusual. Of course, I have seen things that can be improved or seen at a different angle. Sometimes I competed in building castles from the sand, and although at first it looked strange, but other children were involved with me and it turned out to be very nice.
 

Later I grew up and realized that I love people, the camera and communicate. Sometimes my friends can not "close my mouth." I love talking and thinking about interesting topics, discussion issues and philosophical problems.

And, recently, I realized that I want to take a video, be a blogger, tell and show you what I know, what I know, what I do and hear your feedbacks. But I want to be a good blogger who shows useful or interesting things, not just watching and curling into the camera. To be a "good" blogger, I need to take high-quality videos ... and this is a problem, this is why I have to ask you to help me.

(If you are tired of the text, here are some videos. And if you want to read more and see my projects - under the video will be another text)

 


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Here is a short picture that illustrates my goals. More text below.

Are you still here? Oh, I'm surprised. Well, here are some more interesting things.


The projects I've been doing before. You can check this link. Some of them were taken on video, some on the photo, and some are not at all. They are, unfortunately, in Ukrainian, but still ok. 

  • Cleaning in Сarpathian    https://goo.gl/2vC27d
  • Short blog about my work https://youtu.be/vwPS-TZ9Dyk
  • BBQ with English Club https://youtu.be/W1IO-cNSDPA
  • Street food festival           https://goo.gl/uEKms1
  • 2 days bike trip with tent and camping  https://goo.gl/b6i8Kz
  • Popular non alcohol festival https://goo.gl/rsPCkp
  • Bike trip to awesome rocks https://goo.gl/1Fx9WN
  • Pizza party at our English Club https://goo.gl/4Uny42

and much more...

 

TO BE CONTINUED...check updates.

 


P.S Please, share this campaign as much as you can!
